module Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.MonitoredResourceInfo

-- | Describes resource being monitored by an alarm.
--   
--   An alarm is a way to monitor your Amazon Lightsail resource metrics.
--   For more information, see <a>Alarms in Amazon Lightsail</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMonitoredResourceInfo</a> smart constructor.
data MonitoredResourceInfo
MonitoredResourceInfo' :: Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> MonitoredResourceInfo

-- | The Lightsail resource type of the resource being monitored.
--   
--   Instances, load balancers, and relational databases are the only
--   Lightsail resources that can currently be monitored by alarms.
[$sel:resourceType:MonitoredResourceInfo'] :: MonitoredResourceInfo -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource being monitored.
[$sel:arn:MonitoredResourceInfo'] :: MonitoredResourceInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the Lightsail resource being monitored.
[$sel:name:MonitoredResourceInfo'] :: MonitoredResourceInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MonitoredResourceInfo</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:MonitoredResourceInfo'</a>,
--   <a>monitoredResourceInfo_resourceType</a> - The Lightsail resource
--   type of the resource being monitored.
--   
--   Instances, load balancers, and relational databases are the only
--   Lightsail resources that can currently be monitored by alarms.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:MonitoredResourceInfo'</a>,
--   <a>monitoredResourceInfo_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the resource being monitored.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:MonitoredResourceInfo'</a>,
--   <a>monitoredResourceInfo_name</a> - The name of the Lightsail resource
--   being monitored.
newMonitoredResourceInfo :: MonitoredResourceInfo

-- | The Lightsail resource type of the resource being monitored.
--   
--   Instances, load balancers, and relational databases are the only
--   Lightsail resources that can currently be monitored by alarms.
monitoredResourceInfo_resourceType :: Lens' MonitoredResourceInfo (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource being monitored.
monitoredResourceInfo_arn :: Lens' MonitoredResourceInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the Lightsail resource being monitored.
monitoredResourceInfo_name :: Lens' MonitoredResourceInfo (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.MonitoredResourceInfo.MonitoredResourceInfo
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.MonitoredResourceInfo.MonitoredResourceInfo
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.MonitoredResourceInfo.MonitoredResourceInfo

module Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.ContactMethod

-- | Describes a contact method.
--   
--   A contact method is a way to send you notifications. For more
--   information, see <a>Notifications in Amazon Lightsail</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContactMethod</a> smart constructor.
data ContactMethod
ContactMethod' :: Maybe ContactMethodStatus -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe ContactProtocol -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ContactMethod

-- | The current status of the contact method.
--   
--   A contact method has the following possible status:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PendingVerification</tt> - The contact method has not yet been
--   verified, and the verification has not yet expired.</li>
--   <li><tt>Valid</tt> - The contact method has been verified.</li>
--   <li><tt>InValid</tt> - An attempt was made to verify the contact
--   method, but the verification has expired.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:ContactMethod'] :: ContactMethod -> Maybe ContactMethodStatus

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>ContactMethod</tt>).
[$sel:resourceType:ContactMethod'] :: ContactMethod -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact method.
[$sel:arn:ContactMethod'] :: ContactMethod -> Maybe Text

-- | The timestamp when the contact method was created.
[$sel:createdAt:ContactMethod'] :: ContactMethod -> Maybe POSIX
[$sel:location:ContactMethod'] :: ContactMethod -> Maybe ResourceLocation

-- | The protocol of the contact method, such as email or SMS (text
--   messaging).
[$sel:protocol:ContactMethod'] :: ContactMethod -> Maybe ContactProtocol

-- | The name of the contact method.
[$sel:name:ContactMethod'] :: ContactMethod -> Maybe Text

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about your Lightsail contact method. This code enables
--   our support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.
[$sel:supportCode:ContactMethod'] :: ContactMethod -> Maybe Text

-- | The destination of the contact method, such as an email address or a
--   mobile phone number.
[$sel:contactEndpoint:ContactMethod'] :: ContactMethod -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ContactMethod</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ContactMethod'</a>, <a>contactMethod_status</a> - The
--   current status of the contact method.
--   
--   A contact method has the following possible status:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PendingVerification</tt> - The contact method has not yet been
--   verified, and the verification has not yet expired.</li>
--   <li><tt>Valid</tt> - The contact method has been verified.</li>
--   <li><tt>InValid</tt> - An attempt was made to verify the contact
--   method, but the verification has expired.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:ContactMethod'</a>,
--   <a>contactMethod_resourceType</a> - The Lightsail resource type (e.g.,
--   <tt>ContactMethod</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:ContactMethod'</a>, <a>contactMethod_arn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the contact method.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:ContactMethod'</a>, <a>contactMethod_createdAt</a> -
--   The timestamp when the contact method was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:ContactMethod'</a>, <a>contactMethod_location</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protocol:ContactMethod'</a>, <a>contactMethod_protocol</a> -
--   The protocol of the contact method, such as email or SMS (text
--   messaging).
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ContactMethod'</a>, <a>contactMethod_name</a> - The name
--   of the contact method.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportCode:ContactMethod'</a>,
--   <a>contactMethod_supportCode</a> - The support code. Include this code
--   in your email to support when you have questions about your Lightsail
--   contact method. This code enables our support team to look up your
--   Lightsail information more easily.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactEndpoint:ContactMethod'</a>,
--   <a>contactMethod_contactEndpoint</a> - The destination of the contact
--   method, such as an email address or a mobile phone number.
newContactMethod :: ContactMethod

-- | The current status of the contact method.
--   
--   A contact method has the following possible status:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PendingVerification</tt> - The contact method has not yet been
--   verified, and the verification has not yet expired.</li>
--   <li><tt>Valid</tt> - The contact method has been verified.</li>
--   <li><tt>InValid</tt> - An attempt was made to verify the contact
--   method, but the verification has expired.</li>
--   </ul>

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>ContactMethod</tt>).
contactMethod_resourceType :: Lens' ContactMethod (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact method.
contactMethod_arn :: Lens' ContactMethod (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when the contact method was created.
contactMethod_createdAt :: Lens' ContactMethod (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Undocumented member.
contactMethod_location :: Lens' ContactMethod (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | The protocol of the contact method, such as email or SMS (text
--   messaging).

-- | The name of the contact method.

--   have questions about your Lightsail contact method. This code enables
--   our support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.

--   mobile phone number.
contactMethod_contactEndpoint :: Lens' ContactMethod (Maybe Text)

module Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.CloudFormationStackRecord

-- | Describes a CloudFormation stack record created as a result of the
--   <tt>create cloud formation stack</tt> action.
--   
--   A CloudFormation stack record provides information about the AWS
--   CloudFormation stack used to create a new Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud
--   instance from an exported Lightsail instance snapshot.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudFormationStackRecord</a> smart constructor.
data CloudFormationStackRecord
CloudFormationStackRecord' :: Maybe RecordState -> Maybe DestinationInfo -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo] -> CloudFormationStackRecord

-- | The current state of the CloudFormation stack record.
[$sel:state:CloudFormationStackRecord'] :: CloudFormationStackRecord -> Maybe RecordState

-- | A list of objects describing the destination service, which is AWS
--   CloudFormation, and the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS
--   CloudFormation stack.
[$sel:destinationInfo:CloudFormationStackRecord'] :: CloudFormationStackRecord -> Maybe DestinationInfo

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g.,
--   <tt>CloudFormationStackRecord</tt>).
[$sel:resourceType:CloudFormationStackRecord'] :: CloudFormationStackRecord -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CloudFormation stack record.
[$sel:arn:CloudFormationStackRecord'] :: CloudFormationStackRecord -> Maybe Text

-- | The date when the CloudFormation stack record was created.
[$sel:createdAt:CloudFormationStackRecord'] :: CloudFormationStackRecord -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A list of objects describing the Availability Zone and AWS Region of
--   the CloudFormation stack record.
[$sel:location:CloudFormationStackRecord'] :: CloudFormationStackRecord -> Maybe ResourceLocation

-- | The name of the CloudFormation stack record. It starts with
--   <tt>CloudFormationStackRecord</tt> followed by a GUID.
[$sel:name:CloudFormationStackRecord'] :: CloudFormationStackRecord -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of objects describing the source of the CloudFormation stack
--   record.
[$sel:sourceInfo:CloudFormationStackRecord'] :: CloudFormationStackRecord -> Maybe [CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo]

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudFormationStackRecord</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:CloudFormationStackRecord'</a>,
--   <a>cloudFormationStackRecord_state</a> - The current state of the
--   CloudFormation stack record.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationInfo:CloudFormationStackRecord'</a>,
--   <a>cloudFormationStackRecord_destinationInfo</a> - A list of objects
--   describing the destination service, which is AWS CloudFormation, and
--   the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS CloudFormation stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:CloudFormationStackRecord'</a>,
--   <a>cloudFormationStackRecord_resourceType</a> - The Lightsail resource
--   type (e.g., <tt>CloudFormationStackRecord</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:CloudFormationStackRecord'</a>,
--   <a>cloudFormationStackRecord_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the CloudFormation stack record.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:CloudFormationStackRecord'</a>,
--   <a>cloudFormationStackRecord_createdAt</a> - The date when the
--   CloudFormation stack record was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:CloudFormationStackRecord'</a>,
--   <a>cloudFormationStackRecord_location</a> - A list of objects
--   describing the Availability Zone and AWS Region of the CloudFormation
--   stack record.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CloudFormationStackRecord'</a>,
--   <a>cloudFormationStackRecord_name</a> - The name of the CloudFormation
--   stack record. It starts with <tt>CloudFormationStackRecord</tt>
--   followed by a GUID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceInfo:CloudFormationStackRecord'</a>,
--   <a>cloudFormationStackRecord_sourceInfo</a> - A list of objects
--   describing the source of the CloudFormation stack record.
newCloudFormationStackRecord :: CloudFormationStackRecord

-- | The current state of the CloudFormation stack record.
cloudFormationStackRecord_state :: Lens' CloudFormationStackRecord (Maybe RecordState)

-- | A list of objects describing the destination service, which is AWS
--   CloudFormation, and the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS
--   CloudFormation stack.
cloudFormationStackRecord_destinationInfo :: Lens' CloudFormationStackRecord (Maybe DestinationInfo)

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g.,
--   <tt>CloudFormationStackRecord</tt>).
cloudFormationStackRecord_resourceType :: Lens' CloudFormationStackRecord (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CloudFormation stack record.
cloudFormationStackRecord_arn :: Lens' CloudFormationStackRecord (Maybe Text)

-- | The date when the CloudFormation stack record was created.
cloudFormationStackRecord_createdAt :: Lens' CloudFormationStackRecord (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A list of objects describing the Availability Zone and AWS Region of
--   the CloudFormation stack record.
cloudFormationStackRecord_location :: Lens' CloudFormationStackRecord (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | The name of the CloudFormation stack record. It starts with
--   <tt>CloudFormationStackRecord</tt> followed by a GUID.
cloudFormationStackRecord_name :: Lens' CloudFormationStackRecord (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of objects describing the source of the CloudFormation stack
--   record.
cloudFormationStackRecord_sourceInfo :: Lens' CloudFormationStackRecord (Maybe [CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo])

module Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.StaticIp

-- | Describes a static IP.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStaticIp</a> smart constructor.
data StaticIp
StaticIp' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> StaticIp

-- | The static IP address.
[$sel:ipAddress:StaticIp'] :: StaticIp -> Maybe Text

-- | The resource type (usually <tt>StaticIp</tt>).
[$sel:resourceType:StaticIp'] :: StaticIp -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the static IP (e.g.,
--   <tt>arn:aws:lightsail:us-east-2:123456789101:StaticIp/9cbb4a9e-f8e3-4dfe-b57e-12345EXAMPLE</tt>).
[$sel:arn:StaticIp'] :: StaticIp -> Maybe Text

-- | The timestamp when the static IP was created (e.g.,
--   <tt>1479735304.222</tt>).
[$sel:createdAt:StaticIp'] :: StaticIp -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The region and Availability Zone where the static IP was created.
[$sel:location:StaticIp'] :: StaticIp -> Maybe ResourceLocation

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the static IP is attached.
[$sel:isAttached:StaticIp'] :: StaticIp -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the static IP (e.g., <tt>StaticIP-Ohio-EXAMPLE</tt>).
[$sel:name:StaticIp'] :: StaticIp -> Maybe Text

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.
--   This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail
--   information more easily.
[$sel:supportCode:StaticIp'] :: StaticIp -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance where the static IP is attached (e.g.,
--   <tt>Amazon_Linux-1GB-Ohio-1</tt>).
[$sel:attachedTo:StaticIp'] :: StaticIp -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StaticIp</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipAddress:StaticIp'</a>, <a>staticIp_ipAddress</a> - The
--   static IP address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:StaticIp'</a>, <a>staticIp_resourceType</a> - The
--   resource type (usually <tt>StaticIp</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:StaticIp'</a>, <a>staticIp_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the static IP (e.g.,
--   <tt>arn:aws:lightsail:us-east-2:123456789101:StaticIp/9cbb4a9e-f8e3-4dfe-b57e-12345EXAMPLE</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:StaticIp'</a>, <a>staticIp_createdAt</a> - The
--   timestamp when the static IP was created (e.g.,
--   <tt>1479735304.222</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:StaticIp'</a>, <a>staticIp_location</a> - The region
--   and Availability Zone where the static IP was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isAttached:StaticIp'</a>, <a>staticIp_isAttached</a> - A
--   Boolean value indicating whether the static IP is attached.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:StaticIp'</a>, <a>staticIp_name</a> - The name of the
--   static IP (e.g., <tt>StaticIP-Ohio-EXAMPLE</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportCode:StaticIp'</a>, <a>staticIp_supportCode</a> - The
--   support code. Include this code in your email to support when you have
--   questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail. This
--   code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail information
--   more easily.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attachedTo:StaticIp'</a>, <a>staticIp_attachedTo</a> - The
--   instance where the static IP is attached (e.g.,
--   <tt>Amazon_Linux-1GB-Ohio-1</tt>).
newStaticIp :: StaticIp

-- | The static IP address.
staticIp_ipAddress :: Lens' StaticIp (Maybe Text)

-- | The resource type (usually <tt>StaticIp</tt>).
staticIp_resourceType :: Lens' StaticIp (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the static IP (e.g.,
--   <tt>arn:aws:lightsail:us-east-2:123456789101:StaticIp/9cbb4a9e-f8e3-4dfe-b57e-12345EXAMPLE</tt>).
staticIp_arn :: Lens' StaticIp (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when the static IP was created (e.g.,
--   <tt>1479735304.222</tt>).
staticIp_createdAt :: Lens' StaticIp (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The region and Availability Zone where the static IP was created.
staticIp_location :: Lens' StaticIp (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the static IP is attached.
staticIp_isAttached :: Lens' StaticIp (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the static IP (e.g., <tt>StaticIP-Ohio-EXAMPLE</tt>).
staticIp_name :: Lens' StaticIp (Maybe Text)

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.
--   This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail
--   information more easily.
staticIp_supportCode :: Lens' StaticIp (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance where the static IP is attached (e.g.,
--   <tt>Amazon_Linux-1GB-Ohio-1</tt>).
staticIp_attachedTo :: Lens' StaticIp (Maybe Text)

module Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.AccessKey

-- | Describes an access key for an Amazon Lightsail bucket.
--   
--   Access keys grant full programmatic access to the specified bucket and
--   its objects. You can have a maximum of two access keys per bucket. Use
--   the CreateBucketAccessKey action to create an access key for a
--   specific bucket. For more information about access keys, see
--   <a>Creating access keys for a bucket in Amazon Lightsail</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   The <tt>secretAccessKey</tt> value is returned only in response to the
--   <tt>CreateBucketAccessKey</tt> action. You can get a secret access key
--   only when you first create an access key; you cannot get the secret
--   access key later. If you lose the secret access key, you must create a
--   new access key.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccessKey</a> smart constructor.
data AccessKey
AccessKey' :: Maybe StatusType -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AccessKeyLastUsed -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> AccessKey

-- | The status of the access key.
--   
--   A status of <tt>Active</tt> means that the key is valid, while
--   <tt>Inactive</tt> means it is not.
[$sel:status:AccessKey'] :: AccessKey -> Maybe StatusType

-- | The timestamp when the access key was created.
[$sel:createdAt:AccessKey'] :: AccessKey -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The secret access key used to sign requests.
--   
--   You should store the secret access key in a safe location. We
--   recommend that you delete the access key if the secret access key is
--   compromised.
[$sel:secretAccessKey:AccessKey'] :: AccessKey -> Maybe Text

-- | An object that describes the last time the access key was used.
--   
--   This object does not include data in the response of a
--   CreateBucketAccessKey action. If the access key has not been used, the
--   <tt>region</tt> and <tt>serviceName</tt> values are <tt>N/A</tt>, and
--   the <tt>lastUsedDate</tt> value is null.
[$sel:lastUsed:AccessKey'] :: AccessKey -> Maybe AccessKeyLastUsed

-- | The ID of the access key.
[$sel:accessKeyId:AccessKey'] :: AccessKey -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>AccessKey</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:AccessKey'</a>, <a>accessKey_status</a> - The status of
--   the access key.
--   
--   A status of <tt>Active</tt> means that the key is valid, while
--   <tt>Inactive</tt> means it is not.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:AccessKey'</a>, <a>accessKey_createdAt</a> - The
--   timestamp when the access key was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretAccessKey:AccessKey'</a>,
--   <a>accessKey_secretAccessKey</a> - The secret access key used to sign
--   requests.
--   
--   You should store the secret access key in a safe location. We
--   recommend that you delete the access key if the secret access key is
--   compromised.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUsed:AccessKey'</a>, <a>accessKey_lastUsed</a> - An object
--   that describes the last time the access key was used.
--   
--   This object does not include data in the response of a
--   CreateBucketAccessKey action. If the access key has not been used, the
--   <tt>region</tt> and <tt>serviceName</tt> values are <tt>N/A</tt>, and
--   the <tt>lastUsedDate</tt> value is null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessKeyId:AccessKey'</a>, <a>accessKey_accessKeyId</a> - The
--   ID of the access key.
newAccessKey :: AccessKey

-- | The status of the access key.
--   
--   A status of <tt>Active</tt> means that the key is valid, while
--   <tt>Inactive</tt> means it is not.
accessKey_status :: Lens' AccessKey (Maybe StatusType)

-- | The timestamp when the access key was created.
accessKey_createdAt :: Lens' AccessKey (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The secret access key used to sign requests.
--   
--   You should store the secret access key in a safe location. We
--   recommend that you delete the access key if the secret access key is
--   compromised.
accessKey_secretAccessKey :: Lens' AccessKey (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that describes the last time the access key was used.
--   
--   This object does not include data in the response of a
--   CreateBucketAccessKey action. If the access key has not been used, the
--   <tt>region</tt> and <tt>serviceName</tt> values are <tt>N/A</tt>, and
--   the <tt>lastUsedDate</tt> value is null.
accessKey_lastUsed :: Lens' AccessKey (Maybe AccessKeyLastUsed)

-- | The ID of the access key.
accessKey_accessKeyId :: Lens' AccessKey (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.AccessKey.AccessKey
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.AccessKey.AccessKey
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.AccessKey.AccessKey
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.AccessKey.AccessKey
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.AccessKey.AccessKey
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.AccessKey.AccessKey


module Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.Tag

-- | Describes a tag key and optional value assigned to an Amazon Lightsail
--   resource.
--   
--   For more information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon
--   Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Tag

-- | The value of the tag.
--   
--   Constraints: Tag values accept a maximum of 256 letters, numbers,
--   spaces in UTF-8, or the following characters: + - = . _ : / @
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Maybe Text

-- | The key of the tag.
--   
--   Constraints: Tag keys accept a maximum of 128 letters, numbers, spaces
--   in UTF-8, or the following characters: + - = . _ : / @
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - The value of the tag.
--   
--   Constraints: Tag values accept a maximum of 256 letters, numbers,
--   spaces in UTF-8, or the following characters: + - = . _ : / @
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - The key of the tag.
--   
--   Constraints: Tag keys accept a maximum of 128 letters, numbers, spaces
--   in UTF-8, or the following characters: + - = . _ : / @
newTag :: Tag

-- | The value of the tag.
--   
--   Constraints: Tag values accept a maximum of 256 letters, numbers,
--   spaces in UTF-8, or the following characters: + - = . _ : / @
tag_value :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | The key of the tag.
--   
--   Constraints: Tag keys accept a maximum of 128 letters, numbers, spaces
--   in UTF-8, or the following characters: + - = . _ : / @
tag_key :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.Tag.Tag


module Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.RelationalDatabaseSnapshot

-- | Describes a database snapshot.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRelationalDatabaseSnapshot</a> smart constructor.
data RelationalDatabaseSnapshot
RelationalDatabaseSnapshot' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> RelationalDatabaseSnapshot

-- | The database engine version for the database snapshot (for example,
--   <tt>5.7.23</tt>).
[$sel:engineVersion:RelationalDatabaseSnapshot'] :: RelationalDatabaseSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The state of the database snapshot.
[$sel:state:RelationalDatabaseSnapshot'] :: RelationalDatabaseSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the source database from which the database snapshot was
--   created.
[$sel:fromRelationalDatabaseName:RelationalDatabaseSnapshot'] :: RelationalDatabaseSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The Lightsail resource type.
[$sel:resourceType:RelationalDatabaseSnapshot'] :: RelationalDatabaseSnapshot -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | The blueprint ID of the database from which the database snapshot was
--   created. A blueprint describes the major engine version of a database.
[$sel:fromRelationalDatabaseBlueprintId:RelationalDatabaseSnapshot'] :: RelationalDatabaseSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the database snapshot.
[$sel:arn:RelationalDatabaseSnapshot'] :: RelationalDatabaseSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The timestamp when the database snapshot was created.
[$sel:createdAt:RelationalDatabaseSnapshot'] :: RelationalDatabaseSnapshot -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Region name and Availability Zone where the database snapshot is
--   located.
[$sel:location:RelationalDatabaseSnapshot'] :: RelationalDatabaseSnapshot -> Maybe ResourceLocation

-- | The software of the database snapshot (for example, <tt>MySQL</tt>)
[$sel:engine:RelationalDatabaseSnapshot'] :: RelationalDatabaseSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the database snapshot.
[$sel:name:RelationalDatabaseSnapshot'] :: RelationalDatabaseSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The size of the disk in GB (for example, <tt>32</tt>) for the database
--   snapshot.
[$sel:sizeInGb:RelationalDatabaseSnapshot'] :: RelationalDatabaseSnapshot -> Maybe Int

-- | The support code for the database snapshot. Include this code in your
--   email to support when you have questions about a database snapshot in
--   Lightsail. This code enables our support team to look up your
--   Lightsail information more easily.
[$sel:supportCode:RelationalDatabaseSnapshot'] :: RelationalDatabaseSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the database from which the database
--   snapshot was created.
[$sel:fromRelationalDatabaseArn:RelationalDatabaseSnapshot'] :: RelationalDatabaseSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The bundle ID of the database from which the database snapshot was
--   created.
[$sel:fromRelationalDatabaseBundleId:RelationalDatabaseSnapshot'] :: RelationalDatabaseSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:tags:RelationalDatabaseSnapshot'] :: RelationalDatabaseSnapshot -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>RelationalDatabaseSnapshot</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   easily.

--   <a>relationalDatabaseSnapshot_fromRelationalDatabaseArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the database from which the database
--   snapshot was created.

--   created.

--   see the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.

module Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.RelationalDatabase

-- | Describes a database.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRelationalDatabase</a> smart constructor.
data RelationalDatabase
RelationalDatabase' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RelationalDatabaseEndpoint -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [PendingMaintenanceAction] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe PendingModifiedRelationalDatabaseValues -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RelationalDatabaseHardware -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> RelationalDatabase

-- | The database engine version (for example, <tt>5.7.23</tt>).
[$sel:engineVersion:RelationalDatabase'] :: RelationalDatabase -> Maybe Text

-- | The bundle ID for the database. A bundle describes the performance
--   specifications for your database.
[$sel:relationalDatabaseBundleId:RelationalDatabase'] :: RelationalDatabase -> Maybe Text

-- | The master endpoint for the database.
[$sel:masterEndpoint:RelationalDatabase'] :: RelationalDatabase -> Maybe RelationalDatabaseEndpoint

-- | Describes the current state of the database.
[$sel:state:RelationalDatabase'] :: RelationalDatabase -> Maybe Text

-- | The Lightsail resource type for the database (for example,
--   <tt>RelationalDatabase</tt>).
[$sel:resourceType:RelationalDatabase'] :: RelationalDatabase -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the database is publicly
--   accessible.
[$sel:publiclyAccessible:RelationalDatabase'] :: RelationalDatabase -> Maybe Bool

-- | The master user name of the database.
[$sel:masterUsername:RelationalDatabase'] :: RelationalDatabase -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the database.
[$sel:arn:RelationalDatabase'] :: RelationalDatabase -> Maybe Text

-- | The timestamp when the database was created. Formatted in Unix time.
[$sel:createdAt:RelationalDatabase'] :: RelationalDatabase -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Region name and Availability Zone where the database is located.
[$sel:location:RelationalDatabase'] :: RelationalDatabase -> Maybe ResourceLocation

-- | The database software (for example, <tt>MySQL</tt>).
[$sel:engine:RelationalDatabase'] :: RelationalDatabase -> Maybe Text

-- | The latest point in time to which the database can be restored.
--   Formatted in Unix time.
[$sel:latestRestorableTime:RelationalDatabase'] :: RelationalDatabase -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The weekly time range during which system maintenance can occur on the
--   database.
--   
--   In the format <tt>ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi</tt>. For example,
--   <tt>Tue:17:00-Tue:17:30</tt>.
[$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:RelationalDatabase'] :: RelationalDatabase -> Maybe Text

-- | The blueprint ID for the database. A blueprint describes the major
--   engine version of a database.
[$sel:relationalDatabaseBlueprintId:RelationalDatabase'] :: RelationalDatabase -> Maybe Text

-- | The certificate associated with the database.
[$sel:caCertificateIdentifier:RelationalDatabase'] :: RelationalDatabase -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique name of the database resource in Lightsail.
[$sel:name:RelationalDatabase'] :: RelationalDatabase -> Maybe Text

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether automated backup retention is
--   enabled for the database.
[$sel:backupRetentionEnabled:RelationalDatabase'] :: RelationalDatabase -> Maybe Bool

-- | The daily time range during which automated backups are created for
--   the database (for example, <tt>16:00-16:30</tt>).
[$sel:preferredBackupWindow:RelationalDatabase'] :: RelationalDatabase -> Maybe Text

-- | Describes the pending maintenance actions for the database.
[$sel:pendingMaintenanceActions:RelationalDatabase'] :: RelationalDatabase -> Maybe [PendingMaintenanceAction]

-- | The support code for the database. Include this code in your email to
--   support when you have questions about a database in Lightsail. This
--   code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail information
--   more easily.
[$sel:supportCode:RelationalDatabase'] :: RelationalDatabase -> Maybe Text

-- | Describes the secondary Availability Zone of a high availability
--   database.
--   
--   The secondary database is used for failover support of a high
--   availability database.
[$sel:secondaryAvailabilityZone:RelationalDatabase'] :: RelationalDatabase -> Maybe Text

-- | Describes pending database value modifications.
[$sel:pendingModifiedValues:RelationalDatabase'] :: RelationalDatabase -> Maybe PendingModifiedRelationalDatabaseValues

-- | The name of the master database created when the Lightsail database
--   resource is created.
[$sel:masterDatabaseName:RelationalDatabase'] :: RelationalDatabase -> Maybe Text

-- | Describes the hardware of the database.
[$sel:hardware:RelationalDatabase'] :: RelationalDatabase -> Maybe RelationalDatabaseHardware

-- | The status of parameter updates for the database.
[$sel:parameterApplyStatus:RelationalDatabase'] :: RelationalDatabase -> Maybe Text

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:tags:RelationalDatabase'] :: RelationalDatabase -> Maybe [Tag]

--   indicating whether automated backup retention is enabled for the
--   database.

--   <a>$sel:preferredBackupWindow:RelationalDatabase'</a>,
--   <a>relationalDatabase_preferredBackupWindow</a> - The daily time range

module Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.LoadBalancerTlsCertificate

-- | Describes a load balancer SSL/TLS certificate.
--   
--   TLS is just an updated, more secure version of Secure Socket Layer
--   (SSL).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoadBalancerTlsCertificate</a> smart constructor.
data LoadBalancerTlsCertificate
LoadBalancerTlsCertificate' :: Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateFailureReason -> Maybe Text -> Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateStatus -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRevocationReason -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord] -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe POSIX -> LoadBalancerTlsCertificate

-- | The validation failure reason, if any, of the certificate.
--   
--   The following failure reasons are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>NO_AVAILABLE_CONTACTS</tt></b> - This failure applies to
--   email validation, which is not available for Lightsail
--   certificates.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>ADDITIONAL_VERIFICATION_REQUIRED</tt></b> - Lightsail
--   requires additional information to process this certificate request.
--   This can happen as a fraud-protection measure, such as when the domain
--   ranks within the Alexa top 1000 websites. To provide the required
--   information, use the <a>AWS Support Center</a> to contact AWS
--   Support.You cannot request a certificate for Amazon-owned domain names
--   such as those ending in amazonaws.com, cloudfront.net, or
--   elasticbeanstalk.com.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>DOMAIN_NOT_ALLOWED</tt></b> - One or more of the domain
--   names in the certificate request was reported as an unsafe domain by
--   <a>VirusTotal</a>. To correct the problem, search for your domain name
--   on the <a>VirusTotal</a> website. If your domain is reported as
--   suspicious, see <a>Google Help for Hacked Websites</a> to learn what
--   you can do.If you believe that the result is a false positive, notify
--   the organization that is reporting the domain. VirusTotal is an
--   aggregate of several antivirus and URL scanners and cannot remove your
--   domain from a block list itself. After you correct the problem and the
--   VirusTotal registry has been updated, request a new certificate.If you
--   see this error and your domain is not included in the VirusTotal list,
--   visit the <a>AWS Support Center</a> and create a case.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>INVALID_PUBLIC_DOMAIN</tt></b> - One or more of the domain
--   names in the certificate request is not valid. Typically, this is
--   because a domain name in the request is not a valid top-level domain.
--   Try to request a certificate again, correcting any spelling errors or
--   typos that were in the failed request, and ensure that all domain
--   names in the request are for valid top-level domains. For example, you
--   cannot request a certificate for <tt>example.invalidpublicdomain</tt>
--   because <tt>invalidpublicdomain</tt> is not a valid top-level
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>OTHER</tt></b> - Typically, this failure occurs when there
--   is a typographical error in one or more of the domain names in the
--   certificate request. Try to request a certificate again, correcting
--   any spelling errors or typos that were in the failed request.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:failureReason:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateFailureReason

-- | The name of the entity that is associated with the public key
--   contained in the certificate.
[$sel:subject:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The validation status of the SSL/TLS certificate. Valid values are
--   below.
[$sel:status:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateStatus

-- | An array of strings that specify the alternate domains (e.g.,
--   <tt>example2.com</tt>) and subdomains (e.g.,
--   <tt>blog.example.com</tt>) for the certificate.
[$sel:subjectAlternativeNames:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The resource type (e.g., <tt>LoadBalancerTlsCertificate</tt>).
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance</tt></b> - A Lightsail instance (a virtual private
--   server)</li>
--   <li><b><tt>StaticIp</tt></b> - A static IP address</li>
--   <li><b><tt>KeyPair</tt></b> - The key pair used to connect to a
--   Lightsail instance</li>
--   <li><b><tt>InstanceSnapshot</tt></b> - A Lightsail instance
--   snapshot</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Domain</tt></b> - A DNS zone</li>
--   <li><b><tt>PeeredVpc</tt></b> - A peered VPC</li>
--   <li><b><tt>LoadBalancer</tt></b> - A Lightsail load balancer</li>
--   <li><b><tt>LoadBalancerTlsCertificate</tt></b> - An SSL/TLS
--   certificate associated with a Lightsail load balancer</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Disk</tt></b> - A Lightsail block storage disk</li>
--   <li><b><tt>DiskSnapshot</tt></b> - A block storage disk snapshot</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:resourceType:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SSL/TLS certificate.
[$sel:arn:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The time when you created your SSL/TLS certificate.
[$sel:createdAt:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The AWS Region and Availability Zone where you created your
--   certificate.
[$sel:location:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe ResourceLocation

-- | The load balancer name where your SSL/TLS certificate is attached.
[$sel:loadBalancerName:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The serial number of the certificate.
[$sel:serial:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | When <tt>true</tt>, the SSL/TLS certificate is attached to the
--   Lightsail load balancer.
[$sel:isAttached:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe Bool

-- | The timestamp when the certificate was revoked. This value is present
--   only when the certificate status is <tt>REVOKED</tt>.
[$sel:revokedAt:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The timestamp when the SSL/TLS certificate is first valid.
[$sel:notBefore:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The reason the certificate was revoked. This value is present only
--   when the certificate status is <tt>REVOKED</tt>.
[$sel:revocationReason:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRevocationReason

-- | The domain name for your SSL/TLS certificate.
[$sel:domainName:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the SSL/TLS certificate (e.g., <tt>my-certificate</tt>).
[$sel:name:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | An object that describes the status of the certificate renewal managed
--   by Lightsail.
[$sel:renewalSummary:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about your Lightsail load balancer or SSL/TLS
--   certificate. This code enables our support team to look up your
--   Lightsail information more easily.
[$sel:supportCode:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord objects
--   describing the records.
[$sel:domainValidationRecords:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe [LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord]

-- | The time when the SSL/TLS certificate was issued.
[$sel:issuedAt:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The algorithm used to generate the key pair (the public and private
--   key).
[$sel:keyAlgorithm:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The algorithm that was used to sign the certificate.
[$sel:signatureAlgorithm:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The issuer of the certificate.
[$sel:issuer:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:tags:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The timestamp when the SSL/TLS certificate expires.
[$sel:notAfter:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>LoadBalancerTlsCertificate</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureReason:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_failureReason</a> - The validation
--   failure reason, if any, of the certificate.
--   
--   The following failure reasons are possible:
--

--   you can do.If you believe that the result is a false positive, notify
--   the organization that is reporting the domain. VirusTotal is an
--   aggregate of several antivirus and URL scanners and cannot remove your

--   VirusTotal registry has been updated, request a new certificate.If you

--   of strings that specify the alternate domains (e.g.,
--   <tt>example2.com</tt>) and subdomains (e.g.,
--   <tt>blog.example.com</tt>) for the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_resourceType</a> - The resource type
--   (e.g., <tt>LoadBalancerTlsCertificate</tt>).
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance</tt></b> - A Lightsail instance (a virtual private
--   server)</li>
--   <li><b><tt>StaticIp</tt></b> - A static IP address</li>
--   <li><b><tt>KeyPair</tt></b> - The key pair used to connect to a
--   Lightsail instance</li>
--   <li><b><tt>InstanceSnapshot</tt></b> - A Lightsail instance
--   snapshot</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Domain</tt></b> - A DNS zone</li>
--   <li><b><tt>PeeredVpc</tt></b> - A peered VPC</li>
--   <li><b><tt>LoadBalancer</tt></b> - A Lightsail load balancer</li>
--   <li><b><tt>LoadBalancerTlsCertificate</tt></b> - An SSL/TLS
--   certificate associated with a Lightsail load balancer</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Disk</tt></b> - A Lightsail block storage disk</li>
--   <li><b><tt>DiskSnapshot</tt></b> - A block storage disk snapshot</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the SSL/TLS certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_createdAt</a> - The time when you
--   created your SSL/TLS certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_location</a> - The AWS Region and
--   Availability Zone where you created your certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:loadBalancerName:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_loadBalancerName</a> - The load balancer
--   name where your SSL/TLS certificate is attached.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serial:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_serial</a> - The serial number of the
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isAttached:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_isAttached</a> - When <tt>true</tt>, the
--   SSL/TLS certificate is attached to the Lightsail load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:revokedAt:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_revokedAt</a> - The timestamp when the
--   certificate was revoked. This value is present only when the
--   certificate status is <tt>REVOKED</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notBefore:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_notBefore</a> - The timestamp when the
--   SSL/TLS certificate is first valid.
--   
--   <a>$sel:revocationReason:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_revocationReason</a> - The reason the
--   certificate was revoked. This value is present only when the
--   certificate status is <tt>REVOKED</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainName:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_domainName</a> - The domain name for
--   your SSL/TLS certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_name</a> - The name of the SSL/TLS
--   certificate (e.g., <tt>my-certificate</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:renewalSummary:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_renewalSummary</a> - An object that
--   describes the status of the certificate renewal managed by Lightsail.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportCode:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_supportCode</a> - The support code.
--   Include this code in your email to support when you have questions
--   about your Lightsail load balancer or SSL/TLS certificate. This code
--   enables our support team to look up your Lightsail information more
--   easily.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainValidationRecords:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_domainValidationRecords</a> - An array
--   of LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord objects describing
--   the records.
--   
--   <a>$sel:issuedAt:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_issuedAt</a> - The time when the SSL/TLS
--   certificate was issued.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyAlgorithm:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_keyAlgorithm</a> - The algorithm used to
--   generate the key pair (the public and private key).
--   
--   <a>$sel:signatureAlgorithm:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_signatureAlgorithm</a> - The algorithm
--   that was used to sign the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:issuer:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_issuer</a> - The issuer of the
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_tags</a> - The tag keys and optional
--   values for the resource. For more information about tags in Lightsail,
--   see the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notAfter:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_notAfter</a> - The timestamp when the
--   SSL/TLS certificate expires.
newLoadBalancerTlsCertificate :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate

-- | The validation failure reason, if any, of the certificate.
--   
--   The following failure reasons are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>NO_AVAILABLE_CONTACTS</tt></b> - This failure applies to
--   email validation, which is not available for Lightsail
--   certificates.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>ADDITIONAL_VERIFICATION_REQUIRED</tt></b> - Lightsail
--   requires additional information to process this certificate request.
--   This can happen as a fraud-protection measure, such as when the domain
--   ranks within the Alexa top 1000 websites. To provide the required
--   information, use the <a>AWS Support Center</a> to contact AWS
--   Support.You cannot request a certificate for Amazon-owned domain names
--   such as those ending in amazonaws.com, cloudfront.net, or
--   elasticbeanstalk.com.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>DOMAIN_NOT_ALLOWED</tt></b> - One or more of the domain
--   names in the certificate request was reported as an unsafe domain by
--   <a>VirusTotal</a>. To correct the problem, search for your domain name
--   on the <a>VirusTotal</a> website. If your domain is reported as
--   suspicious, see <a>Google Help for Hacked Websites</a> to learn what
--   you can do.If you believe that the result is a false positive, notify
--   the organization that is reporting the domain. VirusTotal is an
--   aggregate of several antivirus and URL scanners and cannot remove your
--   domain from a block list itself. After you correct the problem and the
--   VirusTotal registry has been updated, request a new certificate.If you
--   see this error and your domain is not included in the VirusTotal list,
--   visit the <a>AWS Support Center</a> and create a case.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>INVALID_PUBLIC_DOMAIN</tt></b> - One or more of the domain
--   names in the certificate request is not valid. Typically, this is
--   because a domain name in the request is not a valid top-level domain.
--   Try to request a certificate again, correcting any spelling errors or
--   typos that were in the failed request, and ensure that all domain
--   names in the request are for valid top-level domains. For example, you
--   cannot request a certificate for <tt>example.invalidpublicdomain</tt>
--   because <tt>invalidpublicdomain</tt> is not a valid top-level
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>OTHER</tt></b> - Typically, this failure occurs when there
--   is a typographical error in one or more of the domain names in the
--   certificate request. Try to request a certificate again, correcting
--   any spelling errors or typos that were in the failed request.</li>
--   </ul>
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_failureReason :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateFailureReason)

-- | The name of the entity that is associated with the public key
--   contained in the certificate.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_subject :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The validation status of the SSL/TLS certificate. Valid values are
--   below.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_status :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateStatus)

-- | An array of strings that specify the alternate domains (e.g.,
--   <tt>example2.com</tt>) and subdomains (e.g.,
--   <tt>blog.example.com</tt>) for the certificate.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_subjectAlternativeNames :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe [Text])

-- | The resource type (e.g., <tt>LoadBalancerTlsCertificate</tt>).
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance</tt></b> - A Lightsail instance (a virtual private
--   server)</li>
--   <li><b><tt>StaticIp</tt></b> - A static IP address</li>
--   <li><b><tt>KeyPair</tt></b> - The key pair used to connect to a
--   Lightsail instance</li>
--   <li><b><tt>InstanceSnapshot</tt></b> - A Lightsail instance
--   snapshot</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Domain</tt></b> - A DNS zone</li>
--   <li><b><tt>PeeredVpc</tt></b> - A peered VPC</li>
--   <li><b><tt>LoadBalancer</tt></b> - A Lightsail load balancer</li>
--   <li><b><tt>LoadBalancerTlsCertificate</tt></b> - An SSL/TLS
--   certificate associated with a Lightsail load balancer</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Disk</tt></b> - A Lightsail block storage disk</li>
--   <li><b><tt>DiskSnapshot</tt></b> - A block storage disk snapshot</li>
--   </ul>
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_resourceType :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SSL/TLS certificate.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_arn :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The time when you created your SSL/TLS certificate.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_createdAt :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The AWS Region and Availability Zone where you created your
--   certificate.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_location :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | The load balancer name where your SSL/TLS certificate is attached.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_loadBalancerName :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The serial number of the certificate.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_serial :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | When <tt>true</tt>, the SSL/TLS certificate is attached to the
--   Lightsail load balancer.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_isAttached :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe Bool)

-- | The timestamp when the certificate was revoked. This value is present
--   only when the certificate status is <tt>REVOKED</tt>.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_revokedAt :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The timestamp when the SSL/TLS certificate is first valid.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_notBefore :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The reason the certificate was revoked. This value is present only
--   when the certificate status is <tt>REVOKED</tt>.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_revocationReason :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRevocationReason)

-- | The domain name for your SSL/TLS certificate.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_domainName :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the SSL/TLS certificate (e.g., <tt>my-certificate</tt>).
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_name :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that describes the status of the certificate renewal managed
--   by Lightsail.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_renewalSummary :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary)

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about your Lightsail load balancer or SSL/TLS
--   certificate. This code enables our support team to look up your
--   Lightsail information more easily.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_supportCode :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord objects
--   describing the records.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_domainValidationRecords :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe [LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord])

-- | The time when the SSL/TLS certificate was issued.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_issuedAt :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The algorithm used to generate the key pair (the public and private
--   key).
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_keyAlgorithm :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The algorithm that was used to sign the certificate.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_signatureAlgorithm :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The issuer of the certificate.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_issuer :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_tags :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The timestamp when the SSL/TLS certificate expires.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_notAfter :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.LoadBalancerTlsCertificate.LoadBalancerTlsCertificate
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.LoadBalancerTlsCertificate.LoadBalancerTlsCertificate
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.LoadBalancerTlsCertificate.LoadBalancerTlsCertificate
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.LoadBalancerTlsCertificate.LoadBalancerTlsCertificate
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.LoadBalancerTlsCertificate.LoadBalancerTlsCertificate
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.LoadBalancerTlsCertificate.LoadBalancerTlsCertificate
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.LoadBalancerTlsCertificate.LoadBalancerTlsCertificate


module Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.LoadBalancer

-- | Describes a load balancer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoadBalancer</a> smart constructor.
data LoadBalancer
LoadBalancer' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe LoadBalancerState -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe Int -> Maybe (HashMap LoadBalancerAttributeName Text) -> Maybe LoadBalancerProtocol -> Maybe [LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe IpAddressType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Int] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InstanceHealthSummary] -> Maybe [Tag] -> LoadBalancer

-- | The path you specified to perform your health checks. If no path is
--   specified, the load balancer tries to make a request to the default
--   (root) page.
[$sel:healthCheckPath:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of your load balancer. Valid values are below.
[$sel:state:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe LoadBalancerState

-- | The resource type (e.g., <tt>LoadBalancer</tt>.
[$sel:resourceType:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the load balancer.
[$sel:arn:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe Text

-- | The date when your load balancer was created.
[$sel:createdAt:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The AWS Region where your load balancer was created (e.g.,
--   <tt>us-east-2a</tt>). Lightsail automatically creates your load
--   balancer across Availability Zones.
[$sel:location:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe ResourceLocation

-- | The port where the load balancer will direct traffic to your Lightsail
--   instances. For HTTP traffic, it's port 80. For HTTPS traffic, it's
--   port 443.
[$sel:instancePort:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe Int

-- | A string to string map of the configuration options for your load
--   balancer. Valid values are listed below.
[$sel:configurationOptions:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe (HashMap LoadBalancerAttributeName Text)

-- | The protocol you have enabled for your load balancer. Valid values are
--   below.
--   
--   You can't just have <tt>HTTP_HTTPS</tt>, but you can have just
--   <tt>HTTP</tt>.
[$sel:protocol:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe LoadBalancerProtocol

-- | An array of LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary objects that provide
--   additional information about the SSL/TLS certificates. For example, if
--   <tt>true</tt>, the certificate is attached to the load balancer.
[$sel:tlsCertificateSummaries:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe [LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary]

-- | The name of the load balancer (e.g., <tt>my-load-balancer</tt>).
[$sel:name:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe Text

-- | The IP address type of the load balancer.
--   
--   The possible values are <tt>ipv4</tt> for IPv4 only, and
--   <tt>dualstack</tt> for IPv4 and IPv6.
[$sel:ipAddressType:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe IpAddressType

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about your Lightsail load balancer. This code enables
--   our support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.
[$sel:supportCode:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of public port settings for your load balancer. For HTTP, use
--   port 80. For HTTPS, use port 443.
[$sel:publicPorts:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe [Int]

-- | The DNS name of your Lightsail load balancer.
[$sel:dnsName:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of InstanceHealthSummary objects describing the health of the
--   load balancer.
[$sel:instanceHealthSummary:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe [InstanceHealthSummary]

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:tags:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>LoadBalancer</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:healthCheckPath:LoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancer_healthCheckPath</a> - The path you specified to
--   perform your health checks. If no path is specified, the load balancer
--   tries to make a request to the default (root) page.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:LoadBalancer'</a>, <a>loadBalancer_state</a> - The
--   status of your load balancer. Valid values are below.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:LoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancer_resourceType</a> - The resource type (e.g.,
--   <tt>LoadBalancer</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:LoadBalancer'</a>, <a>loadBalancer_arn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:LoadBalancer'</a>, <a>loadBalancer_createdAt</a> -
--   The date when your load balancer was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:LoadBalancer'</a>, <a>loadBalancer_location</a> - The
--   AWS Region where your load balancer was created (e.g.,
--   <tt>us-east-2a</tt>). Lightsail automatically creates your load
--   balancer across Availability Zones.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instancePort:LoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancer_instancePort</a> - The port where the load balancer
--   will direct traffic to your Lightsail instances. For HTTP traffic,
--   it's port 80. For HTTPS traffic, it's port 443.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationOptions:LoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancer_configurationOptions</a> - A string to string map of
--   the configuration options for your load balancer. Valid values are
--   listed below.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protocol:LoadBalancer'</a>, <a>loadBalancer_protocol</a> - The
--   protocol you have enabled for your load balancer. Valid values are
--   below.
--   
--   You can't just have <tt>HTTP_HTTPS</tt>, but you can have just
--   <tt>HTTP</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tlsCertificateSummaries:LoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancer_tlsCertificateSummaries</a> - An array of
--   LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary objects that provide additional
--   information about the SSL/TLS certificates. For example, if
--   <tt>true</tt>, the certificate is attached to the load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:LoadBalancer'</a>, <a>loadBalancer_name</a> - The name of
--   the load balancer (e.g., <tt>my-load-balancer</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipAddressType:LoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancer_ipAddressType</a> - The IP address type of the load
--   balancer.
--   
--   The possible values are <tt>ipv4</tt> for IPv4 only, and
--   <tt>dualstack</tt> for IPv4 and IPv6.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportCode:LoadBalancer'</a>, <a>loadBalancer_supportCode</a>
--   - The support code. Include this code in your email to support when
--   you have questions about your Lightsail load balancer. This code
--   enables our support team to look up your Lightsail information more
--   easily.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicPorts:LoadBalancer'</a>, <a>loadBalancer_publicPorts</a>
--   - An array of public port settings for your load balancer. For HTTP,
--   use port 80. For HTTPS, use port 443.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dnsName:LoadBalancer'</a>, <a>loadBalancer_dnsName</a> - The
--   DNS name of your Lightsail load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceHealthSummary:LoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancer_instanceHealthSummary</a> - An array of
--   InstanceHealthSummary objects describing the health of the load
--   balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:LoadBalancer'</a>, <a>loadBalancer_tags</a> - The tag
--   keys and optional values for the resource. For more information about
--   tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
newLoadBalancer :: LoadBalancer

-- | The path you specified to perform your health checks. If no path is
--   specified, the load balancer tries to make a request to the default
--   (root) page.
loadBalancer_healthCheckPath :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of your load balancer. Valid values are below.
loadBalancer_state :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe LoadBalancerState)

-- | The resource type (e.g., <tt>LoadBalancer</tt>.
loadBalancer_resourceType :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the load balancer.
loadBalancer_arn :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe Text)

-- | The date when your load balancer was created.
loadBalancer_createdAt :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The AWS Region where your load balancer was created (e.g.,
--   <tt>us-east-2a</tt>). Lightsail automatically creates your load
--   balancer across Availability Zones.
loadBalancer_location :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | The port where the load balancer will direct traffic to your Lightsail
--   instances. For HTTP traffic, it's port 80. For HTTPS traffic, it's
--   port 443.
loadBalancer_instancePort :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe Int)

-- | A string to string map of the configuration options for your load
--   balancer. Valid values are listed below.
loadBalancer_configurationOptions :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe (HashMap LoadBalancerAttributeName Text))

-- | The protocol you have enabled for your load balancer. Valid values are
--   below.
--   
--   You can't just have <tt>HTTP_HTTPS</tt>, but you can have just
--   <tt>HTTP</tt>.
loadBalancer_protocol :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe LoadBalancerProtocol)

-- | An array of LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary objects that provide
--   additional information about the SSL/TLS certificates. For example, if
--   <tt>true</tt>, the certificate is attached to the load balancer.
loadBalancer_tlsCertificateSummaries :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe [LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary])

-- | The name of the load balancer (e.g., <tt>my-load-balancer</tt>).
loadBalancer_name :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe Text)

-- | The IP address type of the load balancer.
--   
--   The possible values are <tt>ipv4</tt> for IPv4 only, and
--   <tt>dualstack</tt> for IPv4 and IPv6.
loadBalancer_ipAddressType :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe IpAddressType)

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about your Lightsail load balancer. This code enables
--   our support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.
loadBalancer_supportCode :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of public port settings for your load balancer. For HTTP, use
--   port 80. For HTTPS, use port 443.
loadBalancer_publicPorts :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe [Int])

-- | The DNS name of your Lightsail load balancer.
loadBalancer_dnsName :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of InstanceHealthSummary objects describing the health of the
--   load balancer.
loadBalancer_instanceHealthSummary :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe [InstanceHealthSummary])

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
loadBalancer_tags :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe [Tag])

instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.LoadBalancer.LoadBalancer
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.LoadBalancer.LoadBalancer
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.LoadBalancer.LoadBalancer
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.LoadBalancer.LoadBalancer
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.LoadBalancer.LoadBalancer

module Amazonka.Lightsail.Types.LightsailDistribution

-- | Describes an Amazon Lightsail content delivery network (CDN)
--   distribution.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLightsailDistribution</a> smart constructor.
data LightsailDistribution
LightsailDistribution' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Origin -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe CacheSettings -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe IpAddressType -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CacheBehavior -> Maybe [CacheBehaviorPerPath] -> Maybe [Tag] -> LightsailDistribution

-- | The status of the distribution.
[$sel:status:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe Text

-- | An object that describes the origin resource of the distribution, such
--   as a Lightsail instance or load balancer.
--   
--   The distribution pulls, caches, and serves content from the origin.
[$sel:origin:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe Origin

-- | The name of the SSL/TLS certificate attached to the distribution, if
--   any.
[$sel:certificateName:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe Text

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>Distribution</tt>).
[$sel:resourceType:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the distribution.
[$sel:arn:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe Text

-- | The timestamp when the distribution was created.
[$sel:createdAt:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An object that describes the location of the distribution, such as the
--   AWS Region and Availability Zone.
--   
--   Lightsail distributions are global resources that can reference an
--   origin in any AWS Region, and distribute its content globally.
--   However, all distributions are located in the <tt>us-east-1</tt>
--   Region.
[$sel:location:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe ResourceLocation

-- | An object that describes the cache behavior settings of the
--   distribution.
[$sel:cacheBehaviorSettings:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe CacheSettings

-- | The alternate domain names of the distribution.
[$sel:alternativeDomainNames:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The ID of the bundle currently applied to the distribution.
[$sel:bundleId:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether the bundle that is currently applied to your
--   distribution, specified using the <tt>distributionName</tt> parameter,
--   can be changed to another bundle.
--   
--   Use the <tt>UpdateDistributionBundle</tt> action to change your
--   distribution's bundle.
[$sel:ableToUpdateBundle:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe Bool

-- | The public DNS of the origin.
[$sel:originPublicDNS:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe Text

-- | The domain name of the distribution.
[$sel:domainName:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the distribution.
[$sel:name:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe Text

-- | The IP address type of the distribution.
--   
--   The possible values are <tt>ipv4</tt> for IPv4 only, and
--   <tt>dualstack</tt> for IPv4 and IPv6.
[$sel:ipAddressType:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe IpAddressType

-- | Indicates whether the distribution is enabled.
[$sel:isEnabled:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe Bool

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about your Lightsail distribution. This code enables
--   our support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.
[$sel:supportCode:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe Text

-- | An object that describes the default cache behavior of the
--   distribution.
[$sel:defaultCacheBehavior:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe CacheBehavior

-- | An array of objects that describe the per-path cache behavior of the
--   distribution.
[$sel:cacheBehaviors:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe [CacheBehaviorPerPath]

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:tags:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>LightsailDistribution</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   <a>$sel:origin:LightsailDistribution'</a>,
--   <a>lightsailDistribution_origin</a> - An object that describes the
--   origin resource of the distribution, such as a Lightsail instance or
--   load balancer.

--   <a>lightsailDistribution_location</a> - An object that describes the
--   location of the distribution, such as the AWS Region and Availability
--   Zone.
--   
--   Lightsail distributions are global resources that can reference an
--   origin in any AWS Region, and distribute its content globally.
--   However, all distributions are located in the <tt>us-east-1</tt>
--   Region.

--   <a>$sel:cacheBehaviorSettings:LightsailDistribution'</a>,

--   
--   <a>$sel:ableToUpdateBundle:LightsailDistribution'</a>,
--   <a>lightsailDistribution_ableToUpdateBundle</a> - Indicates whether
--   the bundle that is currently applied to your distribution, specified
--   using the <tt>distributionName</tt> parameter, can be changed to
--   another bundle.
--   
--   Use the <tt>UpdateDistributionBundle</tt> action to change your
--   distribution's bundle.

--   distribution.

--   distribution is enabled.

--   describe the per-path cache behavior of the distribution.

--   <a>lightsailDistribution_tags</a> - The tag keys and optional values
--   for the resource. For more information about tags in Lightsail, see
--   the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
newLightsailDistribution :: LightsailDistribution

-- | The status of the distribution.
lightsailDistribution_status :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that describes the origin resource of the distribution, such
--   as a Lightsail instance or load balancer.
--   
--   The distribution pulls, caches, and serves content from the origin.
lightsailDistribution_origin :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Origin)

-- | The name of the SSL/TLS certificate attached to the distribution, if
--   any.
lightsailDistribution_certificateName :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Text)

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>Distribution</tt>).
lightsailDistribution_resourceType :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the distribution.
lightsailDistribution_arn :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when the distribution was created.
lightsailDistribution_createdAt :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An object that describes the location of the distribution, such as the
--   AWS Region and Availability Zone.
--   
--   Lightsail distributions are global resources that can reference an
--   origin in any AWS Region, and distribute its content globally.
--   However, all distributions are located in the <tt>us-east-1</tt>
--   Region.
lightsailDistribution_location :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | An object that describes the cache behavior settings of the
--   distribution.
lightsailDistribution_cacheBehaviorSettings :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe CacheSettings)

-- | The alternate domain names of the distribution.
lightsailDistribution_alternativeDomainNames :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe [Text])

lightsailDistribution_bundleId :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Text)
