containerImage_digest :: Lens' ContainerImage (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes an Amazon Lightsail container service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContainerService</a> smart constructor.
data ContainerService
ContainerService' :: Maybe ContainerServiceState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ContainerServiceStateDetail -> Maybe ContainerServiceDeployment -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ContainerServicePowerName -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ContainerServiceDeployment -> Maybe [Tag] -> ContainerService

-- | The current state of the container service.
--   
--   The following container service states are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt> - The container service is being created.</li>
--   <li><tt>READY</tt> - The container service is running but it does not
--   have an active container deployment.</li>
--   <li><tt>DEPLOYING</tt> - The container service is launching a
--   container deployment.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt> - The container service is running and it has an
--   active container deployment.</li>
--   <li><tt>UPDATING</tt> - The container service capacity or its custom
--   domains are being updated.</li>
--   <li><tt>DELETING</tt> - The container service is being deleted.</li>
--   <li><tt>DISABLED</tt> - The container service is disabled, and its
--   active deployment and containers, if any, are shut down.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:state:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe ContainerServiceState

-- | The ID of the power of the container service.
[$sel:powerId:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe Text

-- | The Lightsail resource type of the container service (i.e.,
--   <tt>ContainerService</tt>).
[$sel:resourceType:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the container service.
[$sel:arn:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe Text

-- | The timestamp when the container service was created.
[$sel:createdAt:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An object that describes the location of the container service, such
--   as the AWS Region and Availability Zone.
[$sel:location:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe ResourceLocation

-- | The scale specification of the container service.
--   
--   The scale specifies the allocated compute nodes of the container
--   service.
[$sel:scale:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe Natural

-- | The publicly accessible URL of the container service.
--   
--   If no public endpoint is specified in the <tt>currentDeployment</tt>,
--   this URL returns a 404 response.
[$sel:url:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe Text

-- | An object that describes the current state of the container service.
--   
--   The state detail is populated only when a container service is in a
--   <tt>PENDING</tt>, <tt>DEPLOYING</tt>, or <tt>UPDATING</tt> state.
[$sel:stateDetail:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe ContainerServiceStateDetail

-- | An object that describes the next deployment of the container service.
--   
--   This value is <tt>null</tt> when there is no deployment in a
--   <tt>pending</tt> state.
[$sel:nextDeployment:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe ContainerServiceDeployment

-- | The principal ARN of the container service.
--   
--   The principal ARN can be used to create a trust relationship between
--   your standard AWS account and your Lightsail container service. This
--   allows you to give your service permission to access resources in your
--   standard AWS account.
[$sel:principalArn:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe Text

-- | The power specification of the container service.
--   
--   The power specifies the amount of RAM, the number of vCPUs, and the
--   base price of the container service.
[$sel:power:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe ContainerServicePowerName

-- | The private domain name of the container service.
--   
--   The private domain name is accessible only by other resources within
--   the default virtual private cloud (VPC) of your Lightsail account.
[$sel:privateDomainName:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe Text

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the container service is disabled.
[$sel:isDisabled:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe Bool

-- | The public domain name of the container service, such as
--   <tt>example.com</tt> and <tt>www.example.com</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify up to four public domain names for a container
--   service. The domain names that you specify are used when you create a
--   deployment with a container configured as the public endpoint of your
--   container service.
--   
--   If you don't specify public domain names, then you can use the default
--   domain of the container service.
--   
--   You must create and validate an SSL/TLS certificate before you can use
--   public domain names with your container service. Use the
--   <tt>CreateCertificate</tt> action to create a certificate for the
--   public domain names you want to use with your container service.
--   
--   See <tt>CreateContainerService</tt> or <tt>UpdateContainerService</tt>
--   for information about how to specify public domain names for your
--   Lightsail container service.
[$sel:publicDomainNames:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | The name of the container service.
[$sel:containerServiceName:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe Text

-- | An object that describes the current container deployment of the
--   container service.
[$sel:currentDeployment:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe ContainerServiceDeployment

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:tags:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>ContainerService</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:ContainerService'</a>, <a>containerService_state</a> -
--   The current state of the container service.
--   
--   The following container service states are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt> - The container service is being created.</li>
--   <li><tt>READY</tt> - The container service is running but it does not
--   have an active container deployment.</li>
--   <li><tt>DEPLOYING</tt> - The container service is launching a
--   container deployment.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt> - The container service is running and it has an
--   active container deployment.</li>
--   <li><tt>UPDATING</tt> - The container service capacity or its custom
--   domains are being updated.</li>
--   <li><tt>DELETING</tt> - The container service is being deleted.</li>
--   <li><tt>DISABLED</tt> - The container service is disabled, and its
--   active deployment and containers, if any, are shut down.</li>
--   </ul>

--   <a>$sel:powerId:ContainerService'</a>, <a>containerService_powerId</a>

newContainerService :: ContainerService

-- | The current state of the container service.

--   active deployment and containers, if any, are shut down.</li>
--   </ul>

containerService_tags :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe [Tag])

-- | Describes a container deployment configuration of an Amazon Lightsail
--   container service.
--   
--   A deployment specifies the settings, such as the ports and launch
--   command, of containers that are deployed to your container service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContainerServiceDeployment</a> smart constructor.
data ContainerServiceDeployment
ContainerServiceDeployment' :: Maybe ContainerServiceDeploymentState -> Maybe ContainerServiceEndpoint -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (HashMap Text Container) -> Maybe Int -> ContainerServiceDeployment

-- | The state of the deployment.
--   
--   A deployment can be in one of the following states:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Activating</tt> - The deployment is being created.</li>
--   <li><tt>Active</tt> - The deployment was successfully created, and
--   it's currently running on the container service. The container service
--   can have only one deployment in an active state at a time.</li>
--   <li><tt>Inactive</tt> - The deployment was previously successfully
--   created, but it is not currently running on the container
--   service.</li>
--   <li><tt>Failed</tt> - The deployment failed. Use the
--   <tt>GetContainerLog</tt> action to view the log events for the
--   containers in the deployment to try to determine the reason for the
--   failure.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:state:ContainerServiceDeployment'] :: ContainerServiceDeployment -> Maybe ContainerServiceDeploymentState

-- | An object that describes the endpoint of the deployment.
[$sel:publicEndpoint:ContainerServiceDeployment'] :: ContainerServiceDeployment -> Maybe ContainerServiceEndpoint

-- | The timestamp when the deployment was created.
[$sel:createdAt:ContainerServiceDeployment'] :: ContainerServiceDeployment -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An object that describes the configuration for the containers of the
--   deployment.
[$sel:containers:ContainerServiceDeployment'] :: ContainerServiceDeployment -> Maybe (HashMap Text Container)

-- | The version number of the deployment.
[$sel:version:ContainerServiceDeployment'] :: ContainerServiceDeployment -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ContainerServiceDeployment</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:ContainerServiceDeployment'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceDeployment_state</a> - The state of the deployment.
--   
--   A deployment can be in one of the following states:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Activating</tt> - The deployment is being created.</li>
--   <li><tt>Active</tt> - The deployment was successfully created, and
--   it's currently running on the container service. The container service
--   can have only one deployment in an active state at a time.</li>
--   <li><tt>Inactive</tt> - The deployment was previously successfully
--   created, but it is not currently running on the container
--   service.</li>
--   <li><tt>Failed</tt> - The deployment failed. Use the
--   <tt>GetContainerLog</tt> action to view the log events for the
--   containers in the deployment to try to determine the reason for the
--   failure.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicEndpoint:ContainerServiceDeployment'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceDeployment_publicEndpoint</a> - An object that
--   describes the endpoint of the deployment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:ContainerServiceDeployment'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceDeployment_createdAt</a> - The timestamp when the
--   deployment was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:containers:ContainerServiceDeployment'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceDeployment_containers</a> - An object that
--   describes the configuration for the containers of the deployment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:ContainerServiceDeployment'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceDeployment_version</a> - The version number of the
--   deployment.
newContainerServiceDeployment :: ContainerServiceDeployment

-- | The state of the deployment.
--   
--   A deployment can be in one of the following states:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Activating</tt> - The deployment is being created.</li>
--   <li><tt>Active</tt> - The deployment was successfully created, and
--   it's currently running on the container service. The container service
--   can have only one deployment in an active state at a time.</li>
--   <li><tt>Inactive</tt> - The deployment was previously successfully
--   created, but it is not currently running on the container
--   service.</li>
--   <li><tt>Failed</tt> - The deployment failed. Use the
--   <tt>GetContainerLog</tt> action to view the log events for the
--   containers in the deployment to try to determine the reason for the
--   failure.</li>
--   </ul>
containerServiceDeployment_state :: Lens' ContainerServiceDeployment (Maybe ContainerServiceDeploymentState)

-- | An object that describes the endpoint of the deployment.
containerServiceDeployment_publicEndpoint :: Lens' ContainerServiceDeployment (Maybe ContainerServiceEndpoint)

-- | The timestamp when the deployment was created.
containerServiceDeployment_createdAt :: Lens' ContainerServiceDeployment (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An object that describes the configuration for the containers of the
--   deployment.
containerServiceDeployment_containers :: Lens' ContainerServiceDeployment (Maybe (HashMap Text Container))

-- | The version number of the deployment.
containerServiceDeployment_version :: Lens' ContainerServiceDeployment (Maybe Int)

-- | Describes a container deployment configuration of an Amazon Lightsail
--   container service.
--   
--   A deployment specifies the settings, such as the ports and launch
--   command, of containers that are deployed to your container service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContainerServiceDeploymentRequest</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest
ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest' :: Maybe EndpointRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Container) -> ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest

-- | An object that describes the endpoint of the deployment.
[$sel:publicEndpoint:ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest'] :: ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest -> Maybe EndpointRequest

-- | An object that describes the configuration for the containers of the
--   deployment.
[$sel:containers:ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest'] :: ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Container)

-- | Create a value of <a>ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   
--   <a>$sel:containers:ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceDeploymentRequest_containers</a> - An object that
--   describes the configuration for the containers of the deployment.

--   deployment.

-- | Describes the public endpoint configuration of a deployment of an
--   Amazon Lightsail container service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContainerServiceEndpoint</a> smart constructor.
data ContainerServiceEndpoint
ContainerServiceEndpoint' :: Maybe ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> ContainerServiceEndpoint

-- | An object that describes the health check configuration of the
--   container.
[$sel:healthCheck:ContainerServiceEndpoint'] :: ContainerServiceEndpoint -> Maybe ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig

-- | The name of the container entry of the deployment that the endpoint
--   configuration applies to.
[$sel:containerName:ContainerServiceEndpoint'] :: ContainerServiceEndpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The port of the specified container to which traffic is forwarded to.
[$sel:containerPort:ContainerServiceEndpoint'] :: ContainerServiceEndpoint -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ContainerServiceEndpoint</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:healthCheck:ContainerServiceEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceEndpoint_healthCheck</a> - An object that describes
--   the health check configuration of the container.
--   
--   <a>$sel:containerName:ContainerServiceEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceEndpoint_containerName</a> - The name of the
--   container entry of the deployment that the endpoint configuration
--   applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:containerPort:ContainerServiceEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceEndpoint_containerPort</a> - The port of the
--   specified container to which traffic is forwarded to.
newContainerServiceEndpoint :: ContainerServiceEndpoint

-- | An object that describes the health check configuration of the
--   container.
containerServiceEndpoint_healthCheck :: Lens' ContainerServiceEndpoint (Maybe ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig)

--   configuration applies to.
containerServiceEndpoint_containerName :: Lens' ContainerServiceEndpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | The port of the specified container to which traffic is forwarded to.
containerServiceEndpoint_containerPort :: Lens' ContainerServiceEndpoint (Maybe Int)

-- | Describes the health check configuration of an Amazon Lightsail
--   container service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig
ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig

-- | The number of consecutive health checks successes required before
--   moving the container to the <tt>Healthy</tt> state. The default value
--   is <tt>2</tt>.
[$sel:healthyThreshold:ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig'] :: ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig -> Maybe Int

-- | The path on the container on which to perform the health check. The
--   default value is <tt>/</tt>.
[$sel:path:ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig'] :: ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The HTTP codes to use when checking for a successful response from a
--   container. You can specify values between <tt>200</tt> and
--   <tt>499</tt>. You can specify multiple values (for example,
--   <tt>200,202</tt>) or a range of values (for example,
--   <tt>200-299</tt>).
[$sel:successCodes:ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig'] :: ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The approximate interval, in seconds, between health checks of an
--   individual container. You can specify between 5 and 300 seconds. The
--   default value is <tt>5</tt>.
[$sel:intervalSeconds:ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig'] :: ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig -> Maybe Int

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, during which no response means a
--   failed health check. You can specify between 2 and 60 seconds. The
--   default value is <tt>2</tt>.
[$sel:timeoutSeconds:ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig'] :: ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of consecutive health check failures required before moving
--   the container to the <tt>Unhealthy</tt> state. The default value is
--   <tt>2</tt>.
[$sel:unhealthyThreshold:ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig'] :: ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:healthyThreshold:ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_healthyThreshold</a> - The number
--   of consecutive health checks successes required before moving the
--   container to the <tt>Healthy</tt> state. The default value is
--   <tt>2</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:path:ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_path</a> - The path on the
--   container on which to perform the health check. The default value is
--   <tt>/</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:successCodes:ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_successCodes</a> - The HTTP codes
--   to use when checking for a successful response from a container. You
--   can specify values between <tt>200</tt> and <tt>499</tt>. You can
--   specify multiple values (for example, <tt>200,202</tt>) or a range of
--   values (for example, <tt>200-299</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:intervalSeconds:ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_intervalSeconds</a> - The
--   approximate interval, in seconds, between health checks of an
--   individual container. You can specify between 5 and 300 seconds. The
--   default value is <tt>5</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeoutSeconds:ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_timeoutSeconds</a> - The amount
--   of time, in seconds, during which no response means a failed health
--   check. You can specify between 2 and 60 seconds. The default value is
--   <tt>2</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unhealthyThreshold:ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_unhealthyThreshold</a> - The
--   number of consecutive health check failures required before moving the
--   container to the <tt>Unhealthy</tt> state. The default value is
--   <tt>2</tt>.
newContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig :: ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig

-- | The number of consecutive health checks successes required before
--   moving the container to the <tt>Healthy</tt> state. The default value
--   is <tt>2</tt>.
containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_healthyThreshold :: Lens' ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig (Maybe Int)

-- | The path on the container on which to perform the health check. The
--   default value is <tt>/</tt>.
containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_path :: Lens' ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The HTTP codes to use when checking for a successful response from a
--   container. You can specify values between <tt>200</tt> and
--   <tt>499</tt>. You can specify multiple values (for example,
--   <tt>200,202</tt>) or a range of values (for example,
--   <tt>200-299</tt>).
containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_successCodes :: Lens' ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The approximate interval, in seconds, between health checks of an
--   individual container. You can specify between 5 and 300 seconds. The
--   default value is <tt>5</tt>.
containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_intervalSeconds :: Lens' ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig (Maybe Int)

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, during which no response means a
--   failed health check. You can specify between 2 and 60 seconds. The
--   default value is <tt>2</tt>.
containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_timeoutSeconds :: Lens' ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of consecutive health check failures required before moving
--   the container to the <tt>Unhealthy</tt> state. The default value is
--   <tt>2</tt>.
containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_unhealthyThreshold :: Lens' ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig (Maybe Int)

-- | Describes the powers that can be specified for an Amazon Lightsail
--   container service.
--   
--   The power specifies the amount of RAM, the number of vCPUs, and the
--   base price of the container service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContainerServicePower</a> smart constructor.
data ContainerServicePower
ContainerServicePower' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Double -> ContainerServicePower

-- | The ID of the power (e.g., <tt>nano-1</tt>).
[$sel:powerId:ContainerServicePower'] :: ContainerServicePower -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of vCPUs included in the power.
[$sel:cpuCount:ContainerServicePower'] :: ContainerServicePower -> Maybe Double

-- | The friendly name of the power (e.g., <tt>nano</tt>).
[$sel:name:ContainerServicePower'] :: ContainerServicePower -> Maybe Text

-- | The monthly price of the power in USD.
[$sel:price:ContainerServicePower'] :: ContainerServicePower -> Maybe Double

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the power is active and can be
--   specified for container services.
[$sel:isActive:ContainerServicePower'] :: ContainerServicePower -> Maybe Bool

-- | The amount of RAM (in GB) of the power.
[$sel:ramSizeInGb:ContainerServicePower'] :: ContainerServicePower -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>ContainerServicePower</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:powerId:ContainerServicePower'</a>,
--   <a>containerServicePower_powerId</a> - The ID of the power (e.g.,
--   <tt>nano-1</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:cpuCount:ContainerServicePower'</a>,
--   <a>containerServicePower_cpuCount</a> - The number of vCPUs included
--   in the power.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ContainerServicePower'</a>,
--   <a>containerServicePower_name</a> - The friendly name of the power
--   (e.g., <tt>nano</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:price:ContainerServicePower'</a>,
--   <a>containerServicePower_price</a> - The monthly price of the power in
--   USD.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isActive:ContainerServicePower'</a>,
--   <a>containerServicePower_isActive</a> - A Boolean value indicating
--   whether the power is active and can be specified for container
--   services.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ramSizeInGb:ContainerServicePower'</a>,
--   <a>containerServicePower_ramSizeInGb</a> - The amount of RAM (in GB)
--   of the power.
newContainerServicePower :: ContainerServicePower

-- | The ID of the power (e.g., <tt>nano-1</tt>).
containerServicePower_powerId :: Lens' ContainerServicePower (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of vCPUs included in the power.
containerServicePower_cpuCount :: Lens' ContainerServicePower (Maybe Double)

-- | The friendly name of the power (e.g., <tt>nano</tt>).
containerServicePower_name :: Lens' ContainerServicePower (Maybe Text)

-- | The monthly price of the power in USD.
containerServicePower_price :: Lens' ContainerServicePower (Maybe Double)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the power is active and can be
--   specified for container services.
containerServicePower_isActive :: Lens' ContainerServicePower (Maybe Bool)

-- | The amount of RAM (in GB) of the power.
containerServicePower_ramSizeInGb :: Lens' ContainerServicePower (Maybe Double)

-- | Describes the login information for the container image registry of an
--   Amazon Lightsail account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContainerServiceRegistryLogin</a> smart constructor.
data ContainerServiceRegistryLogin
ContainerServiceRegistryLogin' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ContainerServiceRegistryLogin

-- | The timestamp of when the container image registry username and
--   password expire.
--   
--   The log in credentials expire 12 hours after they are created, at
--   which point you will need to create a new set of log in credentials
--   using the <tt>CreateContainerServiceRegistryLogin</tt> action.
[$sel:expiresAt:ContainerServiceRegistryLogin'] :: ContainerServiceRegistryLogin -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The container service registry username to use to push container
--   images to the container image registry of a Lightsail account.
[$sel:username:ContainerServiceRegistryLogin'] :: ContainerServiceRegistryLogin -> Maybe Text

-- | The container service registry password to use to push container
--   images to the container image registry of a Lightsail account
[$sel:password:ContainerServiceRegistryLogin'] :: ContainerServiceRegistryLogin -> Maybe Text

-- | The address to use to push container images to the container image
--   registry of a Lightsail account.
[$sel:registry:ContainerServiceRegistryLogin'] :: ContainerServiceRegistryLogin -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ContainerServiceRegistryLogin</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:expiresAt:ContainerServiceRegistryLogin'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceRegistryLogin_expiresAt</a> - The timestamp of when
--   the container image registry username and password expire.
--   
--   The log in credentials expire 12 hours after they are created, at
--   which point you will need to create a new set of log in credentials
--   using the <tt>CreateContainerServiceRegistryLogin</tt> action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:ContainerServiceRegistryLogin'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceRegistryLogin_username</a> - The container service
--   registry username to use to push container images to the container
--   image registry of a Lightsail account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:ContainerServiceRegistryLogin'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceRegistryLogin_password</a> - The container service
--   registry password to use to push container images to the container
--   image registry of a Lightsail account
--   
--   <a>$sel:registry:ContainerServiceRegistryLogin'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceRegistryLogin_registry</a> - The address to use to
--   push container images to the container image registry of a Lightsail
--   account.
newContainerServiceRegistryLogin :: ContainerServiceRegistryLogin

-- | The timestamp of when the container image registry username and
--   password expire.
--   
--   The log in credentials expire 12 hours after they are created, at
--   which point you will need to create a new set of log in credentials
--   using the <tt>CreateContainerServiceRegistryLogin</tt> action.
containerServiceRegistryLogin_expiresAt :: Lens' ContainerServiceRegistryLogin (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The container service registry username to use to push container
--   images to the container image registry of a Lightsail account.
containerServiceRegistryLogin_username :: Lens' ContainerServiceRegistryLogin (Maybe Text)

-- | The container service registry password to use to push container
--   images to the container image registry of a Lightsail account
containerServiceRegistryLogin_password :: Lens' ContainerServiceRegistryLogin (Maybe Text)

-- | The address to use to push container images to the container image
--   registry of a Lightsail account.
containerServiceRegistryLogin_registry :: Lens' ContainerServiceRegistryLogin (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes the current state of a container service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContainerServiceStateDetail</a> smart constructor.
data ContainerServiceStateDetail
ContainerServiceStateDetail' :: Maybe ContainerServiceStateDetailCode -> Maybe Text -> ContainerServiceStateDetail

-- | The state code of the container service.
--   
--   The following state codes are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The following state codes are possible if your container service
--   is in a <tt>DEPLOYING</tt> or <tt>UPDATING</tt>
--   state:<ul><li><tt>CREATING_SYSTEM_RESOURCES</tt> - The system
--   resources for your container service are being
--   created.</li><li><tt>CREATING_NETWORK_INFRASTRUCTURE</tt> - The
--   network infrastructure for your container service are being
--   created.</li><li><tt>PROVISIONING_CERTIFICATE</tt> - The SSL/TLS
--   certificate for your container service is being
--   created.</li><li><tt>PROVISIONING_SERVICE</tt> - Your container
--   service is being provisioned.</li><li><tt>CREATING_DEPLOYMENT</tt> -
--   Your deployment is being created on your container
--   service.</li><li><tt>EVALUATING_HEALTH_CHECK</tt> - The health of your
--   deployment is being evaluated.</li><li><tt>ACTIVATING_DEPLOYMENT</tt>
--   - Your deployment is being activated.</li></ul></li>
--   <li>The following state codes are possible if your container service
--   is in a <tt>PENDING</tt>
--   state:<ul><li><tt>CERTIFICATE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED</tt> - The SSL/TLS
--   certificate required for your container service exceeds the maximum
--   number of certificates allowed for your
--   account.</li><li><tt>UNKNOWN_ERROR</tt> - An error was experienced
--   when your container service was being created.</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:code:ContainerServiceStateDetail'] :: ContainerServiceStateDetail -> Maybe ContainerServiceStateDetailCode

-- | A message that provides more information for the state code.
--   
--   The state detail is populated only when a container service is in a
--   <tt>PENDING</tt>, <tt>DEPLOYING</tt>, or <tt>UPDATING</tt> state.
[$sel:message:ContainerServiceStateDetail'] :: ContainerServiceStateDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ContainerServiceStateDetail</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:code:ContainerServiceStateDetail'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceStateDetail_code</a> - The state code of the
--   container service.
--   
--   The following state codes are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The following state codes are possible if your container service
--   is in a <tt>DEPLOYING</tt> or <tt>UPDATING</tt>
--   state:<ul><li><tt>CREATING_SYSTEM_RESOURCES</tt> - The system
--   resources for your container service are being
--   created.</li><li><tt>CREATING_NETWORK_INFRASTRUCTURE</tt> - The
--   network infrastructure for your container service are being
--   created.</li><li><tt>PROVISIONING_CERTIFICATE</tt> - The SSL/TLS
--   certificate for your container service is being
--   created.</li><li><tt>PROVISIONING_SERVICE</tt> - Your container
--   service is being provisioned.</li><li><tt>CREATING_DEPLOYMENT</tt> -
--   Your deployment is being created on your container
--   service.</li><li><tt>EVALUATING_HEALTH_CHECK</tt> - The health of your
--   deployment is being evaluated.</li><li><tt>ACTIVATING_DEPLOYMENT</tt>
--   - Your deployment is being activated.</li></ul></li>
--   <li>The following state codes are possible if your container service
--   is in a <tt>PENDING</tt>
--   state:<ul><li><tt>CERTIFICATE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED</tt> - The SSL/TLS
--   certificate required for your container service exceeds the maximum
--   number of certificates allowed for your
--   account.</li><li><tt>UNKNOWN_ERROR</tt> - An error was experienced
--   when your container service was being created.</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:ContainerServiceStateDetail'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceStateDetail_message</a> - A message that provides
--   more information for the state code.
--   
--   The state detail is populated only when a container service is in a
--   <tt>PENDING</tt>, <tt>DEPLOYING</tt>, or <tt>UPDATING</tt> state.
newContainerServiceStateDetail :: ContainerServiceStateDetail

-- | The state code of the container service.
--   
--   The following state codes are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The following state codes are possible if your container service
--   is in a <tt>DEPLOYING</tt> or <tt>UPDATING</tt>
--   state:<ul><li><tt>CREATING_SYSTEM_RESOURCES</tt> - The system
--   resources for your container service are being
--   created.</li><li><tt>CREATING_NETWORK_INFRASTRUCTURE</tt> - The
--   network infrastructure for your container service are being
--   created.</li><li><tt>PROVISIONING_CERTIFICATE</tt> - The SSL/TLS
--   certificate for your container service is being
--   created.</li><li><tt>PROVISIONING_SERVICE</tt> - Your container
--   service is being provisioned.</li><li><tt>CREATING_DEPLOYMENT</tt> -
--   Your deployment is being created on your container
--   service.</li><li><tt>EVALUATING_HEALTH_CHECK</tt> - The health of your
--   deployment is being evaluated.</li><li><tt>ACTIVATING_DEPLOYMENT</tt>
--   - Your deployment is being activated.</li></ul></li>
--   <li>The following state codes are possible if your container service
--   is in a <tt>PENDING</tt>
--   state:<ul><li><tt>CERTIFICATE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED</tt> - The SSL/TLS
--   certificate required for your container service exceeds the maximum
--   number of certificates allowed for your
--   account.</li><li><tt>UNKNOWN_ERROR</tt> - An error was experienced
--   when your container service was being created.</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
containerServiceStateDetail_code :: Lens' ContainerServiceStateDetail (Maybe ContainerServiceStateDetailCode)

-- | A message that provides more information for the state code.
--   
--   The state detail is populated only when a container service is in a
--   <tt>PENDING</tt>, <tt>DEPLOYING</tt>, or <tt>UPDATING</tt> state.
containerServiceStateDetail_message :: Lens' ContainerServiceStateDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes whether an Amazon Lightsail content delivery network (CDN)
--   distribution forwards cookies to the origin and, if so, which ones.
--   
--   For the cookies that you specify, your distribution caches separate
--   versions of the specified content based on the cookie values in viewer
--   requests.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCookieObject</a> smart constructor.
data CookieObject
CookieObject' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe ForwardValues -> CookieObject

-- | The specific cookies to forward to your distribution's origin.
[$sel:cookiesAllowList:CookieObject'] :: CookieObject -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Specifies which cookies to forward to the distribution's origin for a
--   cache behavior: <tt>all</tt>, <tt>none</tt>, or <tt>allow-list</tt> to
--   forward only the cookies specified in the <tt>cookiesAllowList</tt>
--   parameter.
[$sel:option:CookieObject'] :: CookieObject -> Maybe ForwardValues

-- | Create a value of <a>CookieObject</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cookiesAllowList:CookieObject'</a>,
--   <a>cookieObject_cookiesAllowList</a> - The specific cookies to forward
--   to your distribution's origin.
--   
--   <a>$sel:option:CookieObject'</a>, <a>cookieObject_option</a> -
--   Specifies which cookies to forward to the distribution's origin for a
--   cache behavior: <tt>all</tt>, <tt>none</tt>, or <tt>allow-list</tt> to
--   forward only the cookies specified in the <tt>cookiesAllowList</tt>
--   parameter.
newCookieObject :: CookieObject

-- | The specific cookies to forward to your distribution's origin.
cookieObject_cookiesAllowList :: Lens' CookieObject (Maybe [Text])

-- | Specifies which cookies to forward to the distribution's origin for a
--   cache behavior: <tt>all</tt>, <tt>none</tt>, or <tt>allow-list</tt> to
--   forward only the cookies specified in the <tt>cookiesAllowList</tt>
--   parameter.
cookieObject_option :: Lens' CookieObject (Maybe ForwardValues)

data DestinationInfo

destinationInfo_id :: Lens' DestinationInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes a block storage disk.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDisk</a> smart constructor.
data Disk
Disk' :: Maybe DiskState -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [AddOn] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [Tag] -> Disk

-- | Describes the status of the disk.
[$sel:state:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe DiskState

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>Disk</tt>).
[$sel:resourceType:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the disk.
[$sel:arn:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Text

-- | The disk path.
[$sel:path:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Text

-- | The date when the disk was created.
[$sel:createdAt:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The AWS Region and Availability Zone where the disk is located.
[$sel:location:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe ResourceLocation

-- | The input/output operations per second (IOPS) of the disk.
[$sel:iops:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Int

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the disk is attached.
[$sel:isAttached:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Bool

-- | An array of objects representing the add-ons enabled on the disk.
[$sel:addOns:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe [AddOn]

-- | (Deprecated) The attachment state of the disk.
--   
--   In releases prior to November 14, 2017, this parameter returned
--   <tt>attached</tt> for system disks in the API response. It is now
--   deprecated, but still included in the response. Use
--   <tt>isAttached</tt> instead.
[$sel:attachmentState:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique name of the disk.
[$sel:name:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Text

-- | The size of the disk in GB.
[$sel:sizeInGb:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Int

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.
--   This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail
--   information more easily.
[$sel:supportCode:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Text

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether this disk is a system disk (has an
--   operating system loaded on it).
[$sel:isSystemDisk:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Bool

-- | The resources to which the disk is attached.
[$sel:attachedTo:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Text

-- | (Deprecated) The number of GB in use by the disk.
--   
--   In releases prior to November 14, 2017, this parameter was not
--   included in the API response. It is now deprecated.
[$sel:gbInUse:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Int

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:tags:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>Disk</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_state</a> - Describes the status of
--   the disk.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_resourceType</a> - The
--   Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>Disk</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the disk.
--   
--   <a>$sel:path:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_path</a> - The disk path.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_createdAt</a> - The date when the
--   disk was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_location</a> - The AWS Region and
--   Availability Zone where the disk is located.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iops:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_iops</a> - The input/output operations
--   per second (IOPS) of the disk.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isAttached:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_isAttached</a> - A Boolean value
--   indicating whether the disk is attached.
--   
--   <a>$sel:addOns:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_addOns</a> - An array of objects
--   representing the add-ons enabled on the disk.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attachmentState:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_attachmentState</a> -
--   (Deprecated) The attachment state of the disk.
--   
--   In releases prior to November 14, 2017, this parameter returned
--   <tt>attached</tt> for system disks in the API response. It is now
--   deprecated, but still included in the response. Use
--   <tt>isAttached</tt> instead.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_name</a> - The unique name of the
--   disk.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInGb:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_sizeInGb</a> - The size of the
--   disk in GB.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportCode:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_supportCode</a> - The support
--   code. Include this code in your email to support when you have
--   questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail. This
--   code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail information
--   more easily.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isSystemDisk:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_isSystemDisk</a> - A Boolean
--   value indicating whether this disk is a system disk (has an operating
--   system loaded on it).
--   
--   <a>$sel:attachedTo:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_attachedTo</a> - The resources
--   to which the disk is attached.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gbInUse:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_gbInUse</a> - (Deprecated) The
--   number of GB in use by the disk.
--   
--   In releases prior to November 14, 2017, this parameter was not
--   included in the API response. It is now deprecated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_tags</a> - The tag keys and optional
--   values for the resource. For more information about tags in Lightsail,
--   see the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
newDisk :: Disk

-- | Describes the status of the disk.
disk_state :: Lens' Disk (Maybe DiskState)

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>Disk</tt>).
disk_resourceType :: Lens' Disk (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the disk.
disk_arn :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Text)

-- | The disk path.
disk_path :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Text)

-- | The date when the disk was created.
disk_createdAt :: Lens' Disk (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The AWS Region and Availability Zone where the disk is located.
disk_location :: Lens' Disk (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | The input/output operations per second (IOPS) of the disk.
disk_iops :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Int)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the disk is attached.
disk_isAttached :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Bool)

-- | An array of objects representing the add-ons enabled on the disk.
disk_addOns :: Lens' Disk (Maybe [AddOn])

-- | (Deprecated) The attachment state of the disk.
--   
--   In releases prior to November 14, 2017, this parameter returned
--   <tt>attached</tt> for system disks in the API response. It is now
--   deprecated, but still included in the response. Use
--   <tt>isAttached</tt> instead.
disk_attachmentState :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique name of the disk.
disk_name :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Text)

-- | The size of the disk in GB.
disk_sizeInGb :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Int)

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.
--   This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail
--   information more easily.
disk_supportCode :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Text)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether this disk is a system disk (has an
--   operating system loaded on it).
disk_isSystemDisk :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Bool)

-- | The resources to which the disk is attached.
disk_attachedTo :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Text)

-- | (Deprecated) The number of GB in use by the disk.
--   
--   In releases prior to November 14, 2017, this parameter was not
--   included in the API response. It is now deprecated.

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
disk_tags :: Lens' Disk (Maybe [Tag])

-- | Describes a disk.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDiskInfo</a> smart constructor.
data DiskInfo
DiskInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> DiskInfo

-- | The disk path.
[$sel:path:DiskInfo'] :: DiskInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The disk name.
[$sel:name:DiskInfo'] :: DiskInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The size of the disk in GB (e.g., <tt>32</tt>).
[$sel:sizeInGb:DiskInfo'] :: DiskInfo -> Maybe Int

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether this disk is a system disk (has an
--   operating system loaded on it).
[$sel:isSystemDisk:DiskInfo'] :: DiskInfo -> Maybe Bool

--   <a>$sel:name:DiskInfo'</a>, <a>diskInfo_name</a> - The disk name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInGb:DiskInfo'</a>, <a>diskInfo_sizeInGb</a> - The size of
--   the disk in GB (e.g., <tt>32</tt>).
--

--   Boolean value indicating whether this disk is a system disk (has an
--   operating system loaded on it).

--   operating system loaded on it).

-- | Describes a block storage disk snapshot.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDiskSnapshot</a> smart constructor.
data DiskSnapshot
DiskSnapshot' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe DiskSnapshotState -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> DiskSnapshot

-- | The unique name of the source disk from which the disk snapshot was
--   created.
[$sel:fromDiskName:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the snapshot was created from an
--   automatic snapshot.
[$sel:isFromAutoSnapshot:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe Bool

-- | The status of the disk snapshot operation.
[$sel:state:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe DiskSnapshotState

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>DiskSnapshot</tt>).
[$sel:resourceType:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the disk snapshot.
[$sel:arn:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe Text

[$sel:createdAt:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The AWS Region and Availability Zone where the disk snapshot was
--   created.
[$sel:location:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe ResourceLocation

-- | The progress of the snapshot.
[$sel:progress:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the disk snapshot (e.g., <tt>my-disk-snapshot</tt>).
[$sel:name:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The size of the disk in GB.
[$sel:sizeInGb:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe Int

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.
--   This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail
--   information more easily.
[$sel:supportCode:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe Text

--   disk (system volume) snapshot was created.
[$sel:fromInstanceArn:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique name of the source instance from which the disk (system
--   volume) snapshot was created.
[$sel:fromInstanceName:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source disk from which the disk
--   snapshot was created.
[$sel:fromDiskArn:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:tags:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Describes a domain where you are storing recordsets.

data Domain

-- | The resource type.
[$sel:resourceType:Domain'] :: Domain -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | An array of key-value pairs containing information about the domain
--   entries.
[$sel:domainEntries:Domain'] :: Domain -> Maybe [DomainEntry]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the domain recordset (e.g.,
--   <tt>arn:aws:lightsail:global:123456789101:Domain/824cede0-abc7-4f84-8dbc-12345EXAMPLE</tt>).
[$sel:arn:Domain'] :: Domain -> Maybe Text

[$sel:createdAt:Domain'] :: Domain -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The AWS Region and Availability Zones where the domain recordset was
--   created.
[$sel:location:Domain'] :: Domain -> Maybe ResourceLocation

-- | The name of the domain.
[$sel:name:Domain'] :: Domain -> Maybe Text

--   have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.
--   This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail
--   information more easily.
[$sel:supportCode:Domain'] :: Domain -> Maybe Text

--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:tags:Domain'] :: Domain -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>Domain</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   resource type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainEntries:Domain'</a>, <a>domain_domainEntries</a> - An
--   array of key-value pairs containing information about the domain
--   entries.

--   <a>$sel:arn:Domain'</a>, <a>domain_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the domain recordset (e.g.,
--   <tt>arn:aws:lightsail:global:123456789101:Domain/824cede0-abc7-4f84-8dbc-12345EXAMPLE</tt>).

--   the domain recordset was created.

--   more easily.

--   Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.

-- | Describes a domain recordset entry.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDomainEntry</a> smart constructor.
data DomainEntry
DomainEntry' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DomainEntry

-- | When <tt>true</tt>, specifies whether the domain entry is an alias
--   used by the Lightsail load balancer. You can include an alias (A type)
--   record in your request, which points to a load balancer DNS name and
--   routes traffic to your load balancer.
[$sel:isAlias:DomainEntry'] :: DomainEntry -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the domain.
[$sel:name:DomainEntry'] :: DomainEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the domain recordset entry.
[$sel:id:DomainEntry'] :: DomainEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | (Deprecated) The options for the domain entry.
--   
--   In releases prior to November 29, 2017, this parameter was not
--   included in the API response. It is now deprecated.
[$sel:options:DomainEntry'] :: DomainEntry -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The type of domain entry, such as address for IPv4 (A), address for
--   IPv6 (AAAA), canonical name (CNAME), mail exchanger (MX), name server
--   (NS), start of authority (SOA), service locator (SRV), or text (TXT).
--   
--   The following domain entry types can be used:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>A</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>AAAA</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>CNAME</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>MX</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NS</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SOA</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SRV</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TXT</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:type':DomainEntry'] :: DomainEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The target IP address (e.g., <tt>192.0.2.0</tt>), or AWS name server
--   (e.g., <tt>ns-111.awsdns-22.com.</tt>).
--   
--   For Lightsail load balancers, the value looks like
--   <tt>ab1234c56789c6b86aba6fb203d443bc-123456789.us-east-2.elb.amazonaws.com</tt>.
--   For Lightsail distributions, the value looks like
--   <tt>exampled1182ne.cloudfront.net</tt>. For Lightsail container
--   services, the value looks like
--   <tt>container-service-1.example23scljs.us-west-2.cs.amazonlightsail.com</tt>.
--   Be sure to also set <tt>isAlias</tt> to <tt>true</tt> when setting up
--   an A record for a Lightsail load balancer, distribution, or container
--   service.
[$sel:target:DomainEntry'] :: DomainEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DomainEntry</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:isAlias:DomainEntry'</a>, <a>domainEntry_isAlias</a> - When
--   <tt>true</tt>, specifies whether the domain entry is an alias used by
--   the Lightsail load balancer. You can include an alias (A type) record
--   in your request, which points to a load balancer DNS name and routes
--   traffic to your load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:DomainEntry'</a>, <a>domainEntry_name</a> - The name of
--   the domain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:DomainEntry'</a>, <a>domainEntry_id</a> - The ID of the
--   domain recordset entry.
--   
--   <a>$sel:options:DomainEntry'</a>, <a>domainEntry_options</a> -
--   (Deprecated) The options for the domain entry.
--   
--   In releases prior to November 29, 2017, this parameter was not
--   included in the API response. It is now deprecated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':DomainEntry'</a>, <a>domainEntry_type</a> - The type of
--   domain entry, such as address for IPv4 (A), address for IPv6 (AAAA),
--   canonical name (CNAME), mail exchanger (MX), name server (NS), start
--   of authority (SOA), service locator (SRV), or text (TXT).
--   
--   The following domain entry types can be used:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>A</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>AAAA</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>CNAME</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>MX</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NS</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SOA</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SRV</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TXT</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:target:DomainEntry'</a>, <a>domainEntry_target</a> - The
--   target IP address (e.g., <tt>192.0.2.0</tt>), or AWS name server
--   (e.g., <tt>ns-111.awsdns-22.com.</tt>).
--   
--   For Lightsail load balancers, the value looks like
--   <tt>ab1234c56789c6b86aba6fb203d443bc-123456789.us-east-2.elb.amazonaws.com</tt>.
--   For Lightsail distributions, the value looks like
--   <tt>exampled1182ne.cloudfront.net</tt>. For Lightsail container
--   services, the value looks like
--   <tt>container-service-1.example23scljs.us-west-2.cs.amazonlightsail.com</tt>.
--   Be sure to also set <tt>isAlias</tt> to <tt>true</tt> when setting up
--   an A record for a Lightsail load balancer, distribution, or container
--   service.
newDomainEntry :: DomainEntry

-- | When <tt>true</tt>, specifies whether the domain entry is an alias
--   used by the Lightsail load balancer. You can include an alias (A type)
--   record in your request, which points to a load balancer DNS name and
--   routes traffic to your load balancer.
domainEntry_isAlias :: Lens' DomainEntry (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the domain.
domainEntry_name :: Lens' DomainEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the domain recordset entry.
domainEntry_id :: Lens' DomainEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | (Deprecated) The options for the domain entry.
--   
--   In releases prior to November 29, 2017, this parameter was not
--   included in the API response. It is now deprecated.
domainEntry_options :: Lens' DomainEntry (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The type of domain entry, such as address for IPv4 (A), address for
--   IPv6 (AAAA), canonical name (CNAME), mail exchanger (MX), name server
--   (NS), start of authority (SOA), service locator (SRV), or text (TXT).
--   
--   The following domain entry types can be used:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>A</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>AAAA</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>CNAME</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>MX</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NS</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SOA</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SRV</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TXT</pre></li>
--   </ul>
domainEntry_type :: Lens' DomainEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The target IP address (e.g., <tt>192.0.2.0</tt>), or AWS name server
--   (e.g., <tt>ns-111.awsdns-22.com.</tt>).
--   
--   For Lightsail load balancers, the value looks like
--   <tt>ab1234c56789c6b86aba6fb203d443bc-123456789.us-east-2.elb.amazonaws.com</tt>.
--   For Lightsail distributions, the value looks like
--   <tt>exampled1182ne.cloudfront.net</tt>. For Lightsail container
--   services, the value looks like
--   <tt>container-service-1.example23scljs.us-west-2.cs.amazonlightsail.com</tt>.
--   Be sure to also set <tt>isAlias</tt> to <tt>true</tt> when setting up
--   an A record for a Lightsail load balancer, distribution, or container
--   service.
domainEntry_target :: Lens' DomainEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes the domain validation records of an Amazon Lightsail SSL/TLS
--   certificate.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDomainValidationRecord</a> smart constructor.
data DomainValidationRecord
DomainValidationRecord' :: Maybe ResourceRecord -> Maybe Text -> DomainValidationRecord

-- | An object that describes the DNS records to add to your domain's DNS
--   to validate it for the certificate.
[$sel:resourceRecord:DomainValidationRecord'] :: DomainValidationRecord -> Maybe ResourceRecord

-- | The domain name of the certificate validation record. For example,
--   <tt>example.com</tt> or <tt>www.example.com</tt>.
[$sel:domainName:DomainValidationRecord'] :: DomainValidationRecord -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DomainValidationRecord</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceRecord:DomainValidationRecord'</a>,
--   <a>domainValidationRecord_resourceRecord</a> - An object that
--   describes the DNS records to add to your domain's DNS to validate it
--   for the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainName:DomainValidationRecord'</a>,
--   <a>domainValidationRecord_domainName</a> - The domain name of the
--   certificate validation record. For example, <tt>example.com</tt> or
--   <tt>www.example.com</tt>.
newDomainValidationRecord :: DomainValidationRecord

-- | An object that describes the DNS records to add to your domain's DNS
--   to validate it for the certificate.
domainValidationRecord_resourceRecord :: Lens' DomainValidationRecord (Maybe ResourceRecord)

-- | The domain name of the certificate validation record. For example,
--   <tt>example.com</tt> or <tt>www.example.com</tt>.
domainValidationRecord_domainName :: Lens' DomainValidationRecord (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes the settings of a public endpoint for an Amazon Lightsail

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointRequest</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointRequest

--   container.

--   omitted.

endpointRequest_containerPort :: Lens' EndpointRequest Int

-- | Describes the request headers that a Lightsail distribution bases
--   caching on.
--   
--   For the headers that you specify, your distribution caches separate
--   versions of the specified content based on the header values in viewer
--   requests. For example, suppose viewer requests for <tt>logo.jpg</tt>
--   contain a custom <tt>product</tt> header that has a value of either
--   <tt>acme</tt> or <tt>apex</tt>, and you configure your distribution to
--   cache your content based on values in the <tt>product</tt> header.
--   Your distribution forwards the <tt>product</tt> header to the origin
--   and caches the response from the origin once for each header value.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHeaderObject</a> smart constructor.
data HeaderObject
HeaderObject' :: Maybe [HeaderEnum] -> Maybe ForwardValues -> HeaderObject

-- | The specific headers to forward to your distribution's origin.
[$sel:headersAllowList:HeaderObject'] :: HeaderObject -> Maybe [HeaderEnum]

-- | The headers that you want your distribution to forward to your origin
--   and base caching on.
--   
--   You can configure your distribution to do one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>all</tt></b> - Forward all headers to your origin.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>none</tt></b> - Forward only the default headers.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>allow-list</tt></b> - Forward only the headers you specify
--   using the <tt>headersAllowList</tt> parameter.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:option:HeaderObject'] :: HeaderObject -> Maybe ForwardValues

-- | Create a value of <a>HeaderObject</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:headersAllowList:HeaderObject'</a>,
--   <a>headerObject_headersAllowList</a> - The specific headers to forward
--   to your distribution's origin.
--   
--   <a>$sel:option:HeaderObject'</a>, <a>headerObject_option</a> - The
--   headers that you want your distribution to forward to your origin and
--   base caching on.
--   
--   You can configure your distribution to do one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>all</tt></b> - Forward all headers to your origin.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>none</tt></b> - Forward only the default headers.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>allow-list</tt></b> - Forward only the headers you specify
--   using the <tt>headersAllowList</tt> parameter.</li>
--   </ul>
newHeaderObject :: HeaderObject

-- | The specific headers to forward to your distribution's origin.
headerObject_headersAllowList :: Lens' HeaderObject (Maybe [HeaderEnum])

-- | The headers that you want your distribution to forward to your origin
--   and base caching on.
--   
--   You can configure your distribution to do one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>all</tt></b> - Forward all headers to your origin.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>none</tt></b> - Forward only the default headers.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>allow-list</tt></b> - Forward only the headers you specify
--   using the <tt>headersAllowList</tt> parameter.</li>
--   </ul>
headerObject_option :: Lens' HeaderObject (Maybe ForwardValues)

-- | Describes the public SSH host keys or the RDP certificate.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHostKeyAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data HostKeyAttributes
HostKeyAttributes' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> HostKeyAttributes

-- | The returned RDP certificate is not valid after this point in time.
--   
--   This value is listed only for RDP certificates.
[$sel:notValidAfter:HostKeyAttributes'] :: HostKeyAttributes -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The returned RDP certificate is valid after this point in time.
--   
--   This value is listed only for RDP certificates.
[$sel:notValidBefore:HostKeyAttributes'] :: HostKeyAttributes -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The SHA-1 fingerprint of the returned SSH host key or RDP certificate.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-1 SSH
--   fingerprint:<pre>SHA1:1CHH6FaAaXjtFOsR/t83vf91SR0</pre></li>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-1 RDP
--   fingerprint:<pre>af:34:51:fe:09:f0:e0:da:b8:4e:56:ca:60:c2:10:ff:38:06:db:45</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:fingerprintSHA1:HostKeyAttributes'] :: HostKeyAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The public SSH host key or the RDP certificate.
[$sel:publicKey:HostKeyAttributes'] :: HostKeyAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The SSH host key algorithm or the RDP certificate format.
--   
--   For SSH host keys, the algorithm may be <tt>ssh-rsa</tt>,
--   <tt>ecdsa-sha2-nistp256</tt>, <tt>ssh-ed25519</tt>, etc. For RDP
--   certificates, the algorithm is always <tt>x509-cert</tt>.
[$sel:algorithm:HostKeyAttributes'] :: HostKeyAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The time that the SSH host key or RDP certificate was recorded by
--   Lightsail.
[$sel:witnessedAt:HostKeyAttributes'] :: HostKeyAttributes -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The SHA-256 fingerprint of the returned SSH host key or RDP
--   certificate.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-256 SSH
--   fingerprint:<pre>SHA256:KTsMnRBh1IhD17HpdfsbzeGA4jOijm5tyXsMjKVbB8o</pre></li>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-256 RDP
--   fingerprint:<pre>03:9b:36:9f:4b:de:4e:61:70:fc:7c:c9:78:e7:d2:1a:1c:25:a8:0c:91:f6:7c:e4:d6:a0:85:c8:b4:53:99:68</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:fingerprintSHA256:HostKeyAttributes'] :: HostKeyAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>HostKeyAttributes</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:notValidAfter:HostKeyAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>hostKeyAttributes_notValidAfter</a> - The returned RDP certificate
--   is not valid after this point in time.
--   
--   This value is listed only for RDP certificates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notValidBefore:HostKeyAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>hostKeyAttributes_notValidBefore</a> - The returned RDP certificate
--   is valid after this point in time.
--   
--   This value is listed only for RDP certificates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fingerprintSHA1:HostKeyAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>hostKeyAttributes_fingerprintSHA1</a> - The SHA-1 fingerprint of
--   the returned SSH host key or RDP certificate.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-1 SSH
--   fingerprint:<pre>SHA1:1CHH6FaAaXjtFOsR/t83vf91SR0</pre></li>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-1 RDP
--   fingerprint:<pre>af:34:51:fe:09:f0:e0:da:b8:4e:56:ca:60:c2:10:ff:38:06:db:45</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicKey:HostKeyAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>hostKeyAttributes_publicKey</a> - The public SSH host key or the
--   RDP certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:algorithm:HostKeyAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>hostKeyAttributes_algorithm</a> - The SSH host key algorithm or the
--   RDP certificate format.
--   
--   For SSH host keys, the algorithm may be <tt>ssh-rsa</tt>,
--   <tt>ecdsa-sha2-nistp256</tt>, <tt>ssh-ed25519</tt>, etc. For RDP
--   certificates, the algorithm is always <tt>x509-cert</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:witnessedAt:HostKeyAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>hostKeyAttributes_witnessedAt</a> - The time that the SSH host key
--   or RDP certificate was recorded by Lightsail.
--

--   <a>hostKeyAttributes_fingerprintSHA256</a> - The SHA-256 fingerprint

--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-256 SSH
--   fingerprint:<pre>SHA256:KTsMnRBh1IhD17HpdfsbzeGA4jOijm5tyXsMjKVbB8o</pre></li>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-256 RDP
--   fingerprint:<pre>03:9b:36:9f:4b:de:4e:61:70:fc:7c:c9:78:e7:d2:1a:1c:25:a8:0c:91:f6:7c:e4:d6:a0:85:c8:b4:53:99:68</pre></li>
--   </ul>
newHostKeyAttributes :: HostKeyAttributes

-- | The returned RDP certificate is not valid after this point in time.
--   
--   This value is listed only for RDP certificates.
hostKeyAttributes_notValidAfter :: Lens' HostKeyAttributes (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The returned RDP certificate is valid after this point in time.
--   
--   This value is listed only for RDP certificates.
hostKeyAttributes_notValidBefore :: Lens' HostKeyAttributes (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The SHA-1 fingerprint of the returned SSH host key or RDP certificate.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-1 SSH
--   fingerprint:<pre>SHA1:1CHH6FaAaXjtFOsR/t83vf91SR0</pre></li>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-1 RDP
--   fingerprint:<pre>af:34:51:fe:09:f0:e0:da:b8:4e:56:ca:60:c2:10:ff:38:06:db:45</pre></li>
--   </ul>
hostKeyAttributes_fingerprintSHA1 :: Lens' HostKeyAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The public SSH host key or the RDP certificate.
hostKeyAttributes_publicKey :: Lens' HostKeyAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The SSH host key algorithm or the RDP certificate format.
--   
--   For SSH host keys, the algorithm may be <tt>ssh-rsa</tt>,
--   <tt>ecdsa-sha2-nistp256</tt>, <tt>ssh-ed25519</tt>, etc. For RDP
--   certificates, the algorithm is always <tt>x509-cert</tt>.
