-- | Describes an instance snapshot.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceSnapshotInfo</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceSnapshotInfo
InstanceSnapshotInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [DiskInfo] -> InstanceSnapshotInfo

--   <tt>os_debian_8_3</tt>).

--   <tt>micro_1_0</tt>).

--   source instance.
[$sel:fromDiskInfo:InstanceSnapshotInfo'] :: InstanceSnapshotInfo -> Maybe [DiskInfo]

--   omitted.

--   
--   <a>$sel:fromBundleId:InstanceSnapshotInfo'</a>,
--   <a>instanceSnapshotInfo_fromBundleId</a> - The bundle ID from which
--   the source instance was created (e.g., <tt>micro_1_0</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromDiskInfo:InstanceSnapshotInfo'</a>,
--   <a>instanceSnapshotInfo_fromDiskInfo</a> - A list of objects
--   describing the disks that were attached to the source instance.

--   source instance.

--   <tt>pending</tt>).

-- | Describes an Amazon Lightsail content delivery network (CDN)
--   distribution.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLightsailDistribution</a> smart constructor.
data LightsailDistribution
LightsailDistribution' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Origin -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe CacheSettings -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe IpAddressType -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CacheBehavior -> Maybe [CacheBehaviorPerPath] -> Maybe [Tag] -> LightsailDistribution

-- | The status of the distribution.
[$sel:status:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe Text

-- | An object that describes the origin resource of the distribution, such
--   as a Lightsail instance or load balancer.
--   
--   The distribution pulls, caches, and serves content from the origin.
[$sel:origin:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe Origin

-- | The name of the SSL/TLS certificate attached to the distribution, if
--   any.
[$sel:certificateName:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe Text

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>Distribution</tt>).
[$sel:resourceType:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the distribution.
[$sel:arn:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe Text

-- | The timestamp when the distribution was created.
[$sel:createdAt:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An object that describes the location of the distribution, such as the
--   AWS Region and Availability Zone.
--   
--   Lightsail distributions are global resources that can reference an
--   origin in any AWS Region, and distribute its content globally.
--   However, all distributions are located in the <tt>us-east-1</tt>
--   Region.
[$sel:location:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe ResourceLocation

-- | An object that describes the cache behavior settings of the
--   distribution.
[$sel:cacheBehaviorSettings:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe CacheSettings

-- | The alternate domain names of the distribution.
[$sel:alternativeDomainNames:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The ID of the bundle currently applied to the distribution.
[$sel:bundleId:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether the bundle that is currently applied to your
--   distribution, specified using the <tt>distributionName</tt> parameter,
--   can be changed to another bundle.
--   
--   Use the <tt>UpdateDistributionBundle</tt> action to change your
--   distribution's bundle.
[$sel:ableToUpdateBundle:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe Bool

-- | The public DNS of the origin.
[$sel:originPublicDNS:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe Text

-- | The domain name of the distribution.
[$sel:domainName:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the distribution.
[$sel:name:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe Text

-- | The IP address type of the distribution.
--   
--   The possible values are <tt>ipv4</tt> for IPv4 only, and
--   <tt>dualstack</tt> for IPv4 and IPv6.
[$sel:ipAddressType:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe IpAddressType

-- | Indicates whether the distribution is enabled.
[$sel:isEnabled:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe Bool

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about your Lightsail distribution. This code enables
--   our support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.
[$sel:supportCode:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe Text

-- | An object that describes the default cache behavior of the
--   distribution.
[$sel:defaultCacheBehavior:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe CacheBehavior

-- | An array of objects that describe the per-path cache behavior of the
--   distribution.
[$sel:cacheBehaviors:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe [CacheBehaviorPerPath]

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:tags:LightsailDistribution'] :: LightsailDistribution -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>LightsailDistribution</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:LightsailDistribution'</a>,
--   <a>lightsailDistribution_status</a> - The status of the distribution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:origin:LightsailDistribution'</a>,
--   <a>lightsailDistribution_origin</a> - An object that describes the
--   origin resource of the distribution, such as a Lightsail instance or

--   origin.

--   <a>lightsailDistribution_domainName</a> - The domain name of the
--   distribution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:LightsailDistribution'</a>,
--   <a>lightsailDistribution_name</a> - The name of the distribution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipAddressType:LightsailDistribution'</a>,
--   <a>lightsailDistribution_ipAddressType</a> - The IP address type of
--   the distribution.
--

--   <tt>dualstack</tt> for IPv4 and IPv6.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isEnabled:LightsailDistribution'</a>,
--   <a>lightsailDistribution_isEnabled</a> - Indicates whether the
--   distribution is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportCode:LightsailDistribution'</a>,
--   <a>lightsailDistribution_supportCode</a> - The support code. Include
--   this code in your email to support when you have questions about your
--   Lightsail distribution. This code enables our support team to look up
--   your Lightsail information more easily.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultCacheBehavior:LightsailDistribution'</a>,
--   <a>lightsailDistribution_defaultCacheBehavior</a> - An object that
--   describes the default cache behavior of the distribution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cacheBehaviors:LightsailDistribution'</a>,
--   <a>lightsailDistribution_cacheBehaviors</a> - An array of objects that
--   describe the per-path cache behavior of the distribution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:LightsailDistribution'</a>,
--   <a>lightsailDistribution_tags</a> - The tag keys and optional values
--   for the resource. For more information about tags in Lightsail, see
--   the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
newLightsailDistribution :: LightsailDistribution

-- | The status of the distribution.
lightsailDistribution_status :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that describes the origin resource of the distribution, such
--   as a Lightsail instance or load balancer.
--   
--   The distribution pulls, caches, and serves content from the origin.
lightsailDistribution_origin :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Origin)

-- | The name of the SSL/TLS certificate attached to the distribution, if
--   any.
lightsailDistribution_certificateName :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Text)

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>Distribution</tt>).
lightsailDistribution_resourceType :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the distribution.
lightsailDistribution_arn :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when the distribution was created.
lightsailDistribution_createdAt :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An object that describes the location of the distribution, such as the
--   AWS Region and Availability Zone.
--   
--   Lightsail distributions are global resources that can reference an
--   origin in any AWS Region, and distribute its content globally.
--   However, all distributions are located in the <tt>us-east-1</tt>
--   Region.
lightsailDistribution_location :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | An object that describes the cache behavior settings of the
--   distribution.
lightsailDistribution_cacheBehaviorSettings :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe CacheSettings)

-- | The alternate domain names of the distribution.
lightsailDistribution_alternativeDomainNames :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe [Text])

-- | The ID of the bundle currently applied to the distribution.
lightsailDistribution_bundleId :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether the bundle that is currently applied to your
--   distribution, specified using the <tt>distributionName</tt> parameter,
--   can be changed to another bundle.
--   
--   Use the <tt>UpdateDistributionBundle</tt> action to change your
--   distribution's bundle.
lightsailDistribution_ableToUpdateBundle :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Bool)

-- | The public DNS of the origin.
lightsailDistribution_originPublicDNS :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Text)

-- | The domain name of the distribution.
lightsailDistribution_domainName :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the distribution.
lightsailDistribution_name :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Text)

-- | The IP address type of the distribution.
--   
--   The possible values are <tt>ipv4</tt> for IPv4 only, and
--   <tt>dualstack</tt> for IPv4 and IPv6.
lightsailDistribution_ipAddressType :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe IpAddressType)

-- | Indicates whether the distribution is enabled.
lightsailDistribution_isEnabled :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Bool)

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about your Lightsail distribution. This code enables
--   our support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.
lightsailDistribution_supportCode :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that describes the default cache behavior of the
--   distribution.
lightsailDistribution_defaultCacheBehavior :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe CacheBehavior)

-- | An array of objects that describe the per-path cache behavior of the
--   distribution.
lightsailDistribution_cacheBehaviors :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe [CacheBehaviorPerPath])

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
lightsailDistribution_tags :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe [Tag])

-- | Describes a load balancer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoadBalancer</a> smart constructor.
data LoadBalancer
LoadBalancer' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe LoadBalancerState -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe Int -> Maybe (HashMap LoadBalancerAttributeName Text) -> Maybe LoadBalancerProtocol -> Maybe [LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe IpAddressType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Int] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [InstanceHealthSummary] -> Maybe [Tag] -> LoadBalancer

-- | The path you specified to perform your health checks. If no path is
--   specified, the load balancer tries to make a request to the default
--   (root) page.
[$sel:healthCheckPath:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of your load balancer. Valid values are below.
[$sel:state:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe LoadBalancerState

-- | The resource type (e.g., <tt>LoadBalancer</tt>.
[$sel:resourceType:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the load balancer.
[$sel:arn:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe Text

-- | The date when your load balancer was created.
[$sel:createdAt:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The AWS Region where your load balancer was created (e.g.,
--   <tt>us-east-2a</tt>). Lightsail automatically creates your load
--   balancer across Availability Zones.
[$sel:location:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe ResourceLocation

-- | The port where the load balancer will direct traffic to your Lightsail
--   instances. For HTTP traffic, it's port 80. For HTTPS traffic, it's
--   port 443.
[$sel:instancePort:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe Int

-- | A string to string map of the configuration options for your load
--   balancer. Valid values are listed below.
[$sel:configurationOptions:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe (HashMap LoadBalancerAttributeName Text)

-- | The protocol you have enabled for your load balancer. Valid values are
--   below.
--   
--   You can't just have <tt>HTTP_HTTPS</tt>, but you can have just
--   <tt>HTTP</tt>.
[$sel:protocol:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe LoadBalancerProtocol

-- | An array of LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary objects that provide
--   additional information about the SSL/TLS certificates. For example, if
--   <tt>true</tt>, the certificate is attached to the load balancer.
[$sel:tlsCertificateSummaries:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe [LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary]

-- | The name of the load balancer (e.g., <tt>my-load-balancer</tt>).
[$sel:name:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe Text

-- | The IP address type of the load balancer.
--   
--   The possible values are <tt>ipv4</tt> for IPv4 only, and
--   <tt>dualstack</tt> for IPv4 and IPv6.
[$sel:ipAddressType:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe IpAddressType

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about your Lightsail load balancer. This code enables
--   our support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.
[$sel:supportCode:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of public port settings for your load balancer. For HTTP, use
--   port 80. For HTTPS, use port 443.
[$sel:publicPorts:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe [Int]

-- | The DNS name of your Lightsail load balancer.
[$sel:dnsName:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of InstanceHealthSummary objects describing the health of the
--   load balancer.
[$sel:instanceHealthSummary:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe [InstanceHealthSummary]

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:tags:LoadBalancer'] :: LoadBalancer -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>LoadBalancer</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:healthCheckPath:LoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancer_healthCheckPath</a> - The path you specified to
--   perform your health checks. If no path is specified, the load balancer
--   tries to make a request to the default (root) page.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:LoadBalancer'</a>, <a>loadBalancer_state</a> - The
--   status of your load balancer. Valid values are below.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:LoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancer_resourceType</a> - The resource type (e.g.,
--   <tt>LoadBalancer</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:LoadBalancer'</a>, <a>loadBalancer_arn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:LoadBalancer'</a>, <a>loadBalancer_createdAt</a> -
--   The date when your load balancer was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:LoadBalancer'</a>, <a>loadBalancer_location</a> - The
--   AWS Region where your load balancer was created (e.g.,
--   <tt>us-east-2a</tt>). Lightsail automatically creates your load
--   balancer across Availability Zones.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instancePort:LoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancer_instancePort</a> - The port where the load balancer
--   will direct traffic to your Lightsail instances. For HTTP traffic,
--   it's port 80. For HTTPS traffic, it's port 443.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationOptions:LoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancer_configurationOptions</a> - A string to string map of
--   the configuration options for your load balancer. Valid values are
--   listed below.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protocol:LoadBalancer'</a>, <a>loadBalancer_protocol</a> - The
--   protocol you have enabled for your load balancer. Valid values are
--   below.
--   
--   You can't just have <tt>HTTP_HTTPS</tt>, but you can have just
--   <tt>HTTP</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tlsCertificateSummaries:LoadBalancer'</a>,

--   LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary objects that provide additional

--   the load balancer (e.g., <tt>my-load-balancer</tt>).

--   <a>loadBalancer_ipAddressType</a> - The IP address type of the load
--   balancer.

--   <tt>dualstack</tt> for IPv4 and IPv6.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportCode:LoadBalancer'</a>, <a>loadBalancer_supportCode</a>
--   - The support code. Include this code in your email to support when
--   you have questions about your Lightsail load balancer. This code
--   enables our support team to look up your Lightsail information more
--   easily.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicPorts:LoadBalancer'</a>, <a>loadBalancer_publicPorts</a>
--   - An array of public port settings for your load balancer. For HTTP,
--   use port 80. For HTTPS, use port 443.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dnsName:LoadBalancer'</a>, <a>loadBalancer_dnsName</a> - The
--   DNS name of your Lightsail load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceHealthSummary:LoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancer_instanceHealthSummary</a> - An array of
--   InstanceHealthSummary objects describing the health of the load
--   balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:LoadBalancer'</a>, <a>loadBalancer_tags</a> - The tag
--   keys and optional values for the resource. For more information about
--   tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
newLoadBalancer :: LoadBalancer

-- | The path you specified to perform your health checks. If no path is
--   specified, the load balancer tries to make a request to the default
--   (root) page.
loadBalancer_healthCheckPath :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe Text)

loadBalancer_state :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe LoadBalancerState)

loadBalancer_resourceType :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe ResourceType)

loadBalancer_arn :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe Text)

-- | The date when your load balancer was created.
loadBalancer_createdAt :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The AWS Region where your load balancer was created (e.g.,
--   <tt>us-east-2a</tt>). Lightsail automatically creates your load
--   balancer across Availability Zones.
loadBalancer_location :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe ResourceLocation)

--   instances. For HTTP traffic, it's port 80. For HTTPS traffic, it's
--   port 443.
loadBalancer_instancePort :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe Int)

--   balancer. Valid values are listed below.
loadBalancer_configurationOptions :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe (HashMap LoadBalancerAttributeName Text))

--   below.
--

--   <tt>HTTP</tt>.
loadBalancer_protocol :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe LoadBalancerProtocol)

-- | An array of LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary objects that provide
--   additional information about the SSL/TLS certificates. For example, if
--   <tt>true</tt>, the certificate is attached to the load balancer.
loadBalancer_tlsCertificateSummaries :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe [LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary])

loadBalancer_name :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe Text)

loadBalancer_ipAddressType :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe IpAddressType)

loadBalancer_publicPorts :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe [Int])

loadBalancer_dnsName :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe Text)

--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
loadBalancer_tags :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe [Tag])

-- | Describes a load balancer SSL/TLS certificate.
--   
--   TLS is just an updated, more secure version of Secure Socket Layer
--   (SSL).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoadBalancerTlsCertificate</a> smart constructor.
data LoadBalancerTlsCertificate
LoadBalancerTlsCertificate' :: Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateFailureReason -> Maybe Text -> Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateStatus -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRevocationReason -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord] -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe POSIX -> LoadBalancerTlsCertificate

-- | The validation failure reason, if any, of the certificate.
--   
--   The following failure reasons are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>NO_AVAILABLE_CONTACTS</tt></b> - This failure applies to
--   email validation, which is not available for Lightsail
--   certificates.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>ADDITIONAL_VERIFICATION_REQUIRED</tt></b> - Lightsail
--   requires additional information to process this certificate request.
--   This can happen as a fraud-protection measure, such as when the domain
--   ranks within the Alexa top 1000 websites. To provide the required
--   information, use the <a>AWS Support Center</a> to contact AWS
--   Support.You cannot request a certificate for Amazon-owned domain names
--   such as those ending in amazonaws.com, cloudfront.net, or
--   elasticbeanstalk.com.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>DOMAIN_NOT_ALLOWED</tt></b> - One or more of the domain
--   names in the certificate request was reported as an unsafe domain by
--   <a>VirusTotal</a>. To correct the problem, search for your domain name
--   on the <a>VirusTotal</a> website. If your domain is reported as
--   suspicious, see <a>Google Help for Hacked Websites</a> to learn what
--   you can do.If you believe that the result is a false positive, notify
--   the organization that is reporting the domain. VirusTotal is an
--   aggregate of several antivirus and URL scanners and cannot remove your
--   domain from a block list itself. After you correct the problem and the
--   VirusTotal registry has been updated, request a new certificate.If you
--   see this error and your domain is not included in the VirusTotal list,
--   visit the <a>AWS Support Center</a> and create a case.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>INVALID_PUBLIC_DOMAIN</tt></b> - One or more of the domain
--   names in the certificate request is not valid. Typically, this is
--   because a domain name in the request is not a valid top-level domain.
--   Try to request a certificate again, correcting any spelling errors or
--   typos that were in the failed request, and ensure that all domain
--   names in the request are for valid top-level domains. For example, you
--   cannot request a certificate for <tt>example.invalidpublicdomain</tt>
--   because <tt>invalidpublicdomain</tt> is not a valid top-level
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>OTHER</tt></b> - Typically, this failure occurs when there
--   is a typographical error in one or more of the domain names in the
--   certificate request. Try to request a certificate again, correcting
--   any spelling errors or typos that were in the failed request.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:failureReason:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateFailureReason

-- | The name of the entity that is associated with the public key
--   contained in the certificate.
[$sel:subject:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The validation status of the SSL/TLS certificate. Valid values are
--   below.
[$sel:status:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateStatus

-- | An array of strings that specify the alternate domains (e.g.,
--   <tt>example2.com</tt>) and subdomains (e.g.,
--   <tt>blog.example.com</tt>) for the certificate.
[$sel:subjectAlternativeNames:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The resource type (e.g., <tt>LoadBalancerTlsCertificate</tt>).
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance</tt></b> - A Lightsail instance (a virtual private
--   server)</li>
--   <li><b><tt>StaticIp</tt></b> - A static IP address</li>
--   <li><b><tt>KeyPair</tt></b> - The key pair used to connect to a
--   Lightsail instance</li>
--   <li><b><tt>InstanceSnapshot</tt></b> - A Lightsail instance
--   snapshot</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Domain</tt></b> - A DNS zone</li>
--   <li><b><tt>PeeredVpc</tt></b> - A peered VPC</li>
--   <li><b><tt>LoadBalancer</tt></b> - A Lightsail load balancer</li>
--   <li><b><tt>LoadBalancerTlsCertificate</tt></b> - An SSL/TLS
--   certificate associated with a Lightsail load balancer</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Disk</tt></b> - A Lightsail block storage disk</li>
--   <li><b><tt>DiskSnapshot</tt></b> - A block storage disk snapshot</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:resourceType:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SSL/TLS certificate.
[$sel:arn:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The time when you created your SSL/TLS certificate.
[$sel:createdAt:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The AWS Region and Availability Zone where you created your
--   certificate.
[$sel:location:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe ResourceLocation

-- | The load balancer name where your SSL/TLS certificate is attached.
[$sel:loadBalancerName:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The serial number of the certificate.
[$sel:serial:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | When <tt>true</tt>, the SSL/TLS certificate is attached to the
--   Lightsail load balancer.
[$sel:isAttached:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe Bool

-- | The timestamp when the certificate was revoked. This value is present
--   only when the certificate status is <tt>REVOKED</tt>.
[$sel:revokedAt:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The timestamp when the SSL/TLS certificate is first valid.
[$sel:notBefore:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The reason the certificate was revoked. This value is present only
--   when the certificate status is <tt>REVOKED</tt>.
[$sel:revocationReason:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRevocationReason

-- | The domain name for your SSL/TLS certificate.
[$sel:domainName:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the SSL/TLS certificate (e.g., <tt>my-certificate</tt>).
[$sel:name:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | An object that describes the status of the certificate renewal managed
--   by Lightsail.
[$sel:renewalSummary:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about your Lightsail load balancer or SSL/TLS
--   certificate. This code enables our support team to look up your
--   Lightsail information more easily.
[$sel:supportCode:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord objects
--   describing the records.
[$sel:domainValidationRecords:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe [LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord]

-- | The time when the SSL/TLS certificate was issued.
[$sel:issuedAt:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The algorithm used to generate the key pair (the public and private
--   key).
[$sel:keyAlgorithm:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The algorithm that was used to sign the certificate.
[$sel:signatureAlgorithm:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The issuer of the certificate.
[$sel:issuer:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:tags:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The timestamp when the SSL/TLS certificate expires.
[$sel:notAfter:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>LoadBalancerTlsCertificate</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureReason:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_failureReason</a> - The validation
--   failure reason, if any, of the certificate.
--   
--   The following failure reasons are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>NO_AVAILABLE_CONTACTS</tt></b> - This failure applies to
--   email validation, which is not available for Lightsail
--   certificates.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>ADDITIONAL_VERIFICATION_REQUIRED</tt></b> - Lightsail
--   requires additional information to process this certificate request.
--   This can happen as a fraud-protection measure, such as when the domain
--   ranks within the Alexa top 1000 websites. To provide the required
--   information, use the <a>AWS Support Center</a> to contact AWS
--   Support.You cannot request a certificate for Amazon-owned domain names
--   such as those ending in amazonaws.com, cloudfront.net, or
--   elasticbeanstalk.com.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>DOMAIN_NOT_ALLOWED</tt></b> - One or more of the domain
--   names in the certificate request was reported as an unsafe domain by
--   <a>VirusTotal</a>. To correct the problem, search for your domain name
--   on the <a>VirusTotal</a> website. If your domain is reported as
--   suspicious, see <a>Google Help for Hacked Websites</a> to learn what
--   you can do.If you believe that the result is a false positive, notify
--   the organization that is reporting the domain. VirusTotal is an
--   aggregate of several antivirus and URL scanners and cannot remove your
--   domain from a block list itself. After you correct the problem and the
--   VirusTotal registry has been updated, request a new certificate.If you
--   see this error and your domain is not included in the VirusTotal list,
--   visit the <a>AWS Support Center</a> and create a case.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>INVALID_PUBLIC_DOMAIN</tt></b> - One or more of the domain
--   names in the certificate request is not valid. Typically, this is
--   because a domain name in the request is not a valid top-level domain.
--   Try to request a certificate again, correcting any spelling errors or
--   typos that were in the failed request, and ensure that all domain
--   names in the request are for valid top-level domains. For example, you
--   cannot request a certificate for <tt>example.invalidpublicdomain</tt>
--   because <tt>invalidpublicdomain</tt> is not a valid top-level
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>OTHER</tt></b> - Typically, this failure occurs when there
--   is a typographical error in one or more of the domain names in the
--   certificate request. Try to request a certificate again, correcting
--   any spelling errors or typos that were in the failed request.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_subject</a> - The name of the entity
--   that is associated with the public key contained in the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_status</a> - The validation status of
--   the SSL/TLS certificate. Valid values are below.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subjectAlternativeNames:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_subjectAlternativeNames</a> - An array
--   of strings that specify the alternate domains (e.g.,
--   <tt>example2.com</tt>) and subdomains (e.g.,
--   <tt>blog.example.com</tt>) for the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_resourceType</a> - The resource type
--   (e.g., <tt>LoadBalancerTlsCertificate</tt>).
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance</tt></b> - A Lightsail instance (a virtual private
--   server)</li>
--   <li><b><tt>StaticIp</tt></b> - A static IP address</li>
--   <li><b><tt>KeyPair</tt></b> - The key pair used to connect to a
--   Lightsail instance</li>
--   <li><b><tt>InstanceSnapshot</tt></b> - A Lightsail instance
--   snapshot</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Domain</tt></b> - A DNS zone</li>
--   <li><b><tt>PeeredVpc</tt></b> - A peered VPC</li>
--   <li><b><tt>LoadBalancer</tt></b> - A Lightsail load balancer</li>
--   <li><b><tt>LoadBalancerTlsCertificate</tt></b> - An SSL/TLS
--   certificate associated with a Lightsail load balancer</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Disk</tt></b> - A Lightsail block storage disk</li>
--   <li><b><tt>DiskSnapshot</tt></b> - A block storage disk snapshot</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the SSL/TLS certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_createdAt</a> - The time when you
--   created your SSL/TLS certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_location</a> - The AWS Region and
--   Availability Zone where you created your certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:loadBalancerName:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_loadBalancerName</a> - The load balancer
--   name where your SSL/TLS certificate is attached.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serial:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_serial</a> - The serial number of the
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isAttached:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_isAttached</a> - When <tt>true</tt>, the
--   SSL/TLS certificate is attached to the Lightsail load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:revokedAt:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_revokedAt</a> - The timestamp when the
--   certificate was revoked. This value is present only when the
--   certificate status is <tt>REVOKED</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notBefore:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_notBefore</a> - The timestamp when the
--   SSL/TLS certificate is first valid.
--   
--   <a>$sel:revocationReason:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_revocationReason</a> - The reason the
--   certificate was revoked. This value is present only when the
--   certificate status is <tt>REVOKED</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainName:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_domainName</a> - The domain name for
--   your SSL/TLS certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_name</a> - The name of the SSL/TLS
--   certificate (e.g., <tt>my-certificate</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:renewalSummary:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_renewalSummary</a> - An object that
--   describes the status of the certificate renewal managed by Lightsail.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportCode:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_supportCode</a> - The support code.
--   Include this code in your email to support when you have questions
--   about your Lightsail load balancer or SSL/TLS certificate. This code
--   enables our support team to look up your Lightsail information more
--   easily.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainValidationRecords:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_domainValidationRecords</a> - An array
--   of LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord objects describing
--   the records.
--   
--   <a>$sel:issuedAt:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_issuedAt</a> - The time when the SSL/TLS
--   certificate was issued.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyAlgorithm:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_keyAlgorithm</a> - The algorithm used to
--   generate the key pair (the public and private key).
--   
--   <a>$sel:signatureAlgorithm:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_signatureAlgorithm</a> - The algorithm
--   that was used to sign the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:issuer:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_issuer</a> - The issuer of the
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_tags</a> - The tag keys and optional
--   values for the resource. For more information about tags in Lightsail,
--   see the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notAfter:LoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificate_notAfter</a> - The timestamp when the
--   SSL/TLS certificate expires.
newLoadBalancerTlsCertificate :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificate

-- | The validation failure reason, if any, of the certificate.
--   
--   The following failure reasons are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>NO_AVAILABLE_CONTACTS</tt></b> - This failure applies to
--   email validation, which is not available for Lightsail
--   certificates.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>ADDITIONAL_VERIFICATION_REQUIRED</tt></b> - Lightsail
--   requires additional information to process this certificate request.
--   This can happen as a fraud-protection measure, such as when the domain
--   ranks within the Alexa top 1000 websites. To provide the required
--   information, use the <a>AWS Support Center</a> to contact AWS
--   Support.You cannot request a certificate for Amazon-owned domain names
--   such as those ending in amazonaws.com, cloudfront.net, or
--   elasticbeanstalk.com.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>DOMAIN_NOT_ALLOWED</tt></b> - One or more of the domain
--   names in the certificate request was reported as an unsafe domain by
--   <a>VirusTotal</a>. To correct the problem, search for your domain name
--   on the <a>VirusTotal</a> website. If your domain is reported as
--   suspicious, see <a>Google Help for Hacked Websites</a> to learn what
--   you can do.If you believe that the result is a false positive, notify
--   the organization that is reporting the domain. VirusTotal is an
--   aggregate of several antivirus and URL scanners and cannot remove your
--   domain from a block list itself. After you correct the problem and the
--   VirusTotal registry has been updated, request a new certificate.If you
--   see this error and your domain is not included in the VirusTotal list,
--   visit the <a>AWS Support Center</a> and create a case.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>INVALID_PUBLIC_DOMAIN</tt></b> - One or more of the domain
--   names in the certificate request is not valid. Typically, this is
--   because a domain name in the request is not a valid top-level domain.
--   Try to request a certificate again, correcting any spelling errors or
--   typos that were in the failed request, and ensure that all domain
--   names in the request are for valid top-level domains. For example, you
--   cannot request a certificate for <tt>example.invalidpublicdomain</tt>
--   because <tt>invalidpublicdomain</tt> is not a valid top-level
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>OTHER</tt></b> - Typically, this failure occurs when there
--   is a typographical error in one or more of the domain names in the
--   certificate request. Try to request a certificate again, correcting
--   any spelling errors or typos that were in the failed request.</li>
--   </ul>
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_failureReason :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateFailureReason)

-- | The name of the entity that is associated with the public key
--   contained in the certificate.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_subject :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The validation status of the SSL/TLS certificate. Valid values are
--   below.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_status :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateStatus)

-- | An array of strings that specify the alternate domains (e.g.,
--   <tt>example2.com</tt>) and subdomains (e.g.,
--   <tt>blog.example.com</tt>) for the certificate.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_subjectAlternativeNames :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe [Text])

-- | The resource type (e.g., <tt>LoadBalancerTlsCertificate</tt>).
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance</tt></b> - A Lightsail instance (a virtual private

--   </ul>

-- | Contains information about the domain names on an SSL/TLS certificate
--   that you will use to validate domain ownership.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption</a>
--   smart constructor.
data LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption

[$sel:domainName:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption -> Maybe Text

loadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord_type :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains information about the status of Lightsail's managed renewal
--   for the certificate.
--   
--   The renewal status of the certificate.
--   
--   The following renewal status are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>PendingAutoRenewal</tt></b> - Lightsail is attempting to
--   automatically validate the domain names in the certificate. No further
--   action is required.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>PendingValidation</tt></b> - Lightsail couldn't
--   automatically validate one or more domain names in the certificate.
--   You must take action to validate these domain names or the certificate
--   won't be renewed. If you used DNS validation, check to make sure your
--   certificate's domain validation records exist in your domain's DNS,
--   and that your certificate remains in use.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Success</tt></b> - All domain names in the certificate are
--   validated, and Lightsail renewed the certificate. No further action is
--   required.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Failed</tt></b> - One or more domain names were not
--   validated before the certificate expired, and Lightsail did not renew
--   the certificate. You can request a new certificate using the
--   <tt>CreateCertificate</tt> action.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary</a> smart
--   constructor.
data LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary
LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary' :: Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalStatus -> Maybe [LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption] -> LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary

-- | The renewal status of the certificate.
--   
--   The following renewal status are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>PendingAutoRenewal</tt></b> - Lightsail is attempting to
--   automatically validate the domain names of the certificate. No further
--   action is required.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>PendingValidation</tt></b> - Lightsail couldn't
--   automatically validate one or more domain names of the certificate.
--   You must take action to validate these domain names or the certificate
--   won't be renewed. Check to make sure your certificate's domain
--   validation records exist in your domain's DNS, and that your
--   certificate remains in use.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Success</tt></b> - All domain names in the certificate are
--   validated, and Lightsail renewed the certificate. No further action is
--   required.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Failed</tt></b> - One or more domain names were not
--   validated before the certificate expired, and Lightsail did not renew
--   the certificate. You can request a new certificate using the
--   <tt>CreateCertificate</tt> action.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:renewalStatus:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary -> Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalStatus

-- | Contains information about the validation of each domain name in the
--   certificate, as it pertains to Lightsail's managed renewal. This is
--   different from the initial validation that occurs as a result of the
--   RequestCertificate request.
[$sel:domainValidationOptions:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary -> Maybe [LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption]

-- | Create a value of <a>LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:renewalStatus:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary_renewalStatus</a> - The
--   renewal status of the certificate.
--   
--   The following renewal status are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>PendingAutoRenewal</tt></b> - Lightsail is attempting to
--   automatically validate the domain names of the certificate. No further
--   action is required.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>PendingValidation</tt></b> - Lightsail couldn't
--   automatically validate one or more domain names of the certificate.
--   You must take action to validate these domain names or the certificate
--   won't be renewed. Check to make sure your certificate's domain
--   validation records exist in your domain's DNS, and that your
--   certificate remains in use.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Success</tt></b> - All domain names in the certificate are
--   validated, and Lightsail renewed the certificate. No further action is
--   required.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Failed</tt></b> - One or more domain names were not
--   validated before the certificate expired, and Lightsail did not renew
--   the certificate. You can request a new certificate using the
--   <tt>CreateCertificate</tt> action.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainValidationOptions:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary_domainValidationOptions</a>
--   - Contains information about the validation of each domain name in the
--   certificate, as it pertains to Lightsail's managed renewal. This is
--   different from the initial validation that occurs as a result of the
--   RequestCertificate request.
newLoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary

-- | The renewal status of the certificate.
--   
--   The following renewal status are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>PendingAutoRenewal</tt></b> - Lightsail is attempting to
--   automatically validate the domain names of the certificate. No further
--   action is required.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>PendingValidation</tt></b> - Lightsail couldn't
--   automatically validate one or more domain names of the certificate.
--   You must take action to validate these domain names or the certificate
--   won't be renewed. Check to make sure your certificate's domain
--   validation records exist in your domain's DNS, and that your
--   certificate remains in use.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Success</tt></b> - All domain names in the certificate are
--   validated, and Lightsail renewed the certificate. No further action is
--   required.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Failed</tt></b> - One or more domain names were not
--   validated before the certificate expired, and Lightsail did not renew
--   the certificate. You can request a new certificate using the
--   <tt>CreateCertificate</tt> action.</li>
--   </ul>
loadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary_renewalStatus :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary (Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalStatus)

-- | Contains information about the validation of each domain name in the
--   certificate, as it pertains to Lightsail's managed renewal. This is
--   different from the initial validation that occurs as a result of the
--   RequestCertificate request.
loadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary_domainValidationOptions :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary (Maybe [LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption])

-- | Provides a summary of SSL/TLS certificate metadata.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary</a> smart
--   constructor.
data LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary
LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary

-- | When <tt>true</tt>, the SSL/TLS certificate is attached to the
--   Lightsail load balancer.
[$sel:isAttached:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the SSL/TLS certificate.
[$sel:name:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:isAttached:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary_isAttached</a> - When
--   <tt>true</tt>, the SSL/TLS certificate is attached to the Lightsail
--   load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary_name</a> - The name of the
--   SSL/TLS certificate.
newLoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary

-- | When <tt>true</tt>, the SSL/TLS certificate is attached to the
--   Lightsail load balancer.
loadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary_isAttached :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the SSL/TLS certificate.
loadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary_name :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes resource being monitored by an alarm.

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMonitoredResourceInfo</a> smart constructor.
data MonitoredResourceInfo

--   
--   Instances, load balancers, and relational databases are the only
--   Lightsail resources that can currently be monitored by alarms.

--   type of the resource being monitored.

--   Lightsail resources that can currently be monitored by alarms.

--   the resource being monitored.

-- | Describes the API operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOperation</a> smart constructor.
data Operation
Operation' :: Maybe OperationStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe OperationType -> Maybe Bool -> Operation

-- | The status of the operation.
[$sel:status:Operation'] :: Operation -> Maybe OperationStatus

-- | Details about the operation (e.g., <tt>Debian-1GB-Ohio-1</tt>).
[$sel:operationDetails:Operation'] :: Operation -> Maybe Text

-- | The resource type.
[$sel:resourceType:Operation'] :: Operation -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | The timestamp when the operation was initialized (e.g.,
--   <tt>1479816991.349</tt>).
[$sel:createdAt:Operation'] :: Operation -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The resource name.
[$sel:resourceName:Operation'] :: Operation -> Maybe Text

-- | The AWS Region and Availability Zone.
[$sel:location:Operation'] :: Operation -> Maybe ResourceLocation

-- | The timestamp when the status was changed (e.g.,
--   <tt>1479816991.349</tt>).
[$sel:statusChangedAt:Operation'] :: Operation -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The error details.
[$sel:errorDetails:Operation'] :: Operation -> Maybe Text

-- | The error code.
[$sel:errorCode:Operation'] :: Operation -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the operation.
[$sel:id:Operation'] :: Operation -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of operation.
[$sel:operationType:Operation'] :: Operation -> Maybe OperationType

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the operation is terminal.
[$sel:isTerminal:Operation'] :: Operation -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>Operation</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Operation'</a>, <a>operation_status</a> - The status of
--   the operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:operationDetails:Operation'</a>,
--   <a>operation_operationDetails</a> - Details about the operation (e.g.,
--   <tt>Debian-1GB-Ohio-1</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:Operation'</a>, <a>operation_resourceType</a> -
--   The resource type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Operation'</a>, <a>operation_createdAt</a> - The
--   timestamp when the operation was initialized (e.g.,
--   <tt>1479816991.349</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceName:Operation'</a>, <a>operation_resourceName</a> -
--   The resource name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:Operation'</a>, <a>operation_location</a> - The AWS
--   Region and Availability Zone.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusChangedAt:Operation'</a>,
--   <a>operation_statusChangedAt</a> - The timestamp when the status was
--   changed (e.g., <tt>1479816991.349</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorDetails:Operation'</a>, <a>operation_errorDetails</a> -
--   The error details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorCode:Operation'</a>, <a>operation_errorCode</a> - The
--   error code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Operation'</a>, <a>operation_id</a> - The ID of the
--   operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:operationType:Operation'</a>, <a>operation_operationType</a> -
--   The type of operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isTerminal:Operation'</a>, <a>operation_isTerminal</a> - A
--   Boolean value indicating whether the operation is terminal.
newOperation :: Operation

-- | The status of the operation.
operation_status :: Lens' Operation (Maybe OperationStatus)

-- | Details about the operation (e.g., <tt>Debian-1GB-Ohio-1</tt>).
operation_operationDetails :: Lens' Operation (Maybe Text)

--   <tt>1479816991.349</tt>).
operation_createdAt :: Lens' Operation (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The resource name.
operation_resourceName :: Lens' Operation (Maybe Text)

-- | The AWS Region and Availability Zone.

--   <tt>1479816991.349</tt>).
operation_statusChangedAt :: Lens' Operation (Maybe UTCTime)

operation_isTerminal :: Lens' Operation (Maybe Bool)

-- | Describes the origin resource of an Amazon Lightsail content delivery
--   network (CDN) distribution.
--   
--   An origin can be a Lightsail instance or load balancer. A distribution
--   pulls content from an origin, caches it, and serves it to viewers via
--   a worldwide network of edge servers.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOrigin</a> smart constructor.
data Origin
Origin' :: Maybe RegionName -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe OriginProtocolPolicyEnum -> Origin

-- | The AWS Region name of the origin resource.
[$sel:regionName:Origin'] :: Origin -> Maybe RegionName

-- | The resource type of the origin resource (e.g., <i>Instance</i>).
[$sel:resourceType:Origin'] :: Origin -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | The name of the origin resource.
[$sel:name:Origin'] :: Origin -> Maybe Text

-- | The protocol that your Amazon Lightsail distribution uses when
--   establishing a connection with your origin to pull content.
[$sel:protocolPolicy:Origin'] :: Origin -> Maybe OriginProtocolPolicyEnum

-- | Create a value of <a>Origin</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:regionName:Origin'</a>, <a>origin_regionName</a> - The AWS
--   Region name of the origin resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:Origin'</a>, <a>origin_resourceType</a> - The
--   resource type of the origin resource (e.g., <i>Instance</i>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Origin'</a>, <a>origin_name</a> - The name of the origin
--   resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protocolPolicy:Origin'</a>, <a>origin_protocolPolicy</a> - The
--   protocol that your Amazon Lightsail distribution uses when
--   establishing a connection with your origin to pull content.
newOrigin :: Origin

-- | The AWS Region name of the origin resource.
origin_regionName :: Lens' Origin (Maybe RegionName)

-- | The resource type of the origin resource (e.g., <i>Instance</i>).
origin_resourceType :: Lens' Origin (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The name of the origin resource.
origin_name :: Lens' Origin (Maybe Text)

-- | The protocol that your Amazon Lightsail distribution uses when
--   establishing a connection with your origin to pull content.
origin_protocolPolicy :: Lens' Origin (Maybe OriginProtocolPolicyEnum)

-- | The password data for the Windows Server-based instance, including the
--   ciphertext and the key pair name.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPasswordData</a> smart constructor.
data PasswordData
PasswordData' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> PasswordData

-- | The name of the key pair that you used when creating your instance. If
--   no key pair name was specified when creating the instance, Lightsail
--   uses the default key pair (<tt>LightsailDefaultKeyPair</tt>).
--   
--   If you are using a custom key pair, you need to use your own means of
--   decrypting your password using the <tt>ciphertext</tt>. Lightsail
--   creates the ciphertext by encrypting your password with the public key
--   part of this key pair.
[$sel:keyPairName:PasswordData'] :: PasswordData -> Maybe Text

-- | The encrypted password. Ciphertext will be an empty string if access
--   to your new instance is not ready yet. When you create an instance, it
--   can take up to 15 minutes for the instance to be ready.
--   
--   If you use the default key pair (<tt>LightsailDefaultKeyPair</tt>),
--   the decrypted password will be available in the password field.
--   
--   If you are using a custom key pair, you need to use your own means of
--   decryption.
--   
--   If you change the Administrator password on the instance, Lightsail
--   will continue to return the original ciphertext value. When accessing
--   the instance using RDP, you need to manually enter the Administrator
--   password after changing it from the default.
[$sel:ciphertext:PasswordData'] :: PasswordData -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PasswordData</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyPairName:PasswordData'</a>, <a>passwordData_keyPairName</a>
--   - The name of the key pair that you used when creating your instance.
--   If no key pair name was specified when creating the instance,
--   Lightsail uses the default key pair
--   (<tt>LightsailDefaultKeyPair</tt>).
--   
--   If you are using a custom key pair, you need to use your own means of
--   decrypting your password using the <tt>ciphertext</tt>. Lightsail
--   creates the ciphertext by encrypting your password with the public key
--   part of this key pair.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ciphertext:PasswordData'</a>, <a>passwordData_ciphertext</a> -
--   The encrypted password. Ciphertext will be an empty string if access
--   to your new instance is not ready yet. When you create an instance, it
--   can take up to 15 minutes for the instance to be ready.
--   
--   If you use the default key pair (<tt>LightsailDefaultKeyPair</tt>),
--   the decrypted password will be available in the password field.
--   
--   If you are using a custom key pair, you need to use your own means of
--   decryption.
--   
--   If you change the Administrator password on the instance, Lightsail
--   will continue to return the original ciphertext value. When accessing
--   the instance using RDP, you need to manually enter the Administrator
--   password after changing it from the default.
newPasswordData :: PasswordData

-- | The name of the key pair that you used when creating your instance. If
--   no key pair name was specified when creating the instance, Lightsail
--   uses the default key pair (<tt>LightsailDefaultKeyPair</tt>).
--   
--   If you are using a custom key pair, you need to use your own means of
--   decrypting your password using the <tt>ciphertext</tt>. Lightsail
--   creates the ciphertext by encrypting your password with the public key
--   part of this key pair.
passwordData_keyPairName :: Lens' PasswordData (Maybe Text)

-- | The encrypted password. Ciphertext will be an empty string if access
--   to your new instance is not ready yet. When you create an instance, it
--   can take up to 15 minutes for the instance to be ready.
--   
--   If you use the default key pair (<tt>LightsailDefaultKeyPair</tt>),
--   the decrypted password will be available in the password field.
--   
--   If you are using a custom key pair, you need to use your own means of
--   decryption.
--   
--   If you change the Administrator password on the instance, Lightsail
--   will continue to return the original ciphertext value. When accessing
--   the instance using RDP, you need to manually enter the Administrator
--   password after changing it from the default.
passwordData_ciphertext :: Lens' PasswordData (Maybe Text)
