--   values using quotation marks and commas, for example:
--   <tt>["MyFirstInstance","MySecondInstance"]</tt>
[$sel:instanceNames:CreateInstances'] :: CreateInstances -> [Text]

-- | The Availability Zone in which to create your instance. Use the
--   following format: <tt>us-east-2a</tt> (case sensitive). You can get a
--   list of Availability Zones by using the <a>get regions</a> operation.
--   Be sure to add the <tt>include Availability Zones</tt> parameter to
--   your request.
[$sel:availabilityZone:CreateInstances'] :: CreateInstances -> Text

-- | The ID for a virtual private server image (e.g.,
--   <tt>app_wordpress_4_4</tt> or <tt>app_lamp_7_0</tt>). Use the <tt>get
--   blueprints</tt> operation to return a list of available images (or
--   <i>blueprints</i>).
--   
--   Use active blueprints when creating new instances. Inactive blueprints
--   are listed to support customers with existing instances and are not
--   necessarily available to create new instances. Blueprints are marked
--   inactive when they become outdated due to operating system updates or
--   new application releases.
[$sel:blueprintId:CreateInstances'] :: CreateInstances -> Text

-- | Creates an Amazon Lightsail content delivery network (CDN)
--   distribution.
--   
--   A distribution is a globally distributed network of caching servers
--   that improve the performance of your website or web application hosted
--   on a Lightsail instance. For more information, see <a>Content delivery
--   networks in Amazon Lightsail</a>.
module Amazonka.Lightsail.CreateDistribution

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateDistribution</a> smart constructor.
data CreateDistribution
CreateDistribution' :: Maybe CacheSettings -> Maybe IpAddressType -> Maybe [CacheBehaviorPerPath] -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> InputOrigin -> CacheBehavior -> Text -> CreateDistribution

-- | An object that describes the cache behavior settings for the
--   distribution.
[$sel:cacheBehaviorSettings:CreateDistribution'] :: CreateDistribution -> Maybe CacheSettings

-- | The IP address type for the distribution.
--   
--   The possible values are <tt>ipv4</tt> for IPv4 only, and
--   <tt>dualstack</tt> for IPv4 and IPv6.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>dualstack</tt>.
[$sel:ipAddressType:CreateDistribution'] :: CreateDistribution -> Maybe IpAddressType

-- | An array of objects that describe the per-path cache behavior for the
--   distribution.
[$sel:cacheBehaviors:CreateDistribution'] :: CreateDistribution -> Maybe [CacheBehaviorPerPath]

-- | The tag keys and optional values to add to the distribution during
--   create.
--   
--   Use the <tt>TagResource</tt> action to tag a resource after it's
--   created.
[$sel:tags:CreateDistribution'] :: CreateDistribution -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The name for the distribution.
[$sel:distributionName:CreateDistribution'] :: CreateDistribution -> Text

-- | An object that describes the origin resource for the distribution,
--   such as a Lightsail instance or load balancer.
--   
--   The distribution pulls, caches, and serves content from the origin.
[$sel:origin:CreateDistribution'] :: CreateDistribution -> InputOrigin

-- | An object that describes the default cache behavior for the
--   distribution.
[$sel:defaultCacheBehavior:CreateDistribution'] :: CreateDistribution -> CacheBehavior

-- | The bundle ID to use for the distribution.
--   
--   A distribution bundle describes the specifications of your
--   distribution, such as the monthly cost and monthly network transfer
--   quota.
--   
--   Use the <tt>GetDistributionBundles</tt> action to get a list of
--   distribution bundle IDs that you can specify.
[$sel:bundleId:CreateDistribution'] :: CreateDistribution -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateDistribution</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

-- | Creates a snapshot of a block storage disk. You can use snapshots for
--   backups, to make copies of disks, and to save data before shutting
--   down a Lightsail instance.
--   
--   You can take a snapshot of an attached disk that is in use; however,
--   snapshots only capture data that has been written to your disk at the
--   time the snapshot command is issued. This may exclude any data that
--   has been cached by any applications or the operating system. If you
--   can pause any file systems on the disk long enough to take a snapshot,
--   your snapshot should be complete. Nevertheless, if you cannot pause
--   all file writes to the disk, you should unmount the disk from within
--   the Lightsail instance, issue the create disk snapshot command, and
--   then remount the disk to ensure a consistent and complete snapshot.
--   You may remount and use your disk while the snapshot status is
--   pending.
--   
--   You can also use this operation to create a snapshot of an instance's
--   system volume. You might want to do this, for example, to recover data
--   from the system volume of a botched instance or to create a backup of
--   the system volume like you would for a block storage disk. To create a
--   snapshot of a system volume, just define the <tt>instance name</tt>
--   parameter when issuing the snapshot command, and a snapshot of the
--   defined instance's system volume will be created. After the snapshot
--   is available, you can create a block storage disk from the snapshot
--   and attach it to a running instance to access the data on the disk.
--   
--   The <tt>create disk snapshot</tt> operation supports tag-based access
--   control via request tags. For more information, see the <a>Amazon
--   Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
module Amazonka.Lightsail.CreateDiskSnapshot

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateDiskSnapshot</a> smart constructor.

--   parameters are mutually exclusive.

-- | The unique name of the source instance (e.g.,
--   <tt>Amazon_Linux-512MB-Virginia-1</tt>). When this is defined, a
--   snapshot of the instance's system volume is created.

--   This parameter cannot be defined together with the <tt>disk name</tt>
--   parameter. The <tt>instance name</tt> and <tt>disk name</tt>

-- | Creates a block storage disk from a manual or automatic snapshot of a
--   disk. The resulting disk can be attached to an Amazon Lightsail
--   instance in the same Availability Zone (e.g., <tt>us-east-2a</tt>).
--   
--   The <tt>create disk from snapshot</tt> operation supports tag-based
--   access control via request tags and resource tags applied to the
--   resource identified by <tt>disk snapshot name</tt>. For more
--   information, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
module Amazonka.Lightsail.CreateDiskFromSnapshot

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateDiskFromSnapshot</a> smart constructor.
data CreateDiskFromSnapshot
CreateDiskFromSnapshot' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [AddOnRequest] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> Int -> CreateDiskFromSnapshot

-- | A Boolean value to indicate whether to use the latest available
--   automatic snapshot.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This parameter cannot be defined together with the <tt>restore
--   date</tt> parameter. The <tt>use latest restorable auto snapshot</tt>
--   and <tt>restore date</tt> parameters are mutually exclusive.</li>
--   <li>Define this parameter only when creating a new disk from an
--   automatic snapshot. For more information, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:useLatestRestorableAutoSnapshot:CreateDiskFromSnapshot'] :: CreateDiskFromSnapshot -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the source disk from which the source automatic snapshot
--   was created.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This parameter cannot be defined together with the <tt>disk
--   snapshot name</tt> parameter. The <tt>source disk name</tt> and
--   <tt>disk snapshot name</tt> parameters are mutually exclusive.</li>

--   automatic snapshot. For more information, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.</li>
--   </ul>

--   disk.

--   to create the new storage disk.
--

--   <ul>
--   <li>This parameter cannot be defined together with the <tt>source disk
--   name</tt> parameter. The <tt>disk snapshot name</tt> and <tt>source
--   disk name</tt> parameters are mutually exclusive.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:diskSnapshotName:CreateDiskFromSnapshot'] :: CreateDiskFromSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The date of the automatic snapshot to use for the new disk. Use the
--   <tt>get auto snapshots</tt> operation to identify the dates of the
--   available automatic snapshots.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be specified in <tt>YYYY-MM-DD</tt> format.</li>

--   restorable auto snapshot</tt> parameter. The <tt>restore date</tt> and
--   <tt>use latest restorable auto snapshot</tt> parameters are mutually
--   exclusive.</li>

--   Developer Guide</a>.</li>

-- | Creates a block storage disk that can be attached to an Amazon
--   Lightsail instance in the same Availability Zone (e.g.,
--   <tt>us-east-2a</tt>).
--   
--   The <tt>create disk</tt> operation supports tag-based access control
--   via request tags. For more information, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
module Amazonka.Lightsail.CreateDisk

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateDisk</a> smart constructor.
data CreateDisk
CreateDisk' :: Maybe [AddOnRequest] -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> Int -> CreateDisk

-- | An array of objects that represent the add-ons to enable for the new
--   disk.
[$sel:addOns:CreateDisk'] :: CreateDisk -> Maybe [AddOnRequest]

-- | The tag keys and optional values to add to the resource during create.
--   
--   Use the <tt>TagResource</tt> action to tag a resource after it's
--   created.
[$sel:tags:CreateDisk'] :: CreateDisk -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The unique Lightsail disk name (e.g., <tt>my-disk</tt>).
[$sel:diskName:CreateDisk'] :: CreateDisk -> Text

-- | The Availability Zone where you want to create the disk (e.g.,
--   <tt>us-east-2a</tt>). Use the same Availability Zone as the Lightsail
--   instance to which you want to attach the disk.
--   
--   Use the <tt>get regions</tt> operation to list the Availability Zones
--   where Lightsail is currently available.
[$sel:availabilityZone:CreateDisk'] :: CreateDisk -> Text

-- | The size of the disk in GB (e.g., <tt>32</tt>).
[$sel:sizeInGb:CreateDisk'] :: CreateDisk -> Int

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding

--

--   objects that represent the add-ons to enable for the new disk.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateDisk'</a>, <a>createDisk_tags</a> - The tag keys
--   and optional values to add to the resource during create.
--   
--   Use the <tt>TagResource</tt> action to tag a resource after it's
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:diskName:CreateDisk'</a>, <a>createDisk_diskName</a> - The
--   unique Lightsail disk name (e.g., <tt>my-disk</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:CreateDisk'</a>,
--   <a>createDisk_availabilityZone</a> - The Availability Zone where you
--   want to create the disk (e.g., <tt>us-east-2a</tt>). Use the same
--   Availability Zone as the Lightsail instance to which you want to
--   attach the disk.
--   
--   Use the <tt>get regions</tt> operation to list the Availability Zones
--   where Lightsail is currently available.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInGb:CreateDisk'</a>, <a>createDisk_sizeInGb</a> - The
--   size of the disk in GB (e.g., <tt>32</tt>).
newCreateDisk :: Text -> Text -> Int -> CreateDisk

-- | An array of objects that represent the add-ons to enable for the new
--   disk.
createDisk_addOns :: Lens' CreateDisk (Maybe [AddOnRequest])

-- | The tag keys and optional values to add to the resource during create.
--   
--   Use the <tt>TagResource</tt> action to tag a resource after it's
--   created.
createDisk_tags :: Lens' CreateDisk (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The unique Lightsail disk name (e.g., <tt>my-disk</tt>).
createDisk_diskName :: Lens' CreateDisk Text

-- | The Availability Zone where you want to create the disk (e.g.,
--   <tt>us-east-2a</tt>). Use the same Availability Zone as the Lightsail
--   instance to which you want to attach the disk.
--   
--   Use the <tt>get regions</tt> operation to list the Availability Zones
--   where Lightsail is currently available.
createDisk_availabilityZone :: Lens' CreateDisk Text

-- | The size of the disk in GB (e.g., <tt>32</tt>).
createDisk_sizeInGb :: Lens' CreateDisk Int

-- | Creates a temporary set of log in credentials that you can use to log
--   in to the Docker process on your local machine. After you're logged
--   in, you can use the native Docker commands to push your local
--   container images to the container image registry of your Amazon
--   Lightsail account so that you can use them with your Lightsail
--   container service. The log in credentials expire 12 hours after they
--   are created, at which point you will need to create a new set of log
--   in credentials.
--   
--   You can only push container images to the container service registry
--   of your Lightsail account. You cannot pull container images or perform
--   any other container image management actions on the container service
--   registry.
--   
--   After you push your container images to the container image registry
--   of your Lightsail account, use the <tt>RegisterContainerImage</tt>
--   action to register the pushed images to a specific Lightsail container
--   service.
--   
--   This action is not required if you install and use the Lightsail
--   Control (lightsailctl) plugin to push container images to your
--   Lightsail container service. For more information, see <a>Pushing and
--   managing container images on your Amazon Lightsail container
--   services</a> in the <i>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</i>.
module Amazonka.Lightsail.CreateContainerServiceRegistryLogin

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateContainerServiceRegistryLogin</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CreateContainerServiceRegistryLogin
CreateContainerServiceRegistryLogin' :: CreateContainerServiceRegistryLogin

--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.
newCreateContainerServiceRegistryLogin :: CreateContainerServiceRegistryLogin

--   smart constructor.

--   service registry of your Lightsail account.

-- | Creates a deployment for your Amazon Lightsail container service.
--   
--   A deployment specifies the containers that will be launched on the
--   container service and their settings, such as the ports to open, the
--   environment variables to apply, and the launch command to run. It also
--   specifies the container that will serve as the public endpoint of the
--   deployment and its settings, such as the HTTP or HTTPS port to use,
--   and the health check configuration.
--   
--   You can deploy containers to your container service using container
--   images from a public registry like Docker Hub, or from your local
--   machine. For more information, see <a>Creating container images for
--   your Amazon Lightsail container services</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Lightsail Developer Guide</i>.
module Amazonka.Lightsail.CreateContainerServiceDeployment

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateContainerServiceDeployment</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CreateContainerServiceDeployment
CreateContainerServiceDeployment' :: Maybe EndpointRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Container) -> Text -> CreateContainerServiceDeployment

-- | An object that describes the settings of the public endpoint for the
--   container service.
[$sel:publicEndpoint:CreateContainerServiceDeployment'] :: CreateContainerServiceDeployment -> Maybe EndpointRequest

-- | An object that describes the settings of the containers that will be
--   launched on the container service.
[$sel:containers:CreateContainerServiceDeployment'] :: CreateContainerServiceDeployment -> Maybe (HashMap Text Container)

-- | The name of the container service for which to create the deployment.
[$sel:serviceName:CreateContainerServiceDeployment'] :: CreateContainerServiceDeployment -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateContainerServiceDeployment</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--   describes the settings of the containers that will be launched on the
--   container service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceName:CreateContainerServiceDeployment'</a>,
--   <a>createContainerServiceDeployment_serviceName</a> - The name of the
--   container service for which to create the deployment.

--   container service.

-- | Creates an Amazon Lightsail container service.
--   
--   A Lightsail container service is a compute resource to which you can
--   deploy containers. For more information, see <a>Container services in
--   Amazon Lightsail</a> in the <i>Lightsail Dev Guide</i>.
module Amazonka.Lightsail.CreateContainerService

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateContainerService</a> smart constructor.
data CreateContainerService
CreateContainerService' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest -> Text -> ContainerServicePowerName -> Natural -> CreateContainerService

-- | The public domain names to use with the container service, such as
--   <tt>example.com</tt> and <tt>www.example.com</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify up to four public domain names for a container
--   service. The domain names that you specify are used when you create a
--   deployment with a container configured as the public endpoint of your
--   container service.
--   
--   If you don't specify public domain names, then you can use the default
--   domain of the container service.
--   
--   You must create and validate an SSL/TLS certificate before you can use
--   public domain names with your container service. Use the
--   <tt>CreateCertificate</tt> action to create a certificate for the
--   public domain names you want to use with your container service.
--   
--   You can specify public domain names using a string to array map as
--   shown in the example later on this page.
[$sel:publicDomainNames:CreateContainerService'] :: CreateContainerService -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | The tag keys and optional values to add to the certificate during
--   create.
--   
--   Use the <tt>TagResource</tt> action to tag a resource after it's
--   created.
--   
--   For more information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon
--   Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:tags:CreateContainerService'] :: CreateContainerService -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | An object that describes a deployment for the container service.
--   
--   A deployment specifies the containers that will be launched on the
--   container service and their settings, such as the ports to open, the
--   environment variables to apply, and the launch command to run. It also
--   specifies the container that will serve as the public endpoint of the
--   deployment and its settings, such as the HTTP or HTTPS port to use,
--   and the health check configuration.
[$sel:deployment:CreateContainerService'] :: CreateContainerService -> Maybe ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest

-- | The name for the container service.
--   
--   The name that you specify for your container service will make up part
--   of its default domain. The default domain of a container service is
--   typically
--   <tt>https://&lt;ServiceName&gt;.&lt;RandomGUID&gt;.&lt;AWSRegion&gt;.cs.amazonlightsail.com</tt>.
--   If the name of your container service is <tt>container-service-1</tt>,
--   and it's located in the US East (Ohio) AWS region
--   (<tt>us-east-2</tt>), then the domain for your container service will
--   be like the following example:
--   <tt>https://container-service-1.ur4EXAMPLE2uq.us-east-2.cs.amazonlightsail.com</tt>
--   
--   The following are the requirements for container service names:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be unique within each AWS Region in your Lightsail
--   account.</li>
--   <li>Must contain 1 to 63 characters.</li>
--   <li>Must contain only alphanumeric characters and hyphens.</li>
--   <li>A hyphen (-) can separate words but cannot be at the start or end
--   of the name.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:serviceName:CreateContainerService'] :: CreateContainerService -> Text

-- | The power specification for the container service.
--   
--   The power specifies the amount of memory, vCPUs, and base monthly cost
--   of each node of the container service. The <tt>power</tt> and
--   <tt>scale</tt> of a container service makes up its configured
--   capacity. To determine the monthly price of your container service,
--   multiply the base price of the <tt>power</tt> with the <tt>scale</tt>
--   (the number of nodes) of the service.
--   
--   Use the <tt>GetContainerServicePowers</tt> action to get a list of
--   power options that you can specify using this parameter, and their
--   base monthly cost.
[$sel:power:CreateContainerService'] :: CreateContainerService -> ContainerServicePowerName

-- | The scale specification for the container service.
--   
--   The scale specifies the allocated compute nodes of the container
--   service. The <tt>power</tt> and <tt>scale</tt> of a container service
--   makes up its configured capacity. To determine the monthly price of
--   your container service, multiply the base price of the <tt>power</tt>
--   with the <tt>scale</tt> (the number of nodes) of the service.
[$sel:scale:CreateContainerService'] :: CreateContainerService -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateContainerService</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding

--   (the number of nodes) of the service.
--   
--   Use the <tt>GetContainerServicePowers</tt> action to get a list of
--   power options that you can specify using this parameter, and their
--   base monthly cost.
createContainerService_power :: Lens' CreateContainerService ContainerServicePowerName

-- | The scale specification for the container service.
--   
--   The scale specifies the allocated compute nodes of the container
--   service. The <tt>power</tt> and <tt>scale</tt> of a container service
--   makes up its configured capacity. To determine the monthly price of
--   your container service, multiply the base price of the <tt>power</tt>
--   with the <tt>scale</tt> (the number of nodes) of the service.
createContainerService_scale :: Lens' CreateContainerService Natural

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateContainerServiceResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CreateContainerServiceResponse
CreateContainerServiceResponse' :: Maybe ContainerService -> Int -> CreateContainerServiceResponse

-- | An object that describes a container service.
[$sel:containerService:CreateContainerServiceResponse'] :: CreateContainerServiceResponse -> Maybe ContainerService

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CreateContainerServiceResponse'] :: CreateContainerServiceResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateContainerServiceResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--

-- | Creates an email or SMS text message contact method.
--   
--   A contact method is used to send you notifications about your Amazon
--   Lightsail resources. You can add one email address and one mobile
--   phone number contact method in each AWS Region. However, SMS text
--   messaging is not supported in some AWS Regions, and SMS text messages
--   cannot be sent to some countries/regions. For more information, see
--   <a>Notifications in Amazon Lightsail</a>.
module Amazonka.Lightsail.CreateContactMethod

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateContactMethod</a> smart constructor.
data CreateContactMethod
CreateContactMethod' :: ContactProtocol -> Text -> CreateContactMethod

-- | The protocol of the contact method, such as <tt>Email</tt> or
--   <tt>SMS</tt> (text messaging).
--   
--   The <tt>SMS</tt> protocol is supported only in the following AWS
--   Regions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>US East (N. Virginia) (<tt>us-east-1</tt>)</li>
--   <li>US West (Oregon) (<tt>us-west-2</tt>)</li>
--   <li>Europe (Ireland) (<tt>eu-west-1</tt>)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Tokyo) (<tt>ap-northeast-1</tt>)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Singapore) (<tt>ap-southeast-1</tt>)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Sydney) (<tt>ap-southeast-2</tt>)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For a list of countries/regions where SMS text messages can be sent,
--   and the latest AWS Regions where SMS text messaging is supported, see
--   <a>Supported Regions and Countries</a> in the <i>Amazon SNS Developer
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   For more information about notifications in Amazon Lightsail, see
--   <a>Notifications in Amazon Lightsail</a>.
[$sel:protocol:CreateContactMethod'] :: CreateContactMethod -> ContactProtocol

-- | The destination of the contact method, such as an email address or a
--   mobile phone number.
--   
--   Use the E.164 format when specifying a mobile phone number. E.164 is a
--   standard for the phone number structure used for international
--   telecommunication. Phone numbers that follow this format can have a
--   maximum of 15 digits, and they are prefixed with the plus character
--   (+) and the country code. For example, a U.S. phone number in E.164
--   format would be specified as +1XXX5550100. For more information, see
--   <a>E.164</a> on <i>Wikipedia</i>.
[$sel:contactEndpoint:CreateContactMethod'] :: CreateContactMethod -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateContactMethod</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:protocol:CreateContactMethod'</a>,
--   <a>createContactMethod_protocol</a> - The protocol of the contact
--   method, such as <tt>Email</tt> or <tt>SMS</tt> (text messaging).
--   
--   The <tt>SMS</tt> protocol is supported only in the following AWS
--   Regions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>US East (N. Virginia) (<tt>us-east-1</tt>)</li>
--   <li>US West (Oregon) (<tt>us-west-2</tt>)</li>
--   <li>Europe (Ireland) (<tt>eu-west-1</tt>)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Tokyo) (<tt>ap-northeast-1</tt>)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Singapore) (<tt>ap-southeast-1</tt>)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Sydney) (<tt>ap-southeast-2</tt>)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For a list of countries/regions where SMS text messages can be sent,
--   and the latest AWS Regions where SMS text messaging is supported, see
--   <a>Supported Regions and Countries</a> in the <i>Amazon SNS Developer
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   For more information about notifications in Amazon Lightsail, see
--   <a>Notifications in Amazon Lightsail</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactEndpoint:CreateContactMethod'</a>,
--   <a>createContactMethod_contactEndpoint</a> - The destination of the
--   contact method, such as an email address or a mobile phone number.
--   
--   Use the E.164 format when specifying a mobile phone number. E.164 is a
--   standard for the phone number structure used for international
--   telecommunication. Phone numbers that follow this format can have a
--   maximum of 15 digits, and they are prefixed with the plus character
--   (+) and the country code. For example, a U.S. phone number in E.164
--   format would be specified as +1XXX5550100. For more information, see
--   <a>E.164</a> on <i>Wikipedia</i>.
newCreateContactMethod :: ContactProtocol -> Text -> CreateContactMethod

-- | The protocol of the contact method, such as <tt>Email</tt> or
--   <tt>SMS</tt> (text messaging).
--   
--   The <tt>SMS</tt> protocol is supported only in the following AWS
--   Regions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>US East (N. Virginia) (<tt>us-east-1</tt>)</li>
--   <li>US West (Oregon) (<tt>us-west-2</tt>)</li>
--   <li>Europe (Ireland) (<tt>eu-west-1</tt>)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Tokyo) (<tt>ap-northeast-1</tt>)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Singapore) (<tt>ap-southeast-1</tt>)</li>

--   mobile phone number.

--   telecommunication. Phone numbers that follow this format can have a
--   maximum of 15 digits, and they are prefixed with the plus character

--   format would be specified as +1XXX5550100. For more information, see
--   <a>E.164</a> on <i>Wikipedia</i>.
createContactMethod_contactEndpoint :: Lens' CreateContactMethod Text

-- | Creates an AWS CloudFormation stack, which creates a new Amazon EC2
--   instance from an exported Amazon Lightsail snapshot. This operation
--   results in a CloudFormation stack record that can be used to track the
--   AWS CloudFormation stack created. Use the <tt>get cloud formation
--   stack records</tt> operation to get a list of the CloudFormation
--   stacks created.
--   
--   Wait until after your new Amazon EC2 instance is created before
--   running the <tt>create cloud formation stack</tt> operation again with
--   the same export snapshot record.
module Amazonka.Lightsail.CreateCloudFormationStack

-- | Creates an SSL/TLS certificate for an Amazon Lightsail content
--   delivery network (CDN) distribution and a container service.
--   
--   After the certificate is valid, use the
--   <tt>AttachCertificateToDistribution</tt> action to use the certificate
--   and its domains with your distribution. Or use the
--   <tt>UpdateContainerService</tt> action to use the certificate and its
--   domains with your container service.
--   
--   Only certificates created in the <tt>us-east-1</tt> AWS Region can be
--   attached to Lightsail distributions. Lightsail distributions are
--   global resources that can reference an origin in any AWS Region, and
--   distribute its content globally. However, all distributions are
--   located in the <tt>us-east-1</tt> Region.
module Amazonka.Lightsail.CreateCertificate

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateCertificate</a> smart constructor.
data CreateCertificate
CreateCertificate' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> CreateCertificate

-- | An array of strings that specify the alternate domains (e.g.,
--   <tt>example2.com</tt>) and subdomains (e.g.,
--   <tt>blog.example.com</tt>) for the certificate.
--   
--   You can specify a maximum of nine alternate domains (in addition to
--   the primary domain name).
--   
--   Wildcard domain entries (e.g., <tt>*.example.com</tt>) are not
--   supported.
[$sel:subjectAlternativeNames:CreateCertificate'] :: CreateCertificate -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The tag keys and optional values to add to the certificate during
--   create.
--   
--   Use the <tt>TagResource</tt> action to tag a resource after it's
--   created.
[$sel:tags:CreateCertificate'] :: CreateCertificate -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The name for the certificate.
[$sel:certificateName:CreateCertificate'] :: CreateCertificate -> Text

-- | The domain name (e.g., <tt>example.com</tt>) for the certificate.
[$sel:domainName:CreateCertificate'] :: CreateCertificate -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateCertificate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subjectAlternativeNames:CreateCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>createCertificate_subjectAlternativeNames</a> - An array of strings
--   that specify the alternate domains (e.g., <tt>example2.com</tt>) and
--   subdomains (e.g., <tt>blog.example.com</tt>) for the certificate.
--   
--   You can specify a maximum of nine alternate domains (in addition to
--   the primary domain name).
--   
--   Wildcard domain entries (e.g., <tt>*.example.com</tt>) are not
--   supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateCertificate'</a>, <a>createCertificate_tags</a> -
--   The tag keys and optional values to add to the certificate during
--   create.
--   
--   Use the <tt>TagResource</tt> action to tag a resource after it's
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateName:CreateCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>createCertificate_certificateName</a> - The name for the
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainName:CreateCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>createCertificate_domainName</a> - The domain name (e.g.,
--   <tt>example.com</tt>) for the certificate.
newCreateCertificate :: Text -> Text -> CreateCertificate

-- | An array of strings that specify the alternate domains (e.g.,
--   <tt>example2.com</tt>) and subdomains (e.g.,
--   <tt>blog.example.com</tt>) for the certificate.
--   
--   You can specify a maximum of nine alternate domains (in addition to
--   the primary domain name).
--   
--   Wildcard domain entries (e.g., <tt>*.example.com</tt>) are not

-- | Creates a new access key for the specified Amazon Lightsail bucket.
--   Access keys consist of an access key ID and corresponding secret
--   access key.
--   
--   Access keys grant full programmatic access to the specified bucket and
--   its objects. You can have a maximum of two access keys per bucket. Use
--   the GetBucketAccessKeys action to get a list of current access keys
--   for a specific bucket. For more information about access keys, see
--   <a>Creating access keys for a bucket in Amazon Lightsail</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   The <tt>secretAccessKey</tt> value is returned only in response to the
--   <tt>CreateBucketAccessKey</tt> action. You can get a secret access key
--   only when you first create an access key; you cannot get the secret
--   access key later. If you lose the secret access key, you must create a
--   new access key.
module Amazonka.Lightsail.CreateBucketAccessKey

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateBucketAccessKey</a> smart constructor.
data CreateBucketAccessKey
CreateBucketAccessKey' :: Text -> CreateBucketAccessKey

-- | The name of the bucket that the new access key will belong to, and
--   grant access to.
[$sel:bucketName:CreateBucketAccessKey'] :: CreateBucketAccessKey -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateBucketAccessKey</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--

-- | Creates an Amazon Lightsail bucket.
--   
--   A bucket is a cloud storage resource available in the Lightsail object
--   storage service. Use buckets to store objects such as data and its
--   descriptive metadata. For more information about buckets, see
--   <a>Buckets in Amazon Lightsail</a> in the <i>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</i>.
module Amazonka.Lightsail.CreateBucket

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateBucket</a> smart constructor.
data CreateBucket
CreateBucket' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> CreateBucket

-- | A Boolean value that indicates whether to enable versioning of objects
--   in the bucket.
--   
--   For more information about versioning, see <a>Enabling and suspending
--   object versioning in a bucket in Amazon Lightsail</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Lightsail Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:enableObjectVersioning:CreateBucket'] :: CreateBucket -> Maybe Bool

-- | The tag keys and optional values to add to the bucket during creation.
--   
--   Use the TagResource action to tag the bucket after it's created.
[$sel:tags:CreateBucket'] :: CreateBucket -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The name for the bucket.
--   
--   For more information about bucket names, see <a>Bucket naming rules in
--   Amazon Lightsail</a> in the <i>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:bucketName:CreateBucket'] :: CreateBucket -> Text

-- | The ID of the bundle to use for the bucket.
--   
--   A bucket bundle specifies the monthly cost, storage space, and data
--   transfer quota for a bucket.
--   
--   Use the GetBucketBundles action to get a list of bundle IDs that you
--   can specify.
--   
--   Use the UpdateBucketBundle action to change the bundle after the
--   bucket is created.
[$sel:bundleId:CreateBucket'] :: CreateBucket -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateBucket</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>createBucket_enableObjectVersioning</a> - A Boolean value that
--   indicates whether to enable versioning of objects in the bucket.
--   
--   For more information about versioning, see <a>Enabling and suspending
--   object versioning in a bucket in Amazon Lightsail</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Lightsail Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateBucket'</a>, <a>createBucket_tags</a> - The tag
--   keys and optional values to add to the bucket during creation.
--

-- | Copies a manual snapshot of an instance or disk as another manual
--   snapshot, or copies an automatic snapshot of an instance or disk as a
--   manual snapshot. This operation can also be used to copy a manual or
--   automatic snapshot of an instance or a disk from one AWS Region to
--   another in Amazon Lightsail.
--   
--   When copying a <i>manual snapshot</i>, be sure to define the
--   <tt>source region</tt>, <tt>source snapshot name</tt>, and <tt>target
--   snapshot name</tt> parameters.
--   
--   When copying an <i>automatic snapshot</i>, be sure to define the
--   <tt>source region</tt>, <tt>source resource name</tt>, <tt>target
--   snapshot name</tt>, and either the <tt>restore date</tt> or the
--   <tt>use latest restorable auto snapshot</tt> parameters.
module Amazonka.Lightsail.CopySnapshot

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCopySnapshot</a> smart constructor.
data CopySnapshot
CopySnapshot' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> RegionName -> CopySnapshot

-- | A Boolean value to indicate whether to use the latest available
--   automatic snapshot of the specified source instance or disk.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This parameter cannot be defined together with the <tt>restore
--   date</tt> parameter. The <tt>use latest restorable auto snapshot</tt>
--   and <tt>restore date</tt> parameters are mutually exclusive.</li>
--   <li>Define this parameter only when copying an automatic snapshot as a
--   manual snapshot. For more information, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:useLatestRestorableAutoSnapshot:CopySnapshot'] :: CopySnapshot -> Maybe Bool

-- | The date of the source automatic snapshot to copy. Use the <tt>get
--   auto snapshots</tt> operation to identify the dates of the available
--   automatic snapshots.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be specified in <tt>YYYY-MM-DD</tt> format.</li>
--   <li>This parameter cannot be defined together with the <tt>use latest
--   restorable auto snapshot</tt> parameter. The <tt>restore date</tt> and
--   <tt>use latest restorable auto snapshot</tt> parameters are mutually
--   exclusive.</li>
--   <li>Define this parameter only when copying an automatic snapshot as a
--   manual snapshot. For more information, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:restoreDate:CopySnapshot'] :: CopySnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the source instance or disk from which the source
--   automatic snapshot was created.
--   
--   Constraint:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Define this parameter only when copying an automatic snapshot as a
--   manual snapshot. For more information, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:sourceResourceName:CopySnapshot'] :: CopySnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the source manual snapshot to copy.
--   
--   Constraint:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Define this parameter only when copying a manual snapshot as
--   another manual snapshot.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:sourceSnapshotName:CopySnapshot'] :: CopySnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the new manual snapshot to be created as a copy.
[$sel:targetSnapshotName:CopySnapshot'] :: CopySnapshot -> Text

-- | The AWS Region where the source manual or automatic snapshot is
--   located.
[$sel:sourceRegion:CopySnapshot'] :: CopySnapshot -> RegionName

-- | Create a value of <a>CopySnapshot</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:useLatestRestorableAutoSnapshot:CopySnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>copySnapshot_useLatestRestorableAutoSnapshot</a> - A Boolean value
--   to indicate whether to use the latest available automatic snapshot of
--   the specified source instance or disk.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This parameter cannot be defined together with the <tt>restore
--   date</tt> parameter. The <tt>use latest restorable auto snapshot</tt>
--   and <tt>restore date</tt> parameters are mutually exclusive.</li>
--   <li>Define this parameter only when copying an automatic snapshot as a
--   manual snapshot. For more information, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:restoreDate:CopySnapshot'</a>, <a>copySnapshot_restoreDate</a>
--   - The date of the source automatic snapshot to copy. Use the <tt>get
--   auto snapshots</tt> operation to identify the dates of the available
--   automatic snapshots.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be specified in <tt>YYYY-MM-DD</tt> format.</li>
--   <li>This parameter cannot be defined together with the <tt>use latest
--   restorable auto snapshot</tt> parameter. The <tt>restore date</tt> and
--   <tt>use latest restorable auto snapshot</tt> parameters are mutually
--   exclusive.</li>
--   <li>Define this parameter only when copying an automatic snapshot as a
--   manual snapshot. For more information, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceResourceName:CopySnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>copySnapshot_sourceResourceName</a> - The name of the source
--   instance or disk from which the source automatic snapshot was created.
--   
--   Constraint:
--   
--   <ul>

--   manual snapshot. For more information, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.</li>
--   </ul>

--   <a>$sel:sourceSnapshotName:CopySnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>copySnapshot_sourceSnapshotName</a> - The name of the source manual
--   snapshot to copy.
--   
--   Constraint:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Define this parameter only when copying a manual snapshot as

--   </ul>

--

--   <a>copySnapshot_sourceRegion</a> - The AWS Region where the source
--   manual or automatic snapshot is located.
newCopySnapshot :: Text -> RegionName -> CopySnapshot

-- | A Boolean value to indicate whether to use the latest available
--   automatic snapshot of the specified source instance or disk.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This parameter cannot be defined together with the <tt>restore
--   date</tt> parameter. The <tt>use latest restorable auto snapshot</tt>
--   and <tt>restore date</tt> parameters are mutually exclusive.</li>

--   </ul>
copySnapshot_useLatestRestorableAutoSnapshot :: Lens' CopySnapshot (Maybe Bool)

-- | The date of the source automatic snapshot to copy. Use the <tt>get
--   auto snapshots</tt> operation to identify the dates of the available
--   automatic snapshots.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be specified in <tt>YYYY-MM-DD</tt> format.</li>
--   <li>This parameter cannot be defined together with the <tt>use latest

--   located.

-- | Closes ports for a specific Amazon Lightsail instance.
--   
--   The <tt>CloseInstancePublicPorts</tt> action supports tag-based access
--   control via resource tags applied to the resource identified by
--   <tt>instanceName</tt>. For more information, see the <a>Amazon
--   Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.

-- | Attaches a Transport Layer Security (TLS) certificate to your load
--   balancer. TLS is just an updated, more secure version of Secure Socket
--   Layer (SSL).
--   
--   Once you create and validate your certificate, you can attach it to
--   your load balancer. You can also use this API to rotate the
--   certificates on your account. Use the
--   <tt>AttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificate</tt> action with the non-attached
--   certificate, and it will replace the existing one and become the
--   attached certificate.
--   
--   The <tt>AttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificate</tt> operation supports
--   tag-based access control via resource tags applied to the resource
--   identified by <tt>load balancer name</tt>. For more information, see
--   the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
module Amazonka.Lightsail.AttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificate

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificate</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificate
AttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificate' :: Text -> Text -> AttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificate

-- | The name of the load balancer to which you want to associate the
--   SSL/TLS certificate.
[$sel:loadBalancerName:AttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: AttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Text

-- | The name of your SSL/TLS certificate.
[$sel:certificateName:AttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: AttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificate</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:loadBalancerName:AttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>attachLoadBalancerTlsCertificate_loadBalancerName</a> - The name of
--   the load balancer to which you want to associate the SSL/TLS
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateName:AttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>attachLoadBalancerTlsCertificate_certificateName</a> - The name of
--   your SSL/TLS certificate.
newAttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificate :: Text -> Text -> AttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificate

-- | The name of the load balancer to which you want to associate the
--   SSL/TLS certificate.
attachLoadBalancerTlsCertificate_loadBalancerName :: Lens' AttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificate Text

-- | The name of your SSL/TLS certificate.
attachLoadBalancerTlsCertificate_certificateName :: Lens' AttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificate Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificateResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificateResponse
AttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificateResponse' :: Maybe [Operation] -> Int -> AttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificateResponse

-- | An array of objects that describe the result of the action, such as
--   the status of the request, the timestamp of the request, and the
--   resources affected by the request.
--   
--   These SSL/TLS certificates are only usable by Lightsail load
--   balancers. You can't get the certificate and use it for another
--   purpose.

[$sel:httpStatus:AttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificateResponse'] :: AttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificateResponse -> Int

--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>attachLoadBalancerTlsCertificateResponse_operations</a> - An array
--   of objects that describe the result of the action, such as the status
--   of the request, the timestamp of the request, and the resources
--   affected by the request.

--   balancers. You can't get the certificate and use it for another
--   purpose.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:AttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificateResponse'</a>,
--   <a>attachLoadBalancerTlsCertificateResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.
newAttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificateResponse :: Int -> AttachLoadBalancerTlsCertificateResponse

--   the status of the request, the timestamp of the request, and the
--   resources affected by the request.
--

--   balancers. You can't get the certificate and use it for another
--   purpose.

-- | Attaches one or more Lightsail instances to a load balancer.
--   
--   After some time, the instances are attached to the load balancer and
--   the health check status is available.
--   
--   The <tt>attach instances to load balancer</tt> operation supports
--   tag-based access control via resource tags applied to the resource
--   identified by <tt>load balancer name</tt>. For more information, see
--   the <a>Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
module Amazonka.Lightsail.AttachInstancesToLoadBalancer

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAttachInstancesToLoadBalancer</a> smart constructor.
data AttachInstancesToLoadBalancer
AttachInstancesToLoadBalancer' :: Text -> [Text] -> AttachInstancesToLoadBalancer

-- | The name of the load balancer.
[$sel:loadBalancerName:AttachInstancesToLoadBalancer'] :: AttachInstancesToLoadBalancer -> Text

-- | An array of strings representing the instance name(s) you want to
--   attach to your load balancer.
--   
--   An instance must be <tt>running</tt> before you can attach it to your
--   load balancer.
--   
--   There are no additional limits on the number of instances you can
--   attach to your load balancer, aside from the limit of Lightsail
--   instances you can create in your account (20).
[$sel:instanceNames:AttachInstancesToLoadBalancer'] :: AttachInstancesToLoadBalancer -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>AttachInstancesToLoadBalancer</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--   the load balancer.
--

--   strings representing the instance name(s) you want to attach to your
--   load balancer.

--   load balancer.

-- | Attaches a block storage disk to a running or stopped Lightsail
--   instance and exposes it to the instance with the specified disk name.
--   
--   The <tt>attach disk</tt> operation supports tag-based access control
--   via resource tags applied to the resource identified by <tt>disk
--   name</tt>. For more information, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer
--   Guide</a>.
module Amazonka.Lightsail.AttachDisk

--   storage disk.

-- | Attaches an SSL/TLS certificate to your Amazon Lightsail content
--   delivery network (CDN) distribution.
--   
--   After the certificate is attached, your distribution accepts HTTPS
--   traffic for all of the domains that are associated with the
--   certificate.
--   
--   Use the <tt>CreateCertificate</tt> action to create a certificate that
--   you can attach to your distribution.
--   
--   Only certificates created in the <tt>us-east-1</tt> AWS Region can be
--   attached to Lightsail distributions. Lightsail distributions are
--   global resources that can reference an origin in any AWS Region, and
--   distribute its content globally. However, all distributions are
--   located in the <tt>us-east-1</tt> Region.
module Amazonka.Lightsail.AttachCertificateToDistribution

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAttachCertificateToDistribution</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AttachCertificateToDistribution
AttachCertificateToDistribution' :: Text -> Text -> AttachCertificateToDistribution

-- | The name of the distribution that the certificate will be attached to.
--   
--   Use the <tt>GetDistributions</tt> action to get a list of distribution
--   names that you can specify.
[$sel:distributionName:AttachCertificateToDistribution'] :: AttachCertificateToDistribution -> Text

-- | The name of the certificate to attach to a distribution.
--   
--   Only certificates with a status of <tt>ISSUED</tt> can be attached to
--   a distribution.
--   
--   Use the <tt>GetCertificates</tt> action to get a list of certificate
--   names that you can specify.
--   
--   This is the name of the certificate resource type and is used only to
--   reference the certificate in other API actions. It can be different
--   than the domain name of the certificate. For example, your certificate
--   name might be <tt>WordPress-Blog-Certificate</tt> and the domain name
--   of the certificate might be <tt>example.com</tt>.
[$sel:certificateName:AttachCertificateToDistribution'] :: AttachCertificateToDistribution -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AttachCertificateToDistribution</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:distributionName:AttachCertificateToDistribution'</a>,
--   <a>attachCertificateToDistribution_distributionName</a> - The name of
--   the distribution that the certificate will be attached to.
--   
--   Use the <tt>GetDistributions</tt> action to get a list of distribution
--   names that you can specify.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateName:AttachCertificateToDistribution'</a>,
--   <a>attachCertificateToDistribution_certificateName</a> - The name of
--   the certificate to attach to a distribution.
--   
--   Only certificates with a status of <tt>ISSUED</tt> can be attached to
--   a distribution.
--   
--   Use the <tt>GetCertificates</tt> action to get a list of certificate
--   names that you can specify.
--   
--   This is the name of the certificate resource type and is used only to
--   reference the certificate in other API actions. It can be different
--   than the domain name of the certificate. For example, your certificate
--   name might be <tt>WordPress-Blog-Certificate</tt> and the domain name
--   of the certificate might be <tt>example.com</tt>.
newAttachCertificateToDistribution :: Text -> Text -> AttachCertificateToDistribution

-- | The name of the distribution that the certificate will be attached to.
--   
--   Use the <tt>GetDistributions</tt> action to get a list of distribution
--   names that you can specify.
attachCertificateToDistribution_distributionName :: Lens' AttachCertificateToDistribution Text

-- | The name of the certificate to attach to a distribution.
--   
--   Only certificates with a status of <tt>ISSUED</tt> can be attached to
--   a distribution.
--   
--   Use the <tt>GetCertificates</tt> action to get a list of certificate
--   names that you can specify.
--   
--   This is the name of the certificate resource type and is used only to
--   reference the certificate in other API actions. It can be different
--   than the domain name of the certificate. For example, your certificate
--   name might be <tt>WordPress-Blog-Certificate</tt> and the domain name
--   of the certificate might be <tt>example.com</tt>.
attachCertificateToDistribution_certificateName :: Lens' AttachCertificateToDistribution Text

-- | Deletes the specified set of tag keys and their values from the
--   specified Amazon Lightsail resource.
--   
--   The <tt>untag resource</tt> operation supports tag-based access
--   control via request tags and resource tags applied to the resource
--   identified by <tt>resource name</tt>. For more information, see the
--   <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
module Amazonka.Lightsail.UntagResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUntagResource</a> smart constructor.
data UntagResource
UntagResource' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> [Text] -> UntagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource from which you want to
--   remove a tag.
[$sel:resourceArn:UntagResource'] :: UntagResource -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the resource from which you are removing a tag.
[$sel:resourceName:UntagResource'] :: UntagResource -> Text

-- | The tag keys to delete from the specified resource.
[$sel:tagKeys:UntagResource'] :: UntagResource -> [Text]

--   omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   the resource from which you want to remove a tag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceName:UntagResource'</a>,
--   <a>untagResource_resourceName</a> - The name of the resource from
--   which you are removing a tag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagKeys:UntagResource'</a>, <a>untagResource_tagKeys</a> - The
--   tag keys to delete from the specified resource.

--   remove a tag.

-- | The name of the resource from which you are removing a tag.

-- | Updates an existing Amazon Lightsail bucket.
--   
--   Use this action to update the configuration of an existing bucket,
--   such as versioning, public accessibility, and the AWS accounts that
--   can access the bucket.
module Amazonka.Lightsail.UpdateBucket

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateBucket</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateBucket
UpdateBucket' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe AccessRules -> Maybe Text -> Text -> UpdateBucket

-- | An array of strings to specify the AWS account IDs that can access the
--   bucket.
--   
--   You can give a maximum of 10 AWS accounts access to a bucket.
[$sel:readonlyAccessAccounts:UpdateBucket'] :: UpdateBucket -> Maybe [Text]

-- | An object that sets the public accessibility of objects in the
--   specified bucket.
[$sel:accessRules:UpdateBucket'] :: UpdateBucket -> Maybe AccessRules

-- | Specifies whether to enable or suspend versioning of objects in the
--   bucket.
--   
--   The following options can be specified:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Enabled</tt> - Enables versioning of objects in the specified
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li><tt>Suspended</tt> - Suspends versioning of objects in the
--   specified bucket. Existing object versions are retained.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:versioning:UpdateBucket'] :: UpdateBucket -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the bucket to update.
[$sel:bucketName:UpdateBucket'] :: UpdateBucket -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateBucket</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:readonlyAccessAccounts:UpdateBucket'</a>,
--   <a>updateBucket_readonlyAccessAccounts</a> - An array of strings to
--   specify the AWS account IDs that can access the bucket.
--   
--   You can give a maximum of 10 AWS accounts access to a bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessRules:UpdateBucket'</a>, <a>updateBucket_accessRules</a>
--   - An object that sets the public accessibility of objects in the
--   specified bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:versioning:UpdateBucket'</a>, <a>updateBucket_versioning</a> -
--   Specifies whether to enable or suspend versioning of objects in the
--   bucket.
--   
--   The following options can be specified:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Enabled</tt> - Enables versioning of objects in the specified
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li><tt>Suspended</tt> - Suspends versioning of objects in the
--   specified bucket. Existing object versions are retained.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:UpdateBucket'</a>, <a>updateBucket_bucketName</a> -
--   The name of the bucket to update.
newUpdateBucket :: Text -> UpdateBucket

-- | An array of strings to specify the AWS account IDs that can access the
--   bucket.
--   
--   You can give a maximum of 10 AWS accounts access to a bucket.
updateBucket_readonlyAccessAccounts :: Lens' UpdateBucket (Maybe [Text])

-- | An object that sets the public accessibility of objects in the
--   specified bucket.
updateBucket_accessRules :: Lens' UpdateBucket (Maybe AccessRules)

-- | Specifies whether to enable or suspend versioning of objects in the
--   bucket.
--   
--   The following options can be specified:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Enabled</tt> - Enables versioning of objects in the specified
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li><tt>Suspended</tt> - Suspends versioning of objects in the
--   specified bucket. Existing object versions are retained.</li>
--   </ul>

-- | Updates the bundle, or storage plan, of an existing Amazon Lightsail
--   bucket.
--   
--   A bucket bundle specifies the monthly cost, storage space, and data
--   transfer quota for a bucket. You can update a bucket's bundle only one
--   time within a monthly AWS billing cycle. To determine if you can
--   update a bucket's bundle, use the GetBuckets action. The
--   <tt>ableToUpdateBundle</tt> parameter in the response will indicate
--   whether you can currently update a bucket's bundle.
--   
--   Update a bucket's bundle if it's consistently going over its storage
--   space or data transfer quota, or if a bucket's usage is consistently
--   in the lower range of its storage space or data transfer quota. Due to
--   the unpredictable usage fluctuations that a bucket might experience,
--   we strongly recommend that you update a bucket's bundle only as a
--   long-term strategy, instead of as a short-term, monthly cost-cutting
--   measure. Choose a bucket bundle that will provide the bucket with
--   ample storage space and data transfer for a long time to come.
module Amazonka.Lightsail.UpdateBucketBundle

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateBucketBundle</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateBucketBundle
UpdateBucketBundle' :: Text -> Text -> UpdateBucketBundle

-- | The name of the bucket for which to update the bundle.
[$sel:bucketName:UpdateBucketBundle'] :: UpdateBucketBundle -> Text

-- | The ID of the new bundle to apply to the bucket.
--   
--   Use the GetBucketBundles action to get a list of bundle IDs that you
--   can specify.
[$sel:bundleId:UpdateBucketBundle'] :: UpdateBucketBundle -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateBucketBundle</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:UpdateBucketBundle'</a>,
--   <a>updateBucketBundle_bucketName</a> - The name of the bucket for
--   which to update the bundle.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bundleId:UpdateBucketBundle'</a>,
--   <a>updateBucketBundle_bundleId</a> - The ID of the new bundle to apply
--   to the bucket.
--   
--   Use the GetBucketBundles action to get a list of bundle IDs that you
--   can specify.
newUpdateBucketBundle :: Text -> Text -> UpdateBucketBundle

updateBucketBundle_bucketName :: Lens' UpdateBucketBundle Text

-- | The ID of the new bundle to apply to the bucket.
--   
--   Use the GetBucketBundles action to get a list of bundle IDs that you
--   can specify.
updateBucketBundle_bundleId :: Lens' UpdateBucketBundle Text

-- | Updates the configuration of your Amazon Lightsail container service,
--   such as its power, scale, and public domain names.
module Amazonka.Lightsail.UpdateContainerService

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateContainerService</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateContainerService
UpdateContainerService' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe ContainerServicePowerName -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Text -> UpdateContainerService

-- | The scale for the container service.
--   
--   The scale specifies the allocated compute nodes of the container
--   service. The <tt>power</tt> and <tt>scale</tt> of a container service
--   makes up its configured capacity. To determine the monthly price of
--   your container service, multiply the base price of the <tt>power</tt>
--   with the <tt>scale</tt> (the number of nodes) of the service.
[$sel:scale:UpdateContainerService'] :: UpdateContainerService -> Maybe Natural

-- | The power for the container service.
--   
--   The power specifies the amount of memory, vCPUs, and base monthly cost
--   of each node of the container service. The <tt>power</tt> and
--   <tt>scale</tt> of a container service makes up its configured
--   capacity. To determine the monthly price of your container service,
--   multiply the base price of the <tt>power</tt> with the <tt>scale</tt>
--   (the number of nodes) of the service.
--   
--   Use the <tt>GetContainerServicePowers</tt> action to view the
--   specifications of each power option.
[$sel:power:UpdateContainerService'] :: UpdateContainerService -> Maybe ContainerServicePowerName

-- | A Boolean value to indicate whether the container service is disabled.
[$sel:isDisabled:UpdateContainerService'] :: UpdateContainerService -> Maybe Bool

-- | The public domain names to use with the container service, such as
--   <tt>example.com</tt> and <tt>www.example.com</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify up to four public domain names for a container
--   service. The domain names that you specify are used when you create a
--   deployment with a container configured as the public endpoint of your
--   container service.
--   
--   If you don't specify public domain names, then you can use the default
--   domain of the container service.
--   
--   You must create and validate an SSL/TLS certificate before you can use
--   public domain names with your container service. Use the
--   <tt>CreateCertificate</tt> action to create a certificate for the
--   public domain names you want to use with your container service.
--   
--   You can specify public domain names using a string to array map as
--   shown in the example later on this page.
[$sel:publicDomainNames:UpdateContainerService'] :: UpdateContainerService -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | The name of the container service to update.
[$sel:serviceName:UpdateContainerService'] :: UpdateContainerService -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateContainerService</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:scale:UpdateContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>updateContainerService_scale</a> - The scale for the container
--   service.
--   
--   The scale specifies the allocated compute nodes of the container
--   service. The <tt>power</tt> and <tt>scale</tt> of a container service
--   makes up its configured capacity. To determine the monthly price of
--   your container service, multiply the base price of the <tt>power</tt>
--   with the <tt>scale</tt> (the number of nodes) of the service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:power:UpdateContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>updateContainerService_power</a> - The power for the container
--   service.
--   
--   The power specifies the amount of memory, vCPUs, and base monthly cost
--   of each node of the container service. The <tt>power</tt> and
--   <tt>scale</tt> of a container service makes up its configured
--   capacity. To determine the monthly price of your container service,
--   multiply the base price of the <tt>power</tt> with the <tt>scale</tt>
--   (the number of nodes) of the service.
--   
--   Use the <tt>GetContainerServicePowers</tt> action to view the
--   specifications of each power option.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isDisabled:UpdateContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>updateContainerService_isDisabled</a> - A Boolean value to indicate
--   whether the container service is disabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicDomainNames:UpdateContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>updateContainerService_publicDomainNames</a> - The public domain
--   names to use with the container service, such as <tt>example.com</tt>
--   and <tt>www.example.com</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify up to four public domain names for a container
--   service. The domain names that you specify are used when you create a
--   deployment with a container configured as the public endpoint of your
--   container service.
--   
--   If you don't specify public domain names, then you can use the default

--   
--   You must create and validate an SSL/TLS certificate before you can use
--   public domain names with your container service. Use the
--   <tt>CreateCertificate</tt> action to create a certificate for the
--   public domain names you want to use with your container service.
--   
--   You can specify public domain names using a string to array map as
--   shown in the example later on this page.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceName:UpdateContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>updateContainerService_serviceName</a> - The name of the container
--   service to update.
newUpdateContainerService :: Text -> UpdateContainerService

-- | The scale for the container service.
--   
--   The scale specifies the allocated compute nodes of the container
--   service. The <tt>power</tt> and <tt>scale</tt> of a container service
--   makes up its configured capacity. To determine the monthly price of
--   your container service, multiply the base price of the <tt>power</tt>
--   with the <tt>scale</tt> (the number of nodes) of the service.

-- | Updates an existing Amazon Lightsail content delivery network (CDN)
--   distribution.
--   
--   Use this action to update the configuration of your existing
--   distribution.
module Amazonka.Lightsail.UpdateDistribution

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateDistribution</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateDistribution
UpdateDistribution' :: Maybe InputOrigin -> Maybe CacheSettings -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe CacheBehavior -> Maybe [CacheBehaviorPerPath] -> Text -> UpdateDistribution

-- | An object that describes the origin resource for the distribution,
--   such as a Lightsail instance or load balancer.
--   
--   The distribution pulls, caches, and serves content from the origin.
[$sel:origin:UpdateDistribution'] :: UpdateDistribution -> Maybe InputOrigin

-- | An object that describes the cache behavior settings for the
--   distribution.
--   
--   The <tt>cacheBehaviorSettings</tt> specified in your
--   <tt>UpdateDistributionRequest</tt> will replace your distribution's
--   existing settings.
[$sel:cacheBehaviorSettings:UpdateDistribution'] :: UpdateDistribution -> Maybe CacheSettings

-- | Indicates whether to enable the distribution.
[$sel:isEnabled:UpdateDistribution'] :: UpdateDistribution -> Maybe Bool

-- | An object that describes the default cache behavior for the
--   distribution.
[$sel:defaultCacheBehavior:UpdateDistribution'] :: UpdateDistribution -> Maybe CacheBehavior

-- | An array of objects that describe the per-path cache behavior for the
--   distribution.
[$sel:cacheBehaviors:UpdateDistribution'] :: UpdateDistribution -> Maybe [CacheBehaviorPerPath]

-- | The name of the distribution to update.
--   
--   Use the <tt>GetDistributions</tt> action to get a list of distribution
--   names that you can specify.
[$sel:distributionName:UpdateDistribution'] :: UpdateDistribution -> Text

-- | Updates the bundle of your Amazon Lightsail content delivery network
--   (CDN) distribution.
--   
--   A distribution bundle specifies the monthly network transfer quota and
--   monthly cost of your dsitribution.
--   
--   Update your distribution's bundle if your distribution is going over
--   its monthly network transfer quota and is incurring an overage fee.
--   
--   You can update your distribution's bundle only one time within your
--   monthly AWS billing cycle. To determine if you can update your
--   distribution's bundle, use the <tt>GetDistributions</tt> action. The
--   <tt>ableToUpdateBundle</tt> parameter in the result will indicate
--   whether you can currently update your distribution's bundle.
module Amazonka.Lightsail.UpdateDistributionBundle

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateDistributionBundle</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateDistributionBundle
UpdateDistributionBundle' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> UpdateDistributionBundle

-- | The bundle ID of the new bundle to apply to your distribution.
--   
--   Use the <tt>GetDistributionBundles</tt> action to get a list of
--   distribution bundle IDs that you can specify.
[$sel:bundleId:UpdateDistributionBundle'] :: UpdateDistributionBundle -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the distribution for which to update the bundle.
--   
--   Use the <tt>GetDistributions</tt> action to get a list of distribution
--   names that you can specify.
[$sel:distributionName:UpdateDistributionBundle'] :: UpdateDistributionBundle -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateDistributionBundle</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bundleId:UpdateDistributionBundle'</a>,
--   <a>updateDistributionBundle_bundleId</a> - The bundle ID of the new
--   bundle to apply to your distribution.
--   
--   Use the <tt>GetDistributionBundles</tt> action to get a list of
--   distribution bundle IDs that you can specify.
--   
--   <a>$sel:distributionName:UpdateDistributionBundle'</a>,
--   <a>updateDistributionBundle_distributionName</a> - The name of the
--   distribution for which to update the bundle.
--   
--   Use the <tt>GetDistributions</tt> action to get a list of distribution
--   names that you can specify.
newUpdateDistributionBundle :: UpdateDistributionBundle

-- | The bundle ID of the new bundle to apply to your distribution.
--   
--   Use the <tt>GetDistributionBundles</tt> action to get a list of
--   distribution bundle IDs that you can specify.

--   names that you can specify.

-- | Updates a domain recordset after it is created.
--   
--   The <tt>update domain entry</tt> operation supports tag-based access
--   control via resource tags applied to the resource identified by
--   <tt>domain name</tt>. For more information, see the <a>Amazon
--   Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
module Amazonka.Lightsail.UpdateDomainEntry

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateDomainEntry</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateDomainEntry
UpdateDomainEntry' :: Text -> DomainEntry -> UpdateDomainEntry

-- | The name of the domain recordset to update.
[$sel:domainName:UpdateDomainEntry'] :: UpdateDomainEntry -> Text

-- | An array of key-value pairs containing information about the domain
--   entry.
[$sel:domainEntry:UpdateDomainEntry'] :: UpdateDomainEntry -> DomainEntry

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateDomainEntry</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

-- | Updates the specified attribute for a load balancer. You can only

--   tag-based access control via resource tags applied to the resource
--   identified by <tt>load balancer name</tt>. For more information, see
--   the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
