-- | Allows the update of one or more attributes of a database in Amazon
--   Lightsail.
--   
--   Updates are applied immediately, or in cases where the updates could
--   result in an outage, are applied during the database's predefined
--   maintenance window.
--   
--   The <tt>update relational database</tt> operation supports tag-based
--   access control via resource tags applied to the resource identified by
--   relationalDatabaseName. For more information, see the <a>Amazon
--   Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
module Amazonka.Lightsail.UpdateRelationalDatabase

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateRelationalDatabase</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateRelationalDatabase
UpdateRelationalDatabase' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> UpdateRelationalDatabase

-- | The password for the master user. The password can include any
--   printable ASCII character except "/", """, or "@".
--   
--   My<b>SQL</b>
--   
--   Constraints: Must contain from 8 to 41 characters.
--   
--   <b>PostgreSQL</b>
--   
--   Constraints: Must contain from 8 to 128 characters.
[$sel:masterUserPassword:UpdateRelationalDatabase'] :: UpdateRelationalDatabase -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Specifies the accessibility options for your database. A value of
--   <tt>true</tt> specifies a database that is available to resources
--   outside of your Lightsail account. A value of <tt>false</tt> specifies
--   a database that is available only to your Lightsail resources in the
--   same region as your database.
[$sel:publiclyAccessible:UpdateRelationalDatabase'] :: UpdateRelationalDatabase -> Maybe Bool

-- | When <tt>true</tt>, enables automated backup retention for your
--   database.
--   
--   Updates are applied during the next maintenance window because this
--   can result in an outage.
[$sel:enableBackupRetention:UpdateRelationalDatabase'] :: UpdateRelationalDatabase -> Maybe Bool

-- | The weekly time range during which system maintenance can occur on
--   your database.
--   
--   The default is a 30-minute window selected at random from an 8-hour
--   block of time for each AWS Region, occurring on a random day of the
--   week.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be in the <tt>ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi</tt> format.</li>
--   <li>Valid days: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun.</li>
--   <li>Must be at least 30 minutes.</li>
--   <li>Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>Example: <tt>Tue:17:00-Tue:17:30</tt></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:UpdateRelationalDatabase'] :: UpdateRelationalDatabase -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates the certificate that needs to be associated with the
--   database.
[$sel:caCertificateIdentifier:UpdateRelationalDatabase'] :: UpdateRelationalDatabase -> Maybe Text

-- | The daily time range during which automated backups are created for
--   your database if automated backups are enabled.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be in the <tt>hh24:mi-hh24:mi</tt> format.Example:
--   <tt>16:00-16:30</tt></li>
--   <li>Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>Must not conflict with the preferred maintenance window.</li>
--   <li>Must be at least 30 minutes.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:preferredBackupWindow:UpdateRelationalDatabase'] :: UpdateRelationalDatabase -> Maybe Text

-- | When <tt>true</tt>, applies changes immediately. When <tt>false</tt>,
--   applies changes during the preferred maintenance window. Some changes
--   may cause an outage.
--   
--   Default: <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:applyImmediately:UpdateRelationalDatabase'] :: UpdateRelationalDatabase -> Maybe Bool

-- | When <tt>true</tt>, the master user password is changed to a new
--   strong password generated by Lightsail.
--   
--   Use the <tt>get relational database master user password</tt>
--   operation to get the new password.
[$sel:rotateMasterUserPassword:UpdateRelationalDatabase'] :: UpdateRelationalDatabase -> Maybe Bool

-- | When <tt>true</tt>, disables automated backup retention for your
--   database.
--   
--   Disabling backup retention deletes all automated database backups.
--   Before disabling this, you may want to create a snapshot of your
--   database using the <tt>create relational database snapshot</tt>
--   operation.
--   
--   Updates are applied during the next maintenance window because this
--   can result in an outage.
[$sel:disableBackupRetention:UpdateRelationalDatabase'] :: UpdateRelationalDatabase -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of your Lightsail database resource to update.
[$sel:relationalDatabaseName:UpdateRelationalDatabase'] :: UpdateRelationalDatabase -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateRelationalDatabase</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:masterUserPassword:UpdateRelationalDatabase'</a>,
--   <a>updateRelationalDatabase_masterUserPassword</a> - The password for
--   the master user. The password can include any printable ASCII
--   character except "/", """, or "@".
--   
--   My<b>SQL</b>
--   
--   Constraints: Must contain from 8 to 41 characters.
--   
--   <b>PostgreSQL</b>
--   
--   Constraints: Must contain from 8 to 128 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publiclyAccessible:UpdateRelationalDatabase'</a>,
--   <a>updateRelationalDatabase_publiclyAccessible</a> - Specifies the
--   accessibility options for your database. A value of <tt>true</tt>
--   specifies a database that is available to resources outside of your
--   Lightsail account. A value of <tt>false</tt> specifies a database that
--   is available only to your Lightsail resources in the same region as
--   your database.
--

--   <li>Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).</li>

--   <li>Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>Must not conflict with the preferred maintenance window.</li>

-- | Allows the update of one or more parameters of a database in Amazon
--   Lightsail.
--   
--   Parameter updates don't cause outages; therefore, their application is
--   not subject to the preferred maintenance window. However, there are
--   two ways in which parameter updates are applied: <tt>dynamic</tt> or
--   <tt>pending-reboot</tt>. Parameters marked with a <tt>dynamic</tt>
--   apply type are applied immediately. Parameters marked with a
--   <tt>pending-reboot</tt> apply type are applied only after the database
--   is rebooted using the <tt>reboot relational database</tt> operation.
--   
--   The <tt>update relational database parameters</tt> operation supports
--   tag-based access control via resource tags applied to the resource
--   identified by relationalDatabaseName. For more information, see the
--   <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
module Amazonka.Lightsail.UpdateRelationalDatabaseParameters

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateRelationalDatabaseParameters</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateRelationalDatabaseParameters
UpdateRelationalDatabaseParameters' :: Text -> [RelationalDatabaseParameter] -> UpdateRelationalDatabaseParameters

-- | The name of your database for which to update parameters.
[$sel:relationalDatabaseName:UpdateRelationalDatabaseParameters'] :: UpdateRelationalDatabaseParameters -> Text

-- | The name of your database from which to get metric data.
getRelationalDatabaseMetricData_relationalDatabaseName :: Lens' GetRelationalDatabaseMetricData Text

-- | The metric for which you want to return information.
--   
--   Valid relational database metric names are listed below, along with
--   the most useful <tt>statistics</tt> to include in your request, and
--   the published <tt>unit</tt> value. All relational database metric data
--   is available in 1-minute (60 seconds) granularity.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>CPUUtilization</tt></b> - The percentage of CPU utilization
--   currently in use on the database.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful
--   statistics are <tt>Maximum</tt> and <tt>Average</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>:
--   The published unit is <tt>Percent</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>DatabaseConnections</tt></b> - The number of database
--   connections in use.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistics are
--   <tt>Maximum</tt> and <tt>Sum</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is
--   <tt>Count</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>DiskQueueDepth</tt></b> - The number of outstanding IOs
--   (read/write requests) that are waiting to access the
--   disk.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistic is
--   <tt>Sum</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is <tt>Count</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>FreeStorageSpace</tt></b> - The amount of available storage
--   space.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistic is
--   <tt>Sum</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is <tt>Bytes</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>NetworkReceiveThroughput</tt></b> - The incoming (Receive)
--   network traffic on the database, including both customer database
--   traffic and AWS traffic used for monitoring and
--   replication.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistic is
--   <tt>Average</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is
--   <tt>Bytes/Second</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>NetworkTransmitThroughput</tt></b> - The outgoing
--   (Transmit) network traffic on the database, including both customer
--   database traffic and AWS traffic used for monitoring and
--   replication.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistic is
--   <tt>Average</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is
--   <tt>Bytes/Second</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
getRelationalDatabaseMetricData_metricName :: Lens' GetRelationalDatabaseMetricData RelationalDatabaseMetricName

-- | The granularity, in seconds, of the returned data points.
--   
--   All relational database metric data is available in 1-minute (60
--   seconds) granularity.
getRelationalDatabaseMetricData_period :: Lens' GetRelationalDatabaseMetricData Natural

-- | The start of the time interval from which to get metric data.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>Specified in the Unix time format.For example, if you wish to use
--   a start time of October 1, 2018, at 8 PM UTC, then you input
--   <tt>1538424000</tt> as the start time.</li>
--   </ul>
getRelationalDatabaseMetricData_startTime :: Lens' GetRelationalDatabaseMetricData UTCTime

-- | The end of the time interval from which to get metric data.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>Specified in the Unix time format.For example, if you wish to use
--   an end time of October 1, 2018, at 8 PM UTC, then you input
--   <tt>1538424000</tt> as the end time.</li>
--   </ul>
getRelationalDatabaseMetricData_endTime :: Lens' GetRelationalDatabaseMetricData UTCTime

-- | The unit for the metric data request. Valid units depend on the metric
--   data being requested. For the valid units with each available metric,
--   see the <tt>metricName</tt> parameter.
getRelationalDatabaseMetricData_unit :: Lens' GetRelationalDatabaseMetricData MetricUnit

-- | The statistic for the metric.
--   
--   The following statistics are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Minimum</tt> - The lowest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine low volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Maximum</tt> - The highest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine high volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Sum</tt> - All values submitted for the matching metric added
--   together. You can use this statistic to determine the total volume of
--   a metric.</li>
--   <li><tt>Average</tt> - The value of Sum / SampleCount during the
--   specified period. By comparing this statistic with the Minimum and
--   Maximum values, you can determine the full scope of a metric and how
--   close the average use is to the Minimum and Maximum values. This
--   comparison helps you to know when to increase or decrease your
--   resources.</li>
--   <li><tt>SampleCount</tt> - The count, or number, of data points used
--   for the statistical calculation.</li>
--   </ul>
getRelationalDatabaseMetricData_statistics :: Lens' GetRelationalDatabaseMetricData [MetricStatistic]

-- | The name of the alarm to test.
testAlarm_alarmName :: Lens' TestAlarm Text

-- | The alarm state to test.
--   
--   An alarm has the following possible states that can be tested:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALARM</tt> - The metric is outside of the defined
--   threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>INSUFFICIENT_DATA</tt> - The alarm has just started, the
--   metric is not available, or not enough data is available for the
--   metric to determine the alarm state.</li>
--   <li><tt>OK</tt> - The metric is within the defined threshold.</li>
--   </ul>

-- | Specifies the accessibility options for your new database. A value of
--   <tt>true</tt> specifies a database that is available to resources
--   outside of your Lightsail account. A value of <tt>false</tt> specifies
--   a database that is available only to your Lightsail resources in the
--   same region as your database.
createRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot_publiclyAccessible :: Lens' CreateRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether your database is restored from the latest backup
--   time. A value of <tt>true</tt> restores from the latest backup time.
--   
--   Default: <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   Constraints: Cannot be specified if the <tt>restore time</tt>
--   parameter is provided.
createRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot_useLatestRestorableTime :: Lens' CreateRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot (Maybe Bool)

-- | The date and time to restore your database from.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be before the latest restorable time for the database.</li>
--   <li>Cannot be specified if the <tt>use latest restorable time</tt>
--   parameter is <tt>true</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>Specified in the Unix time format.For example, if you wish to use
--   a restore time of October 1, 2018, at 8 PM UTC, then you input
--   <tt>1538424000</tt> as the restore time.</li>
--   </ul>
createRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot_restoreTime :: Lens' CreateRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the container service for which to get metric data.
getContainerServiceMetricData_serviceName :: Lens' GetContainerServiceMetricData Text

-- | The metric for which you want to return information.
--   
--   Valid container service metric names are listed below, along with the
--   most useful statistics to include in your request, and the published
--   unit value.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>CPUUtilization</tt> - The average percentage of compute units
--   that are currently in use across all nodes of the container service.
--   This metric identifies the processing power required to run containers
--   on each node of the container service.Statistics: The most useful
--   statistics are <tt>Maximum</tt> and <tt>Average</tt>.Unit: The
--   published unit is <tt>Percent</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>MemoryUtilization</tt> - The average percentage of available
--   memory that is currently in use across all nodes of the container
--   service. This metric identifies the memory required to run containers
--   on each node of the container service.Statistics: The most useful
--   statistics are <tt>Maximum</tt> and <tt>Average</tt>.Unit: The
--   published unit is <tt>Percent</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
getContainerServiceMetricData_metricName :: Lens' GetContainerServiceMetricData ContainerServiceMetricName

-- | The start time of the time period.
getContainerServiceMetricData_startTime :: Lens' GetContainerServiceMetricData UTCTime

-- | The end time of the time period.
getContainerServiceMetricData_endTime :: Lens' GetContainerServiceMetricData UTCTime

-- | The granularity, in seconds, of the returned data points.
--   
--   All container service metric data is available in 5-minute (300
--   seconds) granularity.
getContainerServiceMetricData_period :: Lens' GetContainerServiceMetricData Natural

-- | The statistic for the metric.
--   
--   The following statistics are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Minimum</tt> - The lowest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine low volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Maximum</tt> - The highest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine high volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Sum</tt> - All values submitted for the matching metric added
--   together. You can use this statistic to determine the total volume of
--   a metric.</li>
--   <li><tt>Average</tt> - The value of <tt>Sum</tt> /
--   <tt>SampleCount</tt> during the specified period. By comparing this
--   statistic with the <tt>Minimum</tt> and <tt>Maximum</tt> values, you
--   can determine the full scope of a metric and how close the average use
--   is to the <tt>Minimum</tt> and <tt>Maximum</tt> values. This
--   comparison helps you to know when to increase or decrease your
--   resources.</li>
--   <li><tt>SampleCount</tt> - The count, or number, of data points used
--   for the statistical calculation.</li>
--   </ul>
getContainerServiceMetricData_statistics :: Lens' GetContainerServiceMetricData [MetricStatistic]

-- | The name of the metric returned.
getContainerServiceMetricDataResponse_metricName :: Lens' GetContainerServiceMetricDataResponse (Maybe ContainerServiceMetricName)

-- | An array of objects that describe the metric data returned.
getContainerServiceMetricDataResponse_metricData :: Lens' GetContainerServiceMetricDataResponse (Maybe [MetricDatapoint])

-- | The response's http status code.
getContainerServiceMetricDataResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetContainerServiceMetricDataResponse Int

-- | The name of the distribution for which to get metric data.
--   
--   Use the <tt>GetDistributions</tt> action to get a list of distribution
--   names that you can specify.
getDistributionMetricData_distributionName :: Lens' GetDistributionMetricData Text

-- | The metric for which you want to return information.
--   
--   Valid distribution metric names are listed below, along with the most
--   useful <tt>statistics</tt> to include in your request, and the
--   published <tt>unit</tt> value.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Requests</tt></b> - The total number of viewer requests
--   received by your Lightsail distribution, for all HTTP methods, and for
--   both HTTP and HTTPS requests.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful
--   statistic is <tt>Sum</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is
--   <tt>None</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>BytesDownloaded</tt></b> - The number of bytes downloaded
--   by viewers for GET, HEAD, and OPTIONS requests.<tt>Statistics</tt>:
--   The most useful statistic is <tt>Sum</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published
--   unit is <tt>None</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>BytesUploaded </tt></b> - The number of bytes uploaded to
--   your origin by your Lightsail distribution, using POST and PUT
--   requests.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistic is
--   <tt>Sum</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is <tt>None</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>TotalErrorRate</tt></b> - The percentage of all viewer
--   requests for which the response's HTTP status code was 4xx or
--   5xx.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistic is
--   <tt>Average</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is
--   <tt>Percent</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>4xxErrorRate</tt></b> - The percentage of all viewer
--   requests for which the response's HTTP status cod was 4xx. In these
--   cases, the client or client viewer may have made an error. For
--   example, a status code of 404 (Not Found) means that the client
--   requested an object that could not be found.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The
--   most useful statistic is <tt>Average</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published
--   unit is <tt>Percent</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>5xxErrorRate</tt></b> - The percentage of all viewer
--   requests for which the response's HTTP status code was 5xx. In these
--   cases, the origin server did not satisfy the requests. For example, a
--   status code of 503 (Service Unavailable) means that the origin server
--   is currently unavailable.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful
--   statistic is <tt>Average</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is
--   <tt>Percent</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
getDistributionMetricData_metricName :: Lens' GetDistributionMetricData DistributionMetricName

-- | The start of the time interval for which to get metric data.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>Specified in the Unix time format.For example, if you wish to use
--   a start time of October 1, 2018, at 8 PM UTC, specify
--   <tt>1538424000</tt> as the start time.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can convert a human-friendly time to Unix time format using a
--   converter like <a>Epoch converter</a>.
getDistributionMetricData_startTime :: Lens' GetDistributionMetricData UTCTime

-- | The end of the time interval for which to get metric data.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>Specified in the Unix time format.For example, if you wish to use
--   an end time of October 1, 2018, at 9 PM UTC, specify
--   <tt>1538427600</tt> as the end time.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can convert a human-friendly time to Unix time format using a
--   converter like <a>Epoch converter</a>.
getDistributionMetricData_endTime :: Lens' GetDistributionMetricData UTCTime

-- | The granularity, in seconds, for the metric data points that will be
--   returned.
getDistributionMetricData_period :: Lens' GetDistributionMetricData Natural

-- | The unit for the metric data request.
--   
--   Valid units depend on the metric data being requested. For the valid
--   units with each available metric, see the <tt>metricName</tt>
--   parameter.
getDistributionMetricData_unit :: Lens' GetDistributionMetricData MetricUnit

-- | The statistic for the metric.
--   
--   The following statistics are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Minimum</tt> - The lowest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine low volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Maximum</tt> - The highest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine high volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Sum</tt> - All values submitted for the matching metric added
--   together. You can use this statistic to determine the total volume of
--   a metric.</li>
--   <li><tt>Average</tt> - The value of Sum / SampleCount during the
--   specified period. By comparing this statistic with the Minimum and
--   Maximum values, you can determine the full scope of a metric and how
--   close the average use is to the Minimum and Maximum values. This
--   comparison helps you to know when to increase or decrease your
--   resources.</li>
--   <li><tt>SampleCount</tt> - The count, or number, of data points used
--   for the statistical calculation.</li>
--   </ul>
getDistributionMetricData_statistics :: Lens' GetDistributionMetricData [MetricStatistic]

-- | The name of the metric returned.
getDistributionMetricDataResponse_metricName :: Lens' GetDistributionMetricDataResponse (Maybe DistributionMetricName)

-- | An array of objects that describe the metric data returned.
getDistributionMetricDataResponse_metricData :: Lens' GetDistributionMetricDataResponse (Maybe [MetricDatapoint])

-- | The response's http status code.
getDistributionMetricDataResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetDistributionMetricDataResponse Int

--   date</tt> parameter. The <tt>use latest restorable auto snapshot</tt>

--

--   <li>Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>Specified in the Unix time format.For example, if you wish to use
--   a start time of October 1, 2018, at 8 PM UTC, then you input
--   <tt>1538424000</tt> as the start time.</li>
--   </ul>
getRelationalDatabaseLogEvents_startTime :: Lens' GetRelationalDatabaseLogEvents (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Parameter to specify if the log should start from head or tail. If
--   <tt>true</tt> is specified, the log event starts from the head of the
--   log. If <tt>false</tt> is specified, the log event starts from the
--   tail of the log.
--   
--   For PostgreSQL, the default value of <tt>false</tt> is the only option
--   available.
getRelationalDatabaseLogEvents_startFromHead :: Lens' GetRelationalDatabaseLogEvents (Maybe Bool)

--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>

--   <tt>1538424000</tt> as the end time.</li>
--   </ul>

-- | The protocol of the contact method, such as <tt>Email</tt> or
--   <tt>SMS</tt> (text messaging).
--   
--   The <tt>SMS</tt> protocol is supported only in the following AWS
--   Regions.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>US East (N. Virginia) (<tt>us-east-1</tt>)</li>
--   <li>US West (Oregon) (<tt>us-west-2</tt>)</li>
--   <li>Europe (Ireland) (<tt>eu-west-1</tt>)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Tokyo) (<tt>ap-northeast-1</tt>)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Singapore) (<tt>ap-southeast-1</tt>)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Sydney) (<tt>ap-southeast-2</tt>)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For a list of countries/regions where SMS text messages can be sent,
--   and the latest AWS Regions where SMS text messaging is supported, see
--   <a>Supported Regions and Countries</a> in the <i>Amazon SNS Developer
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   For more information about notifications in Amazon Lightsail, see
--   <a>Notifications in Amazon Lightsail</a>.
createContactMethod_protocol :: Lens' CreateContactMethod ContactProtocol

-- | The destination of the contact method, such as an email address or a
--   mobile phone number.
--   
--   Use the E.164 format when specifying a mobile phone number. E.164 is a
--   standard for the phone number structure used for international
--   telecommunication. Phone numbers that follow this format can have a
--   maximum of 15 digits, and they are prefixed with the plus character
--   (+) and the country code. For example, a U.S. phone number in E.164
--   format would be specified as +1XXX5550100. For more information, see
--   <a>E.164</a> on <i>Wikipedia</i>.
createContactMethod_contactEndpoint :: Lens' CreateContactMethod Text

-- | The public domain names to use with the container service, such as
--   <tt>example.com</tt> and <tt>www.example.com</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify up to four public domain names for a container
--   service. The domain names that you specify are used when you create a
--   deployment with a container configured as the public endpoint of your
--   container service.
--   
--   If you don't specify public domain names, then you can use the default
--   domain of the container service.
--   
--   You must create and validate an SSL/TLS certificate before you can use
--   public domain names with your container service. Use the
--   <tt>CreateCertificate</tt> action to create a certificate for the
--   public domain names you want to use with your container service.
--   
--   You can specify public domain names using a string to array map as
--   shown in the example later on this page.
createContainerService_publicDomainNames :: Lens' CreateContainerService (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | The tag keys and optional values to add to the certificate during
--   create.
--   
--   Use the <tt>TagResource</tt> action to tag a resource after it's
--   created.
--   
--   For more information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon
--   Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
createContainerService_tags :: Lens' CreateContainerService (Maybe [Tag])

-- | An object that describes a deployment for the container service.
--   
--   A deployment specifies the containers that will be launched on the
--   container service and their settings, such as the ports to open, the
--   environment variables to apply, and the launch command to run. It also
--   specifies the container that will serve as the public endpoint of the
--   deployment and its settings, such as the HTTP or HTTPS port to use,
--   and the health check configuration.
createContainerService_deployment :: Lens' CreateContainerService (Maybe ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest)

-- | The name for the container service.
--   
--   The name that you specify for your container service will make up part
--   of its default domain. The default domain of a container service is
--   typically
--   <tt>https://&lt;ServiceName&gt;.&lt;RandomGUID&gt;.&lt;AWSRegion&gt;.cs.amazonlightsail.com</tt>.
--   If the name of your container service is <tt>container-service-1</tt>,
--   and it's located in the US East (Ohio) AWS region
--   (<tt>us-east-2</tt>), then the domain for your container service will
--   be like the following example:
--   <tt>https://container-service-1.ur4EXAMPLE2uq.us-east-2.cs.amazonlightsail.com</tt>
--   
--   The following are the requirements for container service names:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be unique within each AWS Region in your Lightsail
--   account.</li>
--   <li>Must contain 1 to 63 characters.</li>
--   <li>Must contain only alphanumeric characters and hyphens.</li>
--   <li>A hyphen (-) can separate words but cannot be at the start or end
--   of the name.</li>
--   </ul>
createContainerService_serviceName :: Lens' CreateContainerService Text

-- | The power specification for the container service.
--   
--   The power specifies the amount of memory, vCPUs, and base monthly cost
--   of each node of the container service. The <tt>power</tt> and
--   <tt>scale</tt> of a container service makes up its configured
--   capacity. To determine the monthly price of your container service,
--   multiply the base price of the <tt>power</tt> with the <tt>scale</tt>
--   (the number of nodes) of the service.
--   
--   Use the <tt>GetContainerServicePowers</tt> action to get a list of
--   power options that you can specify using this parameter, and their
--   base monthly cost.
createContainerService_power :: Lens' CreateContainerService ContainerServicePowerName

-- | The scale specification for the container service.
--   
--   The scale specifies the allocated compute nodes of the container
--   service. The <tt>power</tt> and <tt>scale</tt> of a container service
--   makes up its configured capacity. To determine the monthly price of
--   your container service, multiply the base price of the <tt>power</tt>
--   with the <tt>scale</tt> (the number of nodes) of the service.
createContainerService_scale :: Lens' CreateContainerService Natural

createContainerServiceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateContainerServiceResponse Int

-- | The name of the container service for which to register a container
--   image.
registerContainerImage_serviceName :: Lens' RegisterContainerImage Text

-- | The label for the container image when it's registered to the
--   container service.
--   
--   Use a descriptive label that you can use to track the different
--   versions of your registered container images.
--   
--   Use the <tt>GetContainerImages</tt> action to return the container
--   images registered to a Lightsail container service. The label is the
--   <tt>&lt;imagelabel&gt;</tt> portion of the following image name
--   example:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>:container-service-1.&lt;imagelabel&gt;.1</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If the name of your container service is <tt>mycontainerservice</tt>,
--   and the label that you specify is <tt>mystaticwebsite</tt>, then the
--   name of the registered container image will be
--   <tt>:mycontainerservice.mystaticwebsite.1</tt>.
--   
--   The number at the end of these image name examples represents the
--   version of the registered container image. If you push and register
--   another container image to the same Lightsail container service, with
--   the same label, then the version number for the new registered
--   container image will be <tt>2</tt>. If you push and register another
--   container image, the version number will be <tt>3</tt>, and so on.
registerContainerImage_label :: Lens' RegisterContainerImage Text

-- | The digest of the container image to be registered.
registerContainerImage_digest :: Lens' RegisterContainerImage Text

-- | Undocumented member.
registerContainerImageResponse_containerImage :: Lens' RegisterContainerImageResponse (Maybe ContainerImage)

-- | The response's http status code.
registerContainerImageResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' RegisterContainerImageResponse Int

--   <tt>example2.com</tt>) and subdomains (e.g.,
--   <tt>blog.example.com</tt>) for the certificate.
--   
--   You can specify a maximum of nine alternate domains (in addition to
--   the primary domain name).
--   
--   Wildcard domain entries (e.g., <tt>*.example.com</tt>) are not
--   supported.

--   Developer Guide</a>.</li>

-- | The name of the bucket for which to get metric data.
getBucketMetricData_bucketName :: Lens' GetBucketMetricData Text

-- | The metric for which you want to return information.
--   
--   Valid bucket metric names are listed below, along with the most useful
--   statistics to include in your request, and the published unit value.
--   
--   These bucket metrics are reported once per day.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>BucketSizeBytes</tt></b> - The amount of data in bytes
--   stored in a bucket. This value is calculated by summing the size of
--   all objects in the bucket (including object versions), including the
--   size of all parts for all incomplete multipart uploads to the
--   bucket.Statistics: The most useful statistic is <tt>Maximum</tt>.Unit:
--   The published unit is <tt>Bytes</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>NumberOfObjects</tt></b> - The total number of objects
--   stored in a bucket. This value is calculated by counting all objects
--   in the bucket (including object versions) and the total number of
--   parts for all incomplete multipart uploads to the bucket.Statistics:
--   The most useful statistic is <tt>Average</tt>.Unit: The published unit
--   is <tt>Count</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
getBucketMetricData_metricName :: Lens' GetBucketMetricData BucketMetricName

-- | The timestamp indicating the earliest data to be returned.
getBucketMetricData_startTime :: Lens' GetBucketMetricData UTCTime

-- | The timestamp indicating the latest data to be returned.
getBucketMetricData_endTime :: Lens' GetBucketMetricData UTCTime

-- | The granularity, in seconds, of the returned data points.
--   
--   Bucket storage metrics are reported once per day. Therefore, you
--   should specify a period of 86400 seconds, which is the number of
--   seconds in a day.
getBucketMetricData_period :: Lens' GetBucketMetricData Natural

-- | The statistic for the metric.
--   
--   The following statistics are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Minimum</tt> - The lowest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine low volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Maximum</tt> - The highest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine high volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Sum</tt> - The sum of all values submitted for the matching
--   metric. You can use this statistic to determine the total volume of a
--   metric.</li>
--   <li><tt>Average</tt> - The value of <tt>Sum</tt> /
--   <tt>SampleCount</tt> during the specified period. By comparing this
--   statistic with the <tt>Minimum</tt> and <tt>Maximum</tt> values, you
--   can determine the full scope of a metric and how close the average use
--   is to the <tt>Minimum</tt> and <tt>Maximum</tt> values. This
--   comparison helps you to know when to increase or decrease your
--   resources.</li>
--   <li><tt>SampleCount</tt> - The count, or number, of data points used
--   for the statistical calculation.</li>
--   </ul>
getBucketMetricData_statistics :: Lens' GetBucketMetricData [MetricStatistic]

-- | The unit for the metric data request.
--   
--   Valid units depend on the metric data being requested. For the valid
--   units with each available metric, see the <tt>metricName</tt>
--   parameter.
getBucketMetricData_unit :: Lens' GetBucketMetricData MetricUnit

-- | The name of the metric returned.
getBucketMetricDataResponse_metricName :: Lens' GetBucketMetricDataResponse (Maybe BucketMetricName)

-- | An array of objects that describe the metric data returned.
getBucketMetricDataResponse_metricData :: Lens' GetBucketMetricDataResponse (Maybe [MetricDatapoint])

-- | The response's http status code.
getBucketMetricDataResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetBucketMetricDataResponse Int

-- | Determines whether a final database snapshot is created before your
--   database is deleted. If <tt>true</tt> is specified, no database
--   snapshot is created. If <tt>false</tt> is specified, a database
--   snapshot is created before your database is deleted.
--   
--   You must specify the <tt>final relational database snapshot name</tt>
--   parameter if the <tt>skip final snapshot</tt> parameter is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Default: <tt>false</tt>
deleteRelationalDatabase_skipFinalSnapshot :: Lens' DeleteRelationalDatabase (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the database snapshot created if <tt>skip final
--   snapshot</tt> is <tt>false</tt>, which is the default value for that
--   parameter.
--   
--   Specifying this parameter and also specifying the <tt>skip final
--   snapshot</tt> parameter to <tt>true</tt> results in an error.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain from 2 to 255 alphanumeric characters, or
--   hyphens.</li>
--   <li>The first and last character must be a letter or number.</li>
--   </ul>
deleteRelationalDatabase_finalRelationalDatabaseSnapshotName :: Lens' DeleteRelationalDatabase (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the database that you are deleting.
deleteRelationalDatabase_relationalDatabaseName :: Lens' DeleteRelationalDatabase Text

-- | An array of objects that describe the result of the action, such as
--   the status of the request, the timestamp of the request, and the
--   resources affected by the request.
deleteRelationalDatabaseResponse_operations :: Lens' DeleteRelationalDatabaseResponse (Maybe [Operation])

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteRelationalDatabaseResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteRelationalDatabaseResponse Int

-- | The name of the disk snapshot (e.g., <tt>my-disk-snapshot</tt>).
getDiskSnapshot_diskSnapshotName :: Lens' GetDiskSnapshot Text

-- | An object containing information about the disk snapshot.
getDiskSnapshotResponse_diskSnapshot :: Lens' GetDiskSnapshotResponse (Maybe DiskSnapshot)

-- | The response's http status code.
getDiskSnapshotResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetDiskSnapshotResponse Int

-- | The password for the master user. The password can include any
--   printable ASCII character except "/", """, or "@".
--   
--   My<b>SQL</b>
--   
--   Constraints: Must contain from 8 to 41 characters.
--   
--   <b>PostgreSQL</b>
--   
--   Constraints: Must contain from 8 to 128 characters.
updateRelationalDatabase_masterUserPassword :: Lens' UpdateRelationalDatabase (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the accessibility options for your database. A value of
--   <tt>true</tt> specifies a database that is available to resources
--   outside of your Lightsail account. A value of <tt>false</tt> specifies
--   a database that is available only to your Lightsail resources in the
--   same region as your database.
updateRelationalDatabase_publiclyAccessible :: Lens' UpdateRelationalDatabase (Maybe Bool)

-- | When <tt>true</tt>, enables automated backup retention for your
--   database.
--   
--   Updates are applied during the next maintenance window because this
--   can result in an outage.
updateRelationalDatabase_enableBackupRetention :: Lens' UpdateRelationalDatabase (Maybe Bool)

-- | The weekly time range during which system maintenance can occur on
--   your database.
--   
--   The default is a 30-minute window selected at random from an 8-hour
--   block of time for each AWS Region, occurring on a random day of the
--   week.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be in the <tt>ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi</tt> format.</li>
--   <li>Valid days: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun.</li>
--   <li>Must be at least 30 minutes.</li>
--   <li>Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>Example: <tt>Tue:17:00-Tue:17:30</tt></li>
--   </ul>
updateRelationalDatabase_preferredMaintenanceWindow :: Lens' UpdateRelationalDatabase (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates the certificate that needs to be associated with the
--   database.
updateRelationalDatabase_caCertificateIdentifier :: Lens' UpdateRelationalDatabase (Maybe Text)

-- | The daily time range during which automated backups are created for
--   your database if automated backups are enabled.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be in the <tt>hh24:mi-hh24:mi</tt> format.Example:
--   <tt>16:00-16:30</tt></li>
--   <li>Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>Must not conflict with the preferred maintenance window.</li>
--   <li>Must be at least 30 minutes.</li>
--   </ul>
updateRelationalDatabase_preferredBackupWindow :: Lens' UpdateRelationalDatabase (Maybe Text)

-- | When <tt>true</tt>, applies changes immediately. When <tt>false</tt>,
--   applies changes during the preferred maintenance window. Some changes
--   may cause an outage.
--   
--   Default: <tt>false</tt>
updateRelationalDatabase_applyImmediately :: Lens' UpdateRelationalDatabase (Maybe Bool)

-- | When <tt>true</tt>, the master user password is changed to a new
--   strong password generated by Lightsail.
--   
--   Use the <tt>get relational database master user password</tt>
--   operation to get the new password.
updateRelationalDatabase_rotateMasterUserPassword :: Lens' UpdateRelationalDatabase (Maybe Bool)

-- | When <tt>true</tt>, disables automated backup retention for your
--   database.
--   
--   Disabling backup retention deletes all automated database backups.
--   Before disabling this, you may want to create a snapshot of your
--   database using the <tt>create relational database snapshot</tt>
--   operation.
--   
--   Updates are applied during the next maintenance window because this
--   can result in an outage.
updateRelationalDatabase_disableBackupRetention :: Lens' UpdateRelationalDatabase (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of your Lightsail database resource to update.
updateRelationalDatabase_relationalDatabaseName :: Lens' UpdateRelationalDatabase Text

-- | An array of objects that describe the result of the action, such as
--   the status of the request, the timestamp of the request, and the
--   resources affected by the request.
updateRelationalDatabaseResponse_operations :: Lens' UpdateRelationalDatabaseResponse (Maybe [Operation])

-- | The response's http status code.
updateRelationalDatabaseResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateRelationalDatabaseResponse Int

-- | The name of the static IP in Lightsail.
getStaticIp_staticIpName :: Lens' GetStaticIp Text

-- | An array of key-value pairs containing information about the requested
--   static IP.
getStaticIpResponse_staticIp :: Lens' GetStaticIpResponse (Maybe StaticIp)

-- | The response's http status code.
getStaticIpResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetStaticIpResponse Int

-- | The password version to return.
--   
--   Specifying <tt>CURRENT</tt> or <tt>PREVIOUS</tt> returns the current
--   or previous passwords respectively. Specifying <tt>PENDING</tt>
--   returns the newest version of the password that will rotate to
--   <tt>CURRENT</tt>. After the <tt>PENDING</tt> password rotates to
--   <tt>CURRENT</tt>, the <tt>PENDING</tt> password is no longer
--   available.
--   
--   Default: <tt>CURRENT</tt>
getRelationalDatabaseMasterUserPassword_passwordVersion :: Lens' GetRelationalDatabaseMasterUserPassword (Maybe RelationalDatabasePasswordVersion)

-- | The name of your database for which to get the master user password.
getRelationalDatabaseMasterUserPassword_relationalDatabaseName :: Lens' GetRelationalDatabaseMasterUserPassword Text

-- | The master user password for the <tt>password version</tt> specified.
getRelationalDatabaseMasterUserPasswordResponse_masterUserPassword :: Lens' GetRelationalDatabaseMasterUserPasswordResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when the specified version of the master user password
--   was created.
getRelationalDatabaseMasterUserPasswordResponse_createdAt :: Lens' GetRelationalDatabaseMasterUserPasswordResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The response's http status code.
getRelationalDatabaseMasterUserPasswordResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetRelationalDatabaseMasterUserPasswordResponse Int

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether to include inactive results in your
--   request.
getBlueprints_includeInactive :: Lens' GetBlueprints (Maybe Bool)

-- | The token to advance to the next page of results from your request.
--   
--   To get a page token, perform an initial <tt>GetBlueprints</tt>
--   request. If your results are paginated, the response will return a
--   next page token that you can specify as the page token in a subsequent
--   request.
getBlueprints_pageToken :: Lens' GetBlueprints (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of key-value pairs that contains information about the
--   available blueprints.
getBlueprintsResponse_blueprints :: Lens' GetBlueprintsResponse (Maybe [Blueprint])

-- | The token to advance to the next page of results from your request.
--   
--   A next page token is not returned if there are no more results to
--   display.
--   
--   To get the next page of results, perform another
--   <tt>GetBlueprints</tt> request and specify the next page token using
--   the <tt>pageToken</tt> parameter.
getBlueprintsResponse_nextPageToken :: Lens' GetBlueprintsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
getBlueprintsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetBlueprintsResponse Int

-- | Sets how this alarm will handle missing data points.
--   
--   An alarm can treat missing data in the following ways:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>breaching</tt> - Assume the missing data is not within the
--   threshold. Missing data counts towards the number of times the metric
--   is not within the threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>notBreaching</tt> - Assume the missing data is within the
--   threshold. Missing data does not count towards the number of times the
--   metric is not within the threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>ignore</tt> - Ignore the missing data. Maintains the current
--   alarm state.</li>
--   <li><tt>missing</tt> - Missing data is treated as missing.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If <tt>treatMissingData</tt> is not specified, the default behavior of
--   <tt>missing</tt> is used.
putAlarm_treatMissingData :: Lens' PutAlarm (Maybe TreatMissingData)

-- | The contact protocols to use for the alarm, such as <tt>Email</tt>,
--   <tt>SMS</tt> (text messaging), or both.
--   
--   A notification is sent via the specified contact protocol if
--   notifications are enabled for the alarm, and when the alarm is
--   triggered.
--   
--   A notification is not sent if a contact protocol is not specified, if
--   the specified contact protocol is not configured in the AWS Region, or
--   if notifications are not enabled for the alarm using the
--   <tt>notificationEnabled</tt> paramater.
--   
--   Use the <tt>CreateContactMethod</tt> action to configure a contact
--   protocol in an AWS Region.
putAlarm_contactProtocols :: Lens' PutAlarm (Maybe [ContactProtocol])

-- | The number of data points that must be not within the specified
--   threshold to trigger the alarm. If you are setting an "M out of N"
--   alarm, this value (<tt>datapointsToAlarm</tt>) is the M.
putAlarm_datapointsToAlarm :: Lens' PutAlarm (Maybe Int)

-- | Indicates whether the alarm is enabled.
--   
--   Notifications are enabled by default if you don't specify this
--   parameter.
putAlarm_notificationEnabled :: Lens' PutAlarm (Maybe Bool)

-- | The alarm states that trigger a notification.
--   
--   An alarm has the following possible states:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALARM</tt> - The metric is outside of the defined
--   threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>INSUFFICIENT_DATA</tt> - The alarm has just started, the
--   metric is not available, or not enough data is available for the
--   metric to determine the alarm state.</li>
--   <li><tt>OK</tt> - The metric is within the defined threshold.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   When you specify a notification trigger, the <tt>ALARM</tt> state must
--   be specified. The <tt>INSUFFICIENT_DATA</tt> and <tt>OK</tt> states
--   can be specified in addition to the <tt>ALARM</tt> state.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you specify <tt>OK</tt> as an alarm trigger, a notification is
--   sent when the alarm switches from an <tt>ALARM</tt> or
--   <tt>INSUFFICIENT_DATA</tt> alarm state to an <tt>OK</tt> state. This
--   can be thought of as an <i>all clear</i> alarm notification.</li>
--   <li>If you specify <tt>INSUFFICIENT_DATA</tt> as the alarm trigger, a
--   notification is sent when the alarm switches from an <tt>OK</tt> or
--   <tt>ALARM</tt> alarm state to an <tt>INSUFFICIENT_DATA</tt>
--   state.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The notification trigger defaults to <tt>ALARM</tt> if you don't
--   specify this parameter.
putAlarm_notificationTriggers :: Lens' PutAlarm (Maybe [AlarmState])

-- | The name for the alarm. Specify the name of an existing alarm to
--   update, and overwrite the previous configuration of the alarm.
putAlarm_alarmName :: Lens' PutAlarm Text

-- | The name of the metric to associate with the alarm.
--   
--   You can configure up to two alarms per metric.
--   
--   The following metrics are available for each resource type:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Instances</b>: <tt>BurstCapacityPercentage</tt>,
--   <tt>BurstCapacityTime</tt>, <tt>CPUUtilization</tt>,
--   <tt>NetworkIn</tt>, <tt>NetworkOut</tt>, <tt>StatusCheckFailed</tt>,
--   <tt>StatusCheckFailed_Instance</tt>, and
--   <tt>StatusCheckFailed_System</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b>Load balancers</b>: <tt>ClientTLSNegotiationErrorCount</tt>,
--   <tt>HealthyHostCount</tt>, <tt>UnhealthyHostCount</tt>,
--   <tt>HTTPCode_LB_4XX_Count</tt>, <tt>HTTPCode_LB_5XX_Count</tt>,
--   <tt>HTTPCode_Instance_2XX_Count</tt>,
--   <tt>HTTPCode_Instance_3XX_Count</tt>,
--   <tt>HTTPCode_Instance_4XX_Count</tt>,
--   <tt>HTTPCode_Instance_5XX_Count</tt>, <tt>InstanceResponseTime</tt>,
--   <tt>RejectedConnectionCount</tt>, and <tt>RequestCount</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b>Relational databases</b>: <tt>CPUUtilization</tt>,
--   <tt>DatabaseConnections</tt>, <tt>DiskQueueDepth</tt>,
--   <tt>FreeStorageSpace</tt>, <tt>NetworkReceiveThroughput</tt>, and
--   <tt>NetworkTransmitThroughput</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information about these metrics, see <a>Metrics available in
--   Lightsail</a>.
putAlarm_metricName :: Lens' PutAlarm MetricName

-- | The name of the Lightsail resource that will be monitored.
--   
--   Instances, load balancers, and relational databases are the only
--   Lightsail resources that can currently be monitored by alarms.
putAlarm_monitoredResourceName :: Lens' PutAlarm Text

-- | The arithmetic operation to use when comparing the specified statistic
--   to the threshold. The specified statistic value is used as the first
--   operand.
putAlarm_comparisonOperator :: Lens' PutAlarm ComparisonOperator

-- | The value against which the specified statistic is compared.
putAlarm_threshold :: Lens' PutAlarm Double

-- | The number of most recent periods over which data is compared to the
--   specified threshold. If you are setting an "M out of N" alarm, this
--   value (<tt>evaluationPeriods</tt>) is the N.
--   
--   If you are setting an alarm that requires that a number of consecutive
--   data points be breaching to trigger the alarm, this value specifies
--   the rolling period of time in which data points are evaluated.
--   
--   Each evaluation period is five minutes long. For example, specify an
--   evaluation period of 24 to evaluate a metric over a rolling period of
--   two hours.
--   
--   You can specify a minimum valuation period of 1 (5 minutes), and a
--   maximum evaluation period of 288 (24 hours).
putAlarm_evaluationPeriods :: Lens' PutAlarm Int

-- | An array of objects that describe the result of the action, such as
--   the status of the request, the timestamp of the request, and the
--   resources affected by the request.
putAlarmResponse_operations :: Lens' PutAlarmResponse (Maybe [Operation])

-- | The response's http status code.
putAlarmResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' PutAlarmResponse Int

-- | The name of the alarm to delete.
deleteAlarm_alarmName :: Lens' DeleteAlarm Text

-- | An array of objects that describe the result of the action, such as
--   the status of the request, the timestamp of the request, and the
--   resources affected by the request.
deleteAlarmResponse_operations :: Lens' DeleteAlarmResponse (Maybe [Operation])

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteAlarmResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteAlarmResponse Int

-- | The name of the instance for which to return firewall port states.
getInstancePortStates_instanceName :: Lens' GetInstancePortStates Text

-- | An array of objects that describe the firewall port states for the
--   specified instance.
getInstancePortStatesResponse_portStates :: Lens' GetInstancePortStatesResponse (Maybe [InstancePortState])

-- | The response's http status code.
getInstancePortStatesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetInstancePortStatesResponse Int

-- | The name of the source instance or disk from which to delete the
--   automatic snapshot.
deleteAutoSnapshot_resourceName :: Lens' DeleteAutoSnapshot Text

-- | The date of the automatic snapshot to delete in <tt>YYYY-MM-DD</tt>
--   format. Use the <tt>get auto snapshots</tt> operation to get the
--   available automatic snapshots for a resource.
deleteAutoSnapshot_date :: Lens' DeleteAutoSnapshot Text

--   the status of the request, the timestamp of the request, and the
--   resources affected by the request.
deleteAutoSnapshotResponse_operations :: Lens' DeleteAutoSnapshotResponse (Maybe [Operation])

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteAutoSnapshotResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteAutoSnapshotResponse Int

-- | The password for the master user. The password can include any
--   printable ASCII character except "/", """, or "@". It cannot contain
--   spaces.
--   
--   <b>MySQL</b>
--   
--   Constraints: Must contain from 8 to 41 characters.
--   
--   <b>PostgreSQL</b>
--   
--   Constraints: Must contain from 8 to 128 characters.
createRelationalDatabase_masterUserPassword :: Lens' CreateRelationalDatabase (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the accessibility options for your new database. A value of
--   <tt>true</tt> specifies a database that is available to resources
--   outside of your Lightsail account. A value of <tt>false</tt> specifies
--   a database that is available only to your Lightsail resources in the
--   same region as your database.
createRelationalDatabase_publiclyAccessible :: Lens' CreateRelationalDatabase (Maybe Bool)

-- | The weekly time range during which system maintenance can occur on
--   your new database.
--   
--   The default is a 30-minute window selected at random from an 8-hour
--   block of time for each AWS Region, occurring on a random day of the
--   week.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be in the <tt>ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi</tt> format.</li>
--   <li>Valid days: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun.</li>
--   <li>Must be at least 30 minutes.</li>
--   <li>Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>Example: <tt>Tue:17:00-Tue:17:30</tt></li>
--   </ul>
createRelationalDatabase_preferredMaintenanceWindow :: Lens' CreateRelationalDatabase (Maybe Text)

-- | The daily time range during which automated backups are created for
--   your new database if automated backups are enabled.
--   
--   The default is a 30-minute window selected at random from an 8-hour
--   block of time for each AWS Region. For more information about the
--   preferred backup window time blocks for each region, see the
--   <a>Working With Backups</a> guide in the Amazon Relational Database
--   Service (Amazon RDS) documentation.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be in the <tt>hh24:mi-hh24:mi</tt> format.Example:
--   <tt>16:00-16:30</tt></li>
--   <li>Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>Must not conflict with the preferred maintenance window.</li>
--   <li>Must be at least 30 minutes.</li>
--   </ul>
createRelationalDatabase_preferredBackupWindow :: Lens' CreateRelationalDatabase (Maybe Text)

-- | The Availability Zone in which to create your new database. Use the
--   <tt>us-east-2a</tt> case-sensitive format.
--   
--   You can get a list of Availability Zones by using the <tt>get
--   regions</tt> operation. Be sure to add the <tt>include relational
--   database Availability Zones</tt> parameter to your request.
createRelationalDatabase_availabilityZone :: Lens' CreateRelationalDatabase (Maybe Text)

createRelationalDatabase_relationalDatabaseName :: Lens' CreateRelationalDatabase Text

-- | The blueprint ID for your new database. A blueprint describes the
--   major engine version of a database.
--   
--   You can get a list of database blueprints IDs by using the <tt>get
--   relational database blueprints</tt> operation.
createRelationalDatabase_relationalDatabaseBlueprintId :: Lens' CreateRelationalDatabase Text

-- | The bundle ID for your new database. A bundle describes the
--   performance specifications for your database.
--   
--   You can get a list of database bundle IDs by using the <tt>get
--   relational database bundles</tt> operation.
createRelationalDatabase_relationalDatabaseBundleId :: Lens' CreateRelationalDatabase Text

-- | The meaning of this parameter differs according to the database engine
--   you use.
--   
--   <b>MySQL</b>
--   
--   The name of the database to create when the Lightsail database
--   resource is created. If this parameter isn't specified, no database is
--   created in the database resource.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain 1 to 64 letters or numbers.</li>
--   <li>Must begin with a letter. Subsequent characters can be letters,
--   underscores, or digits (0- 9).</li>
--   <li>Can't be a word reserved by the specified database engine.For more
--   information about reserved words in MySQL, see the Keywords and
--   Reserved Words articles for <a>MySQL 5.6</a>, <a>MySQL 5.7</a>, and
--   <a>MySQL 8.0</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>PostgreSQL</b>
--   
--   The name of the database to create when the Lightsail database
--   resource is created. If this parameter isn't specified, a database
--   named <tt>postgres</tt> is created in the database resource.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain 1 to 63 letters or numbers.</li>
--   <li>Must begin with a letter. Subsequent characters can be letters,
--   underscores, or digits (0- 9).</li>
--   <li>Can't be a word reserved by the specified database engine.For more
--   information about reserved words in PostgreSQL, see the SQL Key Words
--   articles for <a>PostgreSQL 9.6</a>, <a>PostgreSQL 10</a>,
--   <a>PostgreSQL 11</a>, and <a>PostgreSQL 12</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
createRelationalDatabase_masterDatabaseName :: Lens' CreateRelationalDatabase Text

-- | The name for the master user.
--   
--   <b>MySQL</b>
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Required for MySQL.</li>
--   <li>Must be 1 to 16 letters or numbers. Can contain underscores.</li>
--   <li>First character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Can't be a reserved word for the chosen database engine.For more
--   information about reserved words in MySQL 5.6 or 5.7, see the Keywords
--   and Reserved Words articles for <a>MySQL 5.6</a>, <a>MySQL 5.7</a>, or
--   <a>MySQL 8.0</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>PostgreSQL</b>
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Required for PostgreSQL.</li>
--   <li>Must be 1 to 63 letters or numbers. Can contain underscores.</li>
--   <li>First character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Can't be a reserved word for the chosen database engine.For more
--   information about reserved words in MySQL 5.6 or 5.7, see the Keywords
--   and Reserved Words articles for <a>PostgreSQL 9.6</a>, <a>PostgreSQL
--   10</a>, <a>PostgreSQL 11</a>, and <a>PostgreSQL 12</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
createRelationalDatabase_masterUsername :: Lens' CreateRelationalDatabase Text

createRelationalDatabaseResponse_operations :: Lens' CreateRelationalDatabaseResponse (Maybe [Operation])

createRelationalDatabaseResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateRelationalDatabaseResponse Int

--   messaging).
sendContactMethodVerification_protocol :: Lens' SendContactMethodVerification ContactMethodVerificationProtocol

sendContactMethodVerificationResponse_operations :: Lens' SendContactMethodVerificationResponse (Maybe [Operation])

sendContactMethodVerificationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' SendContactMethodVerificationResponse Int

-- | The start of the time interval for which to get log data.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>Specified in the Unix time format.For example, if you wish to use
--   a start time of October 1, 2018, at 8 PM UTC, specify
--   <tt>1538424000</tt> as the start time.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can convert a human-friendly time to Unix time format using a
--   converter like <a>Epoch converter</a>.
getContainerLog_startTime :: Lens' GetContainerLog (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The end of the time interval for which to get log data.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>Specified in the Unix time format.For example, if you wish to use
--   an end time of October 1, 2018, at 9 PM UTC, specify
--   <tt>1538427600</tt> as the end time.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can convert a human-friendly time to Unix time format using a
--   converter like <a>Epoch converter</a>.
getContainerLog_endTime :: Lens' GetContainerLog (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The token to advance to the next page of results from your request.
--   
--   To get a page token, perform an initial <tt>GetContainerLog</tt>
--   request. If your results are paginated, the response will return a
--   next page token that you can specify as the page token in a subsequent
--   request.
getContainerLog_pageToken :: Lens' GetContainerLog (Maybe Text)

-- | The pattern to use to filter the returned log events to a specific
--   term.
--   
--   The following are a few examples of filter patterns that you can
--   specify:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>To return all log events, specify a filter pattern of
--   <tt>""</tt>.</li>
--   <li>To exclude log events that contain the <tt>ERROR</tt> term, and
--   return all other log events, specify a filter pattern of
--   <tt>"-ERROR"</tt>.</li>
--   <li>To return log events that contain the <tt>ERROR</tt> term, specify
--   a filter pattern of <tt>"ERROR"</tt>.</li>
--   <li>To return log events that contain both the <tt>ERROR</tt> and
--   <tt>Exception</tt> terms, specify a filter pattern of <tt>"ERROR
--   Exception"</tt>.</li>
--   <li>To return log events that contain the <tt>ERROR</tt> <i>or</i> the
--   <tt>Exception</tt> term, specify a filter pattern of <tt>"?ERROR
--   ?Exception"</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
getContainerLog_filterPattern :: Lens' GetContainerLog (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the container service for which to get a container log.
getContainerLog_serviceName :: Lens' GetContainerLog Text

-- | The name of the container that is either running or previously ran on
--   the container service for which to return a log.
getContainerLog_containerName :: Lens' GetContainerLog Text

-- | The token to advance to the next page of results from your request.
--   
--   A next page token is not returned if there are no more results to
--   display.

--   To get the next page of results, perform another
--   <tt>GetContainerLog</tt> request and specify the next page token using
--   the <tt>pageToken</tt> parameter.

-- | The name of the load balancer.
getLoadBalancerMetricData_loadBalancerName :: Lens' GetLoadBalancerMetricData Text

-- | The metric for which you want to return information.
--   
--   Valid load balancer metric names are listed below, along with the most
--   useful <tt>statistics</tt> to include in your request, and the
--   published <tt>unit</tt> value.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>ClientTLSNegotiationErrorCount</tt></b> - The number of TLS
--   connections initiated by the client that did not establish a session
--   with the load balancer due to a TLS error generated by the load
--   balancer. Possible causes include a mismatch of ciphers or
--   protocols.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistic is
--   <tt>Sum</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is <tt>Count</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>HealthyHostCount</tt></b> - The number of target instances
--   that are considered healthy.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful
--   statistic are <tt>Average</tt>, <tt>Minimum</tt>, and
--   <tt>Maximum</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is
--   <tt>Count</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>HTTPCode_Instance_2XX_Count</tt></b> - The number of HTTP
--   2XX response codes generated by the target instances. This does not
--   include any response codes generated by the load
--   balancer.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistic is
--   <tt>Sum</tt>. Note that <tt>Minimum</tt>, <tt>Maximum</tt>, and
--   <tt>Average</tt> all return <tt>1</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published
--   unit is <tt>Count</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>HTTPCode_Instance_3XX_Count</tt></b> - The number of HTTP
--   3XX response codes generated by the target instances. This does not
--   include any response codes generated by the load
--   balancer.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistic is
--   <tt>Sum</tt>. Note that <tt>Minimum</tt>, <tt>Maximum</tt>, and
--   <tt>Average</tt> all return <tt>1</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published
--   unit is <tt>Count</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>HTTPCode_Instance_4XX_Count</tt></b> - The number of HTTP
--   4XX response codes generated by the target instances. This does not
--   include any response codes generated by the load
--   balancer.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistic is
--   <tt>Sum</tt>. Note that <tt>Minimum</tt>, <tt>Maximum</tt>, and
--   <tt>Average</tt> all return <tt>1</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published
--   unit is <tt>Count</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>HTTPCode_Instance_5XX_Count</tt></b> - The number of HTTP
--   5XX response codes generated by the target instances. This does not
--   include any response codes generated by the load
--   balancer.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistic is
--   <tt>Sum</tt>. Note that <tt>Minimum</tt>, <tt>Maximum</tt>, and
--   <tt>Average</tt> all return <tt>1</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published
--   unit is <tt>Count</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>HTTPCode_LB_4XX_Count</tt></b> - The number of HTTP 4XX
--   client error codes that originated from the load balancer. Client
--   errors are generated when requests are malformed or incomplete. These
--   requests were not received by the target instance. This count does not
--   include response codes generated by the target
--   instances.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistic is
--   <tt>Sum</tt>. Note that <tt>Minimum</tt>, <tt>Maximum</tt>, and
--   <tt>Average</tt> all return <tt>1</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published
--   unit is <tt>Count</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>HTTPCode_LB_5XX_Count</tt></b> - The number of HTTP 5XX
--   server error codes that originated from the load balancer. This does
--   not include any response codes generated by the target instance. This
--   metric is reported if there are no healthy instances attached to the
--   load balancer, or if the request rate exceeds the capacity of the
--   instances (spillover) or the load balancer.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The
--   most useful statistic is <tt>Sum</tt>. Note that <tt>Minimum</tt>,
--   <tt>Maximum</tt>, and <tt>Average</tt> all return
--   <tt>1</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is <tt>Count</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>InstanceResponseTime</tt></b> - The time elapsed, in
--   seconds, after the request leaves the load balancer until a response
--   from the target instance is received.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most
--   useful statistic is <tt>Average</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit
--   is <tt>Seconds</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>RejectedConnectionCount</tt></b> - The number of
--   connections that were rejected because the load balancer had reached
--   its maximum number of connections.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful
--   statistic is <tt>Sum</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is
--   <tt>Count</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>RequestCount</tt></b> - The number of requests processed
--   over IPv4. This count includes only the requests with a response
--   generated by a target instance of the load
--   balancer.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistic is
--   <tt>Sum</tt>. Note that <tt>Minimum</tt>, <tt>Maximum</tt>, and
--   <tt>Average</tt> all return <tt>1</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published
--   unit is <tt>Count</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>UnhealthyHostCount</tt></b> - The number of target
--   instances that are considered unhealthy.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most
--   useful statistic are <tt>Average</tt>, <tt>Minimum</tt>, and
--   <tt>Maximum</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is
--   <tt>Count</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
getLoadBalancerMetricData_metricName :: Lens' GetLoadBalancerMetricData LoadBalancerMetricName

-- | The granularity, in seconds, of the returned data points.
getLoadBalancerMetricData_period :: Lens' GetLoadBalancerMetricData Natural

-- | The start time of the period.
getLoadBalancerMetricData_startTime :: Lens' GetLoadBalancerMetricData UTCTime

-- | The end time of the period.
getLoadBalancerMetricData_endTime :: Lens' GetLoadBalancerMetricData UTCTime

-- | The unit for the metric data request. Valid units depend on the metric
--   data being requested. For the valid units with each available metric,
--   see the <tt>metricName</tt> parameter.
getLoadBalancerMetricData_unit :: Lens' GetLoadBalancerMetricData MetricUnit

-- | The statistic for the metric.
--   
--   The following statistics are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Minimum</tt> - The lowest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine low volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Maximum</tt> - The highest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine high volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Sum</tt> - All values submitted for the matching metric added
--   together. You can use this statistic to determine the total volume of
--   a metric.</li>
--   <li><tt>Average</tt> - The value of Sum / SampleCount during the
--   specified period. By comparing this statistic with the Minimum and
--   Maximum values, you can determine the full scope of a metric and how
--   close the average use is to the Minimum and Maximum values. This
--   comparison helps you to know when to increase or decrease your
--   resources.</li>
--   <li><tt>SampleCount</tt> - The count, or number, of data points used
--   for the statistical calculation.</li>
--   </ul>
getLoadBalancerMetricData_statistics :: Lens' GetLoadBalancerMetricData [MetricStatistic]
