-- | The scale for the container service.
--   
--   The scale specifies the allocated compute nodes of the container
--   service. The <tt>power</tt> and <tt>scale</tt> of a container service
--   makes up its configured capacity. To determine the monthly price of
--   your container service, multiply the base price of the <tt>power</tt>
--   with the <tt>scale</tt> (the number of nodes) of the service.
updateContainerService_scale :: Lens' UpdateContainerService (Maybe Natural)

-- | The power for the container service.
--   
--   The power specifies the amount of memory, vCPUs, and base monthly cost
--   of each node of the container service. The <tt>power</tt> and
--   <tt>scale</tt> of a container service makes up its configured
--   capacity. To determine the monthly price of your container service,
--   multiply the base price of the <tt>power</tt> with the <tt>scale</tt>
--   (the number of nodes) of the service.
--   
--   Use the <tt>GetContainerServicePowers</tt> action to view the
--   specifications of each power option.
updateContainerService_power :: Lens' UpdateContainerService (Maybe ContainerServicePowerName)

-- | A Boolean value to indicate whether the container service is disabled.
updateContainerService_isDisabled :: Lens' UpdateContainerService (Maybe Bool)

-- | The public domain names to use with the container service, such as
--   <tt>example.com</tt> and <tt>www.example.com</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify up to four public domain names for a container
--   service. The domain names that you specify are used when you create a
--   deployment with a container configured as the public endpoint of your
--   container service.
--   
--   If you don't specify public domain names, then you can use the default
--   domain of the container service.
--   
--   You must create and validate an SSL/TLS certificate before you can use
--   public domain names with your container service. Use the
--   <tt>CreateCertificate</tt> action to create a certificate for the
--   public domain names you want to use with your container service.
--   
--   You can specify public domain names using a string to array map as
--   shown in the example later on this page.
updateContainerService_publicDomainNames :: Lens' UpdateContainerService (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | The name of the container service to update.
updateContainerService_serviceName :: Lens' UpdateContainerService Text

-- | An object that describes a container service.
updateContainerServiceResponse_containerService :: Lens' UpdateContainerServiceResponse (Maybe ContainerService)

-- | The response's http status code.
updateContainerServiceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateContainerServiceResponse Int

-- | The name of the database snapshot that you are deleting.
deleteRelationalDatabaseSnapshot_relationalDatabaseSnapshotName :: Lens' DeleteRelationalDatabaseSnapshot Text

-- | An array of objects that describe the result of the action, such as
--   the status of the request, the timestamp of the request, and the
--   resources affected by the request.
deleteRelationalDatabaseSnapshotResponse_operations :: Lens' DeleteRelationalDatabaseSnapshotResponse (Maybe [Operation])

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteRelationalDatabaseSnapshotResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteRelationalDatabaseSnapshotResponse Int

-- | The name of the container service to delete.
deleteContainerService_serviceName :: Lens' DeleteContainerService Text

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteContainerServiceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteContainerServiceResponse Int

-- | The name of the instance for which you want to get metrics data.
getInstanceMetricData_instanceName :: Lens' GetInstanceMetricData Text

-- | The metric for which you want to return information.
--   
--   Valid instance metric names are listed below, along with the most
--   useful <tt>statistics</tt> to include in your request, and the
--   published <tt>unit</tt> value.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>BurstCapacityPercentage</tt></b> - The percentage of CPU
--   performance available for your instance to burst above its baseline.
--   Your instance continuously accrues and consumes burst capacity. Burst
--   capacity stops accruing when your instance's
--   <tt>BurstCapacityPercentage</tt> reaches 100%. For more information,
--   see <a>Viewing instance burst capacity in Amazon
--   Lightsail</a>.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistics are
--   <tt>Maximum</tt> and <tt>Average</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published
--   unit is <tt>Percent</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>BurstCapacityTime</tt></b> - The available amount of time
--   for your instance to burst at 100% CPU utilization. Your instance
--   continuously accrues and consumes burst capacity. Burst capacity time
--   stops accruing when your instance's <tt>BurstCapacityPercentage</tt>
--   metric reaches 100%.Burst capacity time is consumed at the full rate
--   only when your instance operates at 100% CPU utilization. For example,
--   if your instance operates at 50% CPU utilization in the burstable zone
--   for a 5-minute period, then it consumes CPU burst capacity minutes at
--   a 50% rate in that period. Your instance consumed 2 minutes and 30
--   seconds of CPU burst capacity minutes in the 5-minute period. For more
--   information, see <a>Viewing instance burst capacity in Amazon
--   Lightsail</a>.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistics are
--   <tt>Maximum</tt> and <tt>Average</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published
--   unit is <tt>Seconds</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>CPUUtilization</tt></b> - The percentage of allocated
--   compute units that are currently in use on the instance. This metric
--   identifies the processing power to run the applications on the
--   instance. Tools in your operating system can show a lower percentage
--   than Lightsail when the instance is not allocated a full processor
--   core.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistics are
--   <tt>Maximum</tt> and <tt>Average</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published
--   unit is <tt>Percent</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>NetworkIn</tt></b> - The number of bytes received on all
--   network interfaces by the instance. This metric identifies the volume
--   of incoming network traffic to the instance. The number reported is
--   the number of bytes received during the period. Because this metric is
--   reported in 5-minute intervals, divide the reported number by 300 to
--   find Bytes/second.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistic is
--   <tt>Sum</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is <tt>Bytes</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>NetworkOut</tt></b> - The number of bytes sent out on all
--   network interfaces by the instance. This metric identifies the volume
--   of outgoing network traffic from the instance. The number reported is
--   the number of bytes sent during the period. Because this metric is
--   reported in 5-minute intervals, divide the reported number by 300 to
--   find Bytes/second.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistic is
--   <tt>Sum</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is <tt>Bytes</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>StatusCheckFailed</tt></b> - Reports whether the instance
--   passed or failed both the instance status check and the system status
--   check. This metric can be either 0 (passed) or 1 (failed). This metric
--   data is available in 1-minute (60 seconds)
--   granularity.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistic is
--   <tt>Sum</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is <tt>Count</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>StatusCheckFailed_Instance</tt></b> - Reports whether the
--   instance passed or failed the instance status check. This metric can
--   be either 0 (passed) or 1 (failed). This metric data is available in
--   1-minute (60 seconds) granularity.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful
--   statistic is <tt>Sum</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is
--   <tt>Count</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>StatusCheckFailed_System</tt></b> - Reports whether the
--   instance passed or failed the system status check. This metric can be
--   either 0 (passed) or 1 (failed). This metric data is available in
--   1-minute (60 seconds) granularity.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful
--   statistic is <tt>Sum</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is
--   <tt>Count</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
getInstanceMetricData_metricName :: Lens' GetInstanceMetricData InstanceMetricName

-- | The granularity, in seconds, of the returned data points.
--   
--   The <tt>StatusCheckFailed</tt>, <tt>StatusCheckFailed_Instance</tt>,
--   and <tt>StatusCheckFailed_System</tt> instance metric data is
--   available in 1-minute (60 seconds) granularity. All other instance
--   metric data is available in 5-minute (300 seconds) granularity.
getInstanceMetricData_period :: Lens' GetInstanceMetricData Natural

-- | The start time of the time period.
getInstanceMetricData_startTime :: Lens' GetInstanceMetricData UTCTime

-- | The end time of the time period.
getInstanceMetricData_endTime :: Lens' GetInstanceMetricData UTCTime

-- | The unit for the metric data request. Valid units depend on the metric
--   data being requested. For the valid units to specify with each
--   available metric, see the <tt>metricName</tt> parameter.
getInstanceMetricData_unit :: Lens' GetInstanceMetricData MetricUnit

-- | The statistic for the metric.
--   
--   The following statistics are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Minimum</tt> - The lowest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine low volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Maximum</tt> - The highest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine high volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Sum</tt> - All values submitted for the matching metric added
--   together. You can use this statistic to determine the total volume of
--   a metric.</li>
--   <li><tt>Average</tt> - The value of Sum / SampleCount during the
--   specified period. By comparing this statistic with the Minimum and
--   Maximum values, you can determine the full scope of a metric and how
--   close the average use is to the Minimum and Maximum values. This
--   comparison helps you to know when to increase or decrease your
--   resources.</li>
--   <li><tt>SampleCount</tt> - The count, or number, of data points used
--   for the statistical calculation.</li>
--   </ul>
getInstanceMetricData_statistics :: Lens' GetInstanceMetricData [MetricStatistic]

-- | The name of the metric returned.
getInstanceMetricDataResponse_metricName :: Lens' GetInstanceMetricDataResponse (Maybe InstanceMetricName)

-- | An array of objects that describe the metric data returned.
getInstanceMetricDataResponse_metricData :: Lens' GetInstanceMetricDataResponse (Maybe [MetricDatapoint])

-- | The response's http status code.
getInstanceMetricDataResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetInstanceMetricDataResponse Int

-- | The Availability Zone where you want to create the disk (e.g.,
--   <tt>us-east-2a</tt>). Use the same Availability Zone as the Lightsail
--   instance to which you want to attach the disk.
--   
--   Use the <tt>get regions</tt> operation to list the Availability Zones
--   where Lightsail is currently available.
createDisk_availabilityZone :: Lens' CreateDisk Text

-- | The size of the disk in GB (e.g., <tt>32</tt>).
createDisk_sizeInGb :: Lens' CreateDisk Int

-- | An array of objects that describe the result of the action, such as
--   the status of the request, the timestamp of the request, and the
--   resources affected by the request.
createDiskResponse_operations :: Lens' CreateDiskResponse (Maybe [Operation])

-- | The response's http status code.
createDiskResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateDiskResponse Int

-- | The name of the bucket that the new access key will belong to, and
--   grant access to.
createBucketAccessKey_bucketName :: Lens' CreateBucketAccessKey Text

-- | An object that describes the access key that is created.
createBucketAccessKeyResponse_accessKey :: Lens' CreateBucketAccessKeyResponse (Maybe AccessKey)

-- | An array of objects that describe the result of the action, such as
--   the status of the request, the timestamp of the request, and the
--   resources affected by the request.
createBucketAccessKeyResponse_operations :: Lens' CreateBucketAccessKeyResponse (Maybe [Operation])

-- | The response's http status code.
createBucketAccessKeyResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateBucketAccessKeyResponse Int

-- | The token to advance to the next page of results from your request.
--   
--   To get a page token, perform an initial
--   <tt>GetOperationsForResource</tt> request. If your results are
--   paginated, the response will return a next page token that you can
--   specify as the page token in a subsequent request.
getOperationsForResource_pageToken :: Lens' GetOperationsForResource (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the resource for which you are requesting information.
getOperationsForResource_resourceName :: Lens' GetOperationsForResource Text

-- | (Deprecated) Returns the number of pages of results that remain.
--   
--   In releases prior to June 12, 2017, this parameter returned
--   <tt>null</tt> by the API. It is now deprecated, and the API returns
--   the <tt>next page token</tt> parameter instead.
getOperationsForResourceResponse_nextPageCount :: Lens' GetOperationsForResourceResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The token to advance to the next page of results from your request.
--   
--   A next page token is not returned if there are no more results to
--   display.
--   
--   To get the next page of results, perform another
--   <tt>GetOperationsForResource</tt> request and specify the next page
--   token using the <tt>pageToken</tt> parameter.
getOperationsForResourceResponse_nextPageToken :: Lens' GetOperationsForResourceResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of objects that describe the result of the action, such as
--   the status of the request, the timestamp of the request, and the
--   resources affected by the request.
getOperationsForResourceResponse_operations :: Lens' GetOperationsForResourceResponse (Maybe [Operation])

-- | The response's http status code.
getOperationsForResourceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetOperationsForResourceResponse Int

-- | The tag keys and optional values to add to the resource during create.
--   
--   Use the <tt>TagResource</tt> action to tag a resource after it's
--   created.
createKeyPair_tags :: Lens' CreateKeyPair (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The name for your new key pair.
createKeyPair_keyPairName :: Lens' CreateKeyPair Text

-- | An array of key-value pairs containing information about the new key
--   pair you just created.
createKeyPairResponse_keyPair :: Lens' CreateKeyPairResponse (Maybe KeyPair)

-- | An array of objects that describe the result of the action, such as
--   the status of the request, the timestamp of the request, and the
--   resources affected by the request.
createKeyPairResponse_operation :: Lens' CreateKeyPairResponse (Maybe Operation)

-- | A base64-encoded public key of the <tt>ssh-rsa</tt> type.
createKeyPairResponse_publicKeyBase64 :: Lens' CreateKeyPairResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A base64-encoded RSA private key.
createKeyPairResponse_privateKeyBase64 :: Lens' CreateKeyPairResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
createKeyPairResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateKeyPairResponse Int

-- | The name of the instance (a virtual private server) to start.
startInstance_instanceName :: Lens' StartInstance Text

-- | An array of objects that describe the result of the action, such as
--   the status of the request, the timestamp of the request, and the
--   resources affected by the request.
startInstanceResponse_operations :: Lens' StartInstanceResponse (Maybe [Operation])

-- | The response's http status code.
startInstanceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' StartInstanceResponse Int

-- | The status of the access key.
--   
--   A status of <tt>Active</tt> means that the key is valid, while
--   <tt>Inactive</tt> means it is not.
accessKey_status :: Lens' AccessKey (Maybe StatusType)

-- | The timestamp when the access key was created.
accessKey_createdAt :: Lens' AccessKey (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The secret access key used to sign requests.
--   
--   You should store the secret access key in a safe location. We
--   recommend that you delete the access key if the secret access key is
--   compromised.
accessKey_secretAccessKey :: Lens' AccessKey (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that describes the last time the access key was used.
--   
--   This object does not include data in the response of a
--   CreateBucketAccessKey action. If the access key has not been used, the
--   <tt>region</tt> and <tt>serviceName</tt> values are <tt>N/A</tt>, and
--   the <tt>lastUsedDate</tt> value is null.
accessKey_lastUsed :: Lens' AccessKey (Maybe AccessKeyLastUsed)

-- | The ID of the access key.
accessKey_accessKeyId :: Lens' AccessKey (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when the access key was most recently used.
--   
--   This value is null if the access key has not been used.
accessKeyLastUsed_lastUsedDate :: Lens' AccessKeyLastUsed (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the AWS service with which this access key was most
--   recently used.
--   
--   This value is <tt>N/A</tt> if the access key has not been used.
accessKeyLastUsed_serviceName :: Lens' AccessKeyLastUsed (Maybe Text)

-- | The AWS Region where this access key was most recently used.
--   
--   This value is <tt>N/A</tt> if the access key has not been used.
accessKeyLastUsed_region :: Lens' AccessKeyLastUsed (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the anonymous access to all objects in a bucket.
--   
--   The following options can be specified:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>public</tt> - Sets all objects in the bucket to public
--   (read-only), making them readable by anyone in the world.If the
--   <tt>getObject</tt> value is set to <tt>public</tt>, then all objects
--   in the bucket default to public regardless of the
--   <tt>allowPublicOverrides</tt> value.</li>
--   <li><tt>private</tt> - Sets all objects in the bucket to private,
--   making them readable only by you or anyone you give access to.If the
--   <tt>getObject</tt> value is set to <tt>private</tt>, and the
--   <tt>allowPublicOverrides</tt> value is set to <tt>true</tt>, then all
--   objects in the bucket default to private unless they are configured
--   with a <tt>public-read</tt> ACL. Individual objects with a
--   <tt>public-read</tt> ACL are readable by anyone in the world.</li>
--   </ul>
accessRules_getObject :: Lens' AccessRules (Maybe AccessType)

-- | A Boolean value that indicates whether the access control list (ACL)
--   permissions that are applied to individual objects override the
--   <tt>getObject</tt> option that is currently specified.
--   
--   When this is true, you can use the <a>PutObjectAcl</a> Amazon S3 API
--   action to set individual objects to public (read-only) using the
--   <tt>public-read</tt> ACL, or to private using the <tt>private</tt>
--   ACL.
accessRules_allowPublicOverrides :: Lens' AccessRules (Maybe Bool)

-- | The status of the add-on.
addOn_status :: Lens' AddOn (Maybe Text)

-- | The next daily time an automatic snapshot will be created.
--   
--   The time shown is in <tt>HH:00</tt> format, and in Coordinated
--   Universal Time (UTC).
--   
--   The snapshot is automatically created between the time shown and up to
--   45 minutes after.
addOn_nextSnapshotTimeOfDay :: Lens' AddOn (Maybe Text)

-- | The daily time when an automatic snapshot is created.
--   
--   The time shown is in <tt>HH:00</tt> format, and in Coordinated
--   Universal Time (UTC).
--   
--   The snapshot is automatically created between the time shown and up to
--   45 minutes after.
addOn_snapshotTimeOfDay :: Lens' AddOn (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the add-on.
addOn_name :: Lens' AddOn (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that represents additional parameters when enabling or
--   modifying the automatic snapshot add-on.
addOnRequest_autoSnapshotAddOnRequest :: Lens' AddOnRequest (Maybe AutoSnapshotAddOnRequest)

-- | The add-on type.
addOnRequest_addOnType :: Lens' AddOnRequest AddOnType

-- | The current state of the alarm.
--   
--   An alarm has the following possible states:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALARM</tt> - The metric is outside of the defined
--   threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>INSUFFICIENT_DATA</tt> - The alarm has just started, the
--   metric is not available, or not enough data is available for the
--   metric to determine the alarm state.</li>
--   <li><tt>OK</tt> - The metric is within the defined threshold.</li>
--   </ul>
alarm_state :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe AlarmState)

-- | Specifies how the alarm handles missing data points.
--   
--   An alarm can treat missing data in the following ways:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>breaching</tt> - Assume the missing data is not within the
--   threshold. Missing data counts towards the number of times the metric
--   is not within the threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>notBreaching</tt> - Assume the missing data is within the
--   threshold. Missing data does not count towards the number of times the
--   metric is not within the threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>ignore</tt> - Ignore the missing data. Maintains the current
--   alarm state.</li>
--   <li><tt>missing</tt> - Missing data is treated as missing.</li>
--   </ul>
alarm_treatMissingData :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe TreatMissingData)

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>Alarm</tt>).
alarm_resourceType :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the alarm.
alarm_arn :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when the alarm was created.
alarm_createdAt :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An object that lists information about the location of the alarm.
alarm_location :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | The contact protocols for the alarm, such as <tt>Email</tt>,
--   <tt>SMS</tt> (text messaging), or both.
alarm_contactProtocols :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe [ContactProtocol])

-- | The period, in seconds, over which the statistic is applied.
alarm_period :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe Natural)

-- | The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified
--   threshold.
alarm_evaluationPeriods :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe Int)

-- | The name of the metric associated with the alarm.
alarm_metricName :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe MetricName)

-- | The arithmetic operation used when comparing the specified statistic
--   and threshold.
alarm_comparisonOperator :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe ComparisonOperator)

-- | The name of the alarm.
alarm_name :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe Text)

-- | The value against which the specified statistic is compared.
alarm_threshold :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe Double)

-- | The number of data points that must not within the specified threshold
--   to trigger the alarm.
alarm_datapointsToAlarm :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe Int)

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about your Lightsail alarm. This code enables our
--   support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.
alarm_supportCode :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether the alarm is enabled.
alarm_notificationEnabled :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe Bool)

-- | The alarm states that trigger a notification.
alarm_notificationTriggers :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe [AlarmState])

-- | The statistic for the metric associated with the alarm.
--   
--   The following statistics are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Minimum</tt> - The lowest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine low volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Maximum</tt> - The highest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine high volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Sum</tt> - All values submitted for the matching metric added
--   together. You can use this statistic to determine the total volume of
--   a metric.</li>
--   <li><tt>Average</tt> - The value of Sum / SampleCount during the
--   specified period. By comparing this statistic with the Minimum and
--   Maximum values, you can determine the full scope of a metric and how
--   close the average use is to the Minimum and Maximum values. This
--   comparison helps you to know when to increase or decrease your
--   resources.</li>
--   <li><tt>SampleCount</tt> - The count, or number, of data points used
--   for the statistical calculation.</li>
--   </ul>
alarm_statistic :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe MetricStatistic)

-- | The unit of the metric associated with the alarm.
alarm_unit :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe MetricUnit)

-- | An object that lists information about the resource monitored by the
--   alarm.
alarm_monitoredResourceInfo :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe MonitoredResourceInfo)

-- | The path of the disk (e.g., <tt>/dev/xvdf</tt>).
attachedDisk_path :: Lens' AttachedDisk (Maybe Text)

-- | The size of the disk in GB.
attachedDisk_sizeInGb :: Lens' AttachedDisk (Maybe Int)

-- | The daily time when an automatic snapshot will be created.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be in <tt>HH:00</tt> format, and in an hourly increment.</li>
--   <li>Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>The snapshot will be automatically created between the time
--   specified and up to 45 minutes after.</li>
--   </ul>
autoSnapshotAddOnRequest_snapshotTimeOfDay :: Lens' AutoSnapshotAddOnRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the automatic snapshot.
autoSnapshotDetails_status :: Lens' AutoSnapshotDetails (Maybe AutoSnapshotStatus)

-- | An array of objects that describe the block storage disks attached to
--   the instance when the automatic snapshot was created.
autoSnapshotDetails_fromAttachedDisks :: Lens' AutoSnapshotDetails (Maybe [AttachedDisk])

-- | The timestamp when the automatic snapshot was created.
autoSnapshotDetails_createdAt :: Lens' AutoSnapshotDetails (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date of the automatic snapshot in <tt>YYYY-MM-DD</tt> format.
autoSnapshotDetails_date :: Lens' AutoSnapshotDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The state of the Availability Zone.
availabilityZone_state :: Lens' AvailabilityZone (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the Availability Zone. The format is <tt>us-east-2a</tt>
--   (case-sensitive).
availabilityZone_zoneName :: Lens' AvailabilityZone (Maybe Text)

-- | The version code.
blueprint_versionCode :: Lens' Blueprint (Maybe Text)

-- | The operating system platform (either Linux/Unix-based or Windows
--   Server-based) of the blueprint.
blueprint_platform :: Lens' Blueprint (Maybe InstancePlatform)

-- | The group name of the blueprint (e.g., <tt>amazon-linux</tt>).
blueprint_group :: Lens' Blueprint (Maybe Text)

-- | The minimum bundle power required to run this blueprint. For example,
--   you need a bundle with a power value of 500 or more to create an
--   instance that uses a blueprint with a minimum power value of 500.
--   <tt>0</tt> indicates that the blueprint runs on all instance sizes.
blueprint_minPower :: Lens' Blueprint (Maybe Int)

-- | The product URL to learn more about the image or blueprint.
blueprint_productUrl :: Lens' Blueprint (Maybe Text)

-- | The end-user license agreement URL for the image or blueprint.
blueprint_licenseUrl :: Lens' Blueprint (Maybe Text)

-- | The friendly name of the blueprint (e.g., <tt>Amazon Linux</tt>).
blueprint_name :: Lens' Blueprint (Maybe Text)

-- | The version number of the operating system, application, or stack
--   (e.g., <tt>2016.03.0</tt>).
blueprint_version :: Lens' Blueprint (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID for the virtual private server image (e.g.,
--   <tt>app_wordpress_4_4</tt> or <tt>app_lamp_7_0</tt>).
blueprint_blueprintId :: Lens' Blueprint (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of the blueprint (e.g., <tt>os</tt> or <tt>app</tt>).
blueprint_type :: Lens' Blueprint (Maybe BlueprintType)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the blueprint is active. Inactive
--   blueprints are listed to support customers with existing instances but
--   are not necessarily available for launch of new instances. Blueprints
--   are marked inactive when they become outdated due to operating system
--   updates or new application releases.
blueprint_isActive :: Lens' Blueprint (Maybe Bool)

-- | The description of the blueprint.
blueprint_description :: Lens' Blueprint (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that describes the state of the bucket.
bucket_state :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe BucketState)

-- | Indicates whether object versioning is enabled for the bucket.
--   
--   The following options can be configured:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Enabled</tt> - Object versioning is enabled.</li>
--   <li><tt>Suspended</tt> - Object versioning was previously enabled but
--   is currently suspended. Existing object versions are retained.</li>
--   <li><tt>NeverEnabled</tt> - Object versioning has never been
--   enabled.</li>
--   </ul>
bucket_objectVersioning :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe Text)

-- | The Lightsail resource type of the bucket (for example,
--   <tt>Bucket</tt>).
bucket_resourceType :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket.
bucket_arn :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when the distribution was created.
bucket_createdAt :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Undocumented member.
bucket_location :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | An array of strings that specify the AWS account IDs that have
--   read-only access to the bucket.
bucket_readonlyAccessAccounts :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe [Text])

-- | The URL of the bucket.
bucket_url :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of objects that describe Lightsail instances that have access
--   to the bucket.
--   
--   Use the SetResourceAccessForBucket action to update the instances that
--   have access to a bucket.
bucket_resourcesReceivingAccess :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe [ResourceReceivingAccess])

-- | The ID of the bundle currently applied to the bucket.
--   
--   A bucket bundle specifies the monthly cost, storage space, and data
--   transfer quota for a bucket.
--   
--   Use the UpdateBucketBundle action to change the bundle of a bucket.
bucket_bundleId :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that describes the access rules of the bucket.
bucket_accessRules :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe AccessRules)

-- | Indicates whether the bundle that is currently applied to a bucket can
--   be changed to another bundle.
--   
--   You can update a bucket's bundle only one time within a monthly AWS
--   billing cycle.
--   
--   Use the UpdateBucketBundle action to change a bucket's bundle.
bucket_ableToUpdateBundle :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the bucket.
bucket_name :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe Text)

-- | The support code for a bucket. Include this code in your email to
--   support when you have questions about a Lightsail bucket. This code
--   enables our support team to look up your Lightsail information more
--   easily.
bucket_supportCode :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe Text)

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the bucket. For more information,
--   see <a>Tags in Amazon Lightsail</a> in the <i>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</i>.
bucket_tags :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The storage size of the bundle, in GB.
bucketBundle_storagePerMonthInGb :: Lens' BucketBundle (Maybe Int)

-- | The monthly network transfer quota of the bundle.
bucketBundle_transferPerMonthInGb :: Lens' BucketBundle (Maybe Int)

-- | The ID of the bundle.
bucketBundle_bundleId :: Lens' BucketBundle (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the bundle.
bucketBundle_name :: Lens' BucketBundle (Maybe Text)

-- | The monthly price of the bundle, in US dollars.
bucketBundle_price :: Lens' BucketBundle (Maybe Double)

-- | Indicates whether the bundle is active. Use for a new or existing
--   bucket.
bucketBundle_isActive :: Lens' BucketBundle (Maybe Bool)

-- | The state code of the bucket.
--   
--   The following codes are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>OK</tt> - The bucket is in a running state.</li>
--   <li><tt>Unknown</tt> - Creation of the bucket might have timed-out.
--   You might want to delete the bucket and create a new one.</li>
--   </ul>
bucketState_code :: Lens' BucketState (Maybe Text)

-- | A message that describes the state of the bucket.
bucketState_message :: Lens' BucketState (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of vCPUs included in the bundle (e.g., <tt>2</tt>).
bundle_cpuCount :: Lens' Bundle (Maybe Int)

-- | The data transfer rate per month in GB (e.g., <tt>2000</tt>).
bundle_transferPerMonthInGb :: Lens' Bundle (Maybe Int)

-- | The bundle ID (e.g., <tt>micro_1_0</tt>).
bundle_bundleId :: Lens' Bundle (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon EC2 instance type (e.g., <tt>t2.micro</tt>).
bundle_instanceType :: Lens' Bundle (Maybe Text)

-- | A friendly name for the bundle (e.g., <tt>Micro</tt>).
bundle_name :: Lens' Bundle (Maybe Text)

-- | A numeric value that represents the power of the bundle (e.g.,
--   <tt>500</tt>). You can use the bundle's power value in conjunction
--   with a blueprint's minimum power value to determine whether the
--   blueprint will run on the bundle. For example, you need a bundle with
--   a power value of 500 or more to create an instance that uses a
--   blueprint with a minimum power value of 500.
bundle_power :: Lens' Bundle (Maybe Int)

-- | The size of the SSD (e.g., <tt>30</tt>).
bundle_diskSizeInGb :: Lens' Bundle (Maybe Int)

-- | The operating system platform (Linux/Unix-based or Windows
--   Server-based) that the bundle supports. You can only launch a
--   <tt>WINDOWS</tt> bundle on a blueprint that supports the
--   <tt>WINDOWS</tt> platform. <tt>LINUX_UNIX</tt> blueprints require a
--   <tt>LINUX_UNIX</tt> bundle.
bundle_supportedPlatforms :: Lens' Bundle (Maybe [InstancePlatform])

-- | The price in US dollars (e.g., <tt>5.0</tt>) of the bundle.
bundle_price :: Lens' Bundle (Maybe Double)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the bundle is active.
bundle_isActive :: Lens' Bundle (Maybe Bool)

-- | The amount of RAM in GB (e.g., <tt>2.0</tt>).
bundle_ramSizeInGb :: Lens' Bundle (Maybe Double)

-- | The cache behavior of the distribution.
--   
--   The following cache behaviors can be specified:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>cache</tt></b> - This option is best for static sites. When
--   specified, your distribution caches and serves your entire website as
--   static content. This behavior is ideal for websites with static
--   content that doesn't change depending on who views it, or for websites
--   that don't use cookies, headers, or query strings to personalize
--   content.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>dont-cache</tt></b> - This option is best for sites that
--   serve a mix of static and dynamic content. When specified, your
--   distribution caches and serve only the content that is specified in
--   the distribution's <tt>CacheBehaviorPerPath</tt> parameter. This
--   behavior is ideal for websites or web applications that use cookies,
--   headers, and query strings to personalize content for individual
--   users.</li>
--   </ul>
cacheBehavior_behavior :: Lens' CacheBehavior (Maybe BehaviorEnum)

-- | The path to a directory or file to cached, or not cache. Use an
--   asterisk symbol to specify wildcard directories
--   (<tt>path/to/assets/*</tt>), and file types (<tt>*.html, *jpg,
--   *js</tt>). Directories and file paths are case-sensitive.
--   
--   Examples:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specify the following to cache all files in the document root of
--   an Apache web server running on a Lightsail
--   instance.<pre>var/www/html/</pre></li>
--   <li>Specify the following file to cache only the index page in the
--   document root of an Apache web
--   server.<pre>var/www/html/index.html</pre></li>
--   <li>Specify the following to cache only the .html files in the
--   document root of an Apache web
--   server.<pre>var/www/html/*.html</pre></li>
--   <li>Specify the following to cache only the .jpg, .png, and .gif files
--   in the images sub-directory of the document root of an Apache web
--   server.<pre>var/www/html/images/*.jpg</pre><pre>var/www/html/images/*.png</pre><pre>var/www/html/images/*.gif</pre>Specify
--   the following to cache all files in the images sub-directory of the
--   document root of an Apache web
--   server.<pre>var/www/html/images/</pre></li>
--   </ul>
cacheBehaviorPerPath_path :: Lens' CacheBehaviorPerPath (Maybe Text)

-- | The cache behavior for the specified path.
--   
--   You can specify one of the following per-path cache behaviors:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>cache</tt></b> - This behavior caches the specified
--   path.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>dont-cache</tt></b> - This behavior doesn't cache the
--   specified path.</li>
--   </ul>
cacheBehaviorPerPath_behavior :: Lens' CacheBehaviorPerPath (Maybe BehaviorEnum)

-- | The maximum amount of time that objects stay in the distribution's
--   cache before the distribution forwards another request to the origin
--   to determine whether the object has been updated.
--   
--   The value specified applies only when the origin adds HTTP headers
--   such as <tt>Cache-Control max-age</tt>, <tt>Cache-Control
--   s-maxage</tt>, and <tt>Expires</tt> to objects.
cacheSettings_maximumTTL :: Lens' CacheSettings (Maybe Integer)

-- | The HTTP method responses that are cached by your distribution.
--   
--   You can specify the following options:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>GET,HEAD</tt> - The distribution caches responses to the
--   <tt>GET</tt> and <tt>HEAD</tt> methods.</li>
--   <li><tt>GET,HEAD,OPTIONS</tt> - The distribution caches responses to
--   the <tt>GET</tt>, <tt>HEAD</tt>, and <tt>OPTIONS</tt> methods.</li>
--   </ul>
cacheSettings_cachedHTTPMethods :: Lens' CacheSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that describes the cookies that are forwarded to the origin.
--   Your content is cached based on the cookies that are forwarded.
cacheSettings_forwardedCookies :: Lens' CacheSettings (Maybe CookieObject)

-- | The HTTP methods that are processed and forwarded to the
--   distribution's origin.
--   
--   You can specify the following options:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>GET,HEAD</tt> - The distribution forwards the <tt>GET</tt> and
--   <tt>HEAD</tt> methods.</li>
--   <li><tt>GET,HEAD,OPTIONS</tt> - The distribution forwards the
--   <tt>GET</tt>, <tt>HEAD</tt>, and <tt>OPTIONS</tt> methods.</li>
--   <li><tt>GET,HEAD,OPTIONS,PUT,PATCH,POST,DELETE</tt> - The distribution
--   forwards the <tt>GET</tt>, <tt>HEAD</tt>, <tt>OPTIONS</tt>,
--   <tt>PUT</tt>, <tt>PATCH</tt>, <tt>POST</tt>, and <tt>DELETE</tt>
--   methods.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you specify the third option, you might need to restrict access to
--   your distribution's origin so users can't perform operations that you
--   don't want them to. For example, you might not want users to have
--   permission to delete objects from your origin.
cacheSettings_allowedHTTPMethods :: Lens' CacheSettings (Maybe Text)

-- | The default amount of time that objects stay in the distribution's
--   cache before the distribution forwards another request to the origin
--   to determine whether the content has been updated.
--   
--   The value specified applies only when the origin does not add HTTP
--   headers such as <tt>Cache-Control max-age</tt>, <tt>Cache-Control
--   s-maxage</tt>, and <tt>Expires</tt> to objects.
cacheSettings_defaultTTL :: Lens' CacheSettings (Maybe Integer)

-- | The minimum amount of time that objects stay in the distribution's
--   cache before the distribution forwards another request to the origin
--   to determine whether the object has been updated.
--   
--   A value of <tt>0</tt> must be specified for <tt>minimumTTL</tt> if the
--   distribution is configured to forward all headers to the origin.
cacheSettings_minimumTTL :: Lens' CacheSettings (Maybe Integer)

-- | An object that describes the headers that are forwarded to the origin.
--   Your content is cached based on the headers that are forwarded.
cacheSettings_forwardedHeaders :: Lens' CacheSettings (Maybe HeaderObject)

-- | An object that describes the query strings that are forwarded to the
--   origin. Your content is cached based on the query strings that are
--   forwarded.
cacheSettings_forwardedQueryStrings :: Lens' CacheSettings (Maybe QueryStringObject)

-- | The validation status of the certificate.
certificate_status :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe CertificateStatus)

-- | An array of strings that specify the alternate domains (e.g.,
--   <tt>example2.com</tt>) and subdomains (e.g.,
--   <tt>blog.example.com</tt>) of the certificate.
certificate_subjectAlternativeNames :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe [Text])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the certificate.
certificate_arn :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when the certificate was created.
certificate_createdAt :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The renewal eligibility of the certificate.
certificate_eligibleToRenew :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The validation failure reason, if any, of the certificate.
--   
--   The following failure reasons are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>NO_AVAILABLE_CONTACTS</tt></b> - This failure applies to
--   email validation, which is not available for Lightsail
--   certificates.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>ADDITIONAL_VERIFICATION_REQUIRED</tt></b> - Lightsail
--   requires additional information to process this certificate request.
--   This can happen as a fraud-protection measure, such as when the domain
--   ranks within the Alexa top 1000 websites. To provide the required
--   information, use the <a>AWS Support Center</a> to contact AWS
--   Support.You cannot request a certificate for Amazon-owned domain names
--   such as those ending in amazonaws.com, cloudfront.net, or
--   elasticbeanstalk.com.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>DOMAIN_NOT_ALLOWED</tt></b> - One or more of the domain
--   names in the certificate request was reported as an unsafe domain by
--   <a>VirusTotal</a>. To correct the problem, search for your domain name
--   on the <a>VirusTotal</a> website. If your domain is reported as
--   suspicious, see <a>Google Help for Hacked Websites</a> to learn what
--   you can do.If you believe that the result is a false positive, notify
--   the organization that is reporting the domain. VirusTotal is an
--   aggregate of several antivirus and URL scanners and cannot remove your
--   domain from a block list itself. After you correct the problem and the
--   VirusTotal registry has been updated, request a new certificate.If you
--   see this error and your domain is not included in the VirusTotal list,
--   visit the <a>AWS Support Center</a> and create a case.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>INVALID_PUBLIC_DOMAIN</tt></b> - One or more of the domain
--   names in the certificate request is not valid. Typically, this is
--   because a domain name in the request is not a valid top-level domain.
--   Try to request a certificate again, correcting any spelling errors or
--   typos that were in the failed request, and ensure that all domain
--   names in the request are for valid top-level domains. For example, you
--   cannot request a certificate for <tt>example.invalidpublicdomain</tt>
--   because <tt>invalidpublicdomain</tt> is not a valid top-level
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>OTHER</tt></b> - Typically, this failure occurs when there
--   is a typographical error in one or more of the domain names in the
--   certificate request. Try to request a certificate again, correcting
--   any spelling errors or typos that were in the failed request.</li>
--   </ul>
certificate_requestFailureReason :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when the certificate was revoked. This value is present
--   only when the certificate status is <tt>REVOKED</tt>.
certificate_revokedAt :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The timestamp when the certificate is first valid.
certificate_notBefore :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The reason the certificate was revoked. This value is present only
--   when the certificate status is <tt>REVOKED</tt>.
certificate_revocationReason :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The domain name of the certificate.
certificate_domainName :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the certificate (e.g., <tt>my-certificate</tt>).
certificate_name :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that describes the status of the certificate renewal managed
--   by Lightsail.
certificate_renewalSummary :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe RenewalSummary)

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about your Lightsail certificate. This code enables our
--   support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.
certificate_supportCode :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of objects that describe the domain validation records of the
--   certificate.
certificate_domainValidationRecords :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe [DomainValidationRecord])

-- | The number of Lightsail resources that the certificate is attached to.
certificate_inUseResourceCount :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Int)

-- | The timestamp when the certificate was issued.
certificate_issuedAt :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The algorithm used to generate the key pair (the public and private
--   key) of the certificate.
certificate_keyAlgorithm :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The serial number of the certificate.
certificate_serialNumber :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The certificate authority that issued the certificate.
certificate_issuerCA :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
certificate_tags :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The timestamp when the certificate expires.
certificate_notAfter :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An object that describes a certificate in detail.
certificateSummary_certificateDetail :: Lens' CertificateSummary (Maybe Certificate)

-- | The name of the certificate.
certificateSummary_certificateName :: Lens' CertificateSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the certificate.
certificateSummary_certificateArn :: Lens' CertificateSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The domain name of the certificate.
certificateSummary_domainName :: Lens' CertificateSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
certificateSummary_tags :: Lens' CertificateSummary (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The current state of the CloudFormation stack record.
cloudFormationStackRecord_state :: Lens' CloudFormationStackRecord (Maybe RecordState)

-- | A list of objects describing the destination service, which is AWS
--   CloudFormation, and the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS
--   CloudFormation stack.
cloudFormationStackRecord_destinationInfo :: Lens' CloudFormationStackRecord (Maybe DestinationInfo)

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g.,
--   <tt>CloudFormationStackRecord</tt>).
cloudFormationStackRecord_resourceType :: Lens' CloudFormationStackRecord (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CloudFormation stack record.
cloudFormationStackRecord_arn :: Lens' CloudFormationStackRecord (Maybe Text)

-- | The date when the CloudFormation stack record was created.
cloudFormationStackRecord_createdAt :: Lens' CloudFormationStackRecord (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A list of objects describing the Availability Zone and AWS Region of
--   the CloudFormation stack record.
cloudFormationStackRecord_location :: Lens' CloudFormationStackRecord (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | The name of the CloudFormation stack record. It starts with
--   <tt>CloudFormationStackRecord</tt> followed by a GUID.
cloudFormationStackRecord_name :: Lens' CloudFormationStackRecord (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of objects describing the source of the CloudFormation stack
--   record.
cloudFormationStackRecord_sourceInfo :: Lens' CloudFormationStackRecord (Maybe [CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo])

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>ExportSnapshotRecord</tt>).
cloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo_resourceType :: Lens' CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo (Maybe CloudFormationStackRecordSourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the export snapshot record.
cloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo_arn :: Lens' CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the record.
cloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo_name :: Lens' CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The current status of the contact method.
--   
--   A contact method has the following possible status:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PendingVerification</tt> - The contact method has not yet been
--   verified, and the verification has not yet expired.</li>
--   <li><tt>Valid</tt> - The contact method has been verified.</li>
--   <li><tt>InValid</tt> - An attempt was made to verify the contact
--   method, but the verification has expired.</li>
--   </ul>
contactMethod_status :: Lens' ContactMethod (Maybe ContactMethodStatus)

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>ContactMethod</tt>).
contactMethod_resourceType :: Lens' ContactMethod (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact method.
contactMethod_arn :: Lens' ContactMethod (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when the contact method was created.
contactMethod_createdAt :: Lens' ContactMethod (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Undocumented member.
contactMethod_location :: Lens' ContactMethod (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | The protocol of the contact method, such as email or SMS (text
--   messaging).
contactMethod_protocol :: Lens' ContactMethod (Maybe ContactProtocol)

-- | The name of the contact method.
contactMethod_name :: Lens' ContactMethod (Maybe Text)

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about your Lightsail contact method. This code enables
--   our support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.
contactMethod_supportCode :: Lens' ContactMethod (Maybe Text)

-- | The destination of the contact method, such as an email address or a
--   mobile phone number.
contactMethod_contactEndpoint :: Lens' ContactMethod (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the image used for the container.
--   
--   Container images sourced from your Lightsail container service, that
--   are registered and stored on your service, start with a colon
--   (<tt>:</tt>). For example,
--   <tt>:container-service-1.mystaticwebsite.1</tt>. Container images
--   sourced from a public registry like Docker Hub don't start with a
--   colon. For example, <tt>nginx:latest</tt> or <tt>nginx</tt>.
container_image :: Lens' Container (Maybe Text)

-- | The launch command for the container.
container_command :: Lens' Container (Maybe [Text])

-- | The environment variables of the container.
container_environment :: Lens' Container (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The open firewall ports of the container.
container_ports :: Lens' Container (Maybe (HashMap Text ContainerServiceProtocol))

-- | The name of the container image.
containerImage_image :: Lens' ContainerImage (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when the container image was created.
containerImage_createdAt :: Lens' ContainerImage (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The digest of the container image.
containerImage_digest :: Lens' ContainerImage (Maybe Text)

-- | The current state of the container service.
--   
--   The following container service states are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt> - The container service is being created.</li>
--   <li><tt>READY</tt> - The container service is running but it does not
--   have an active container deployment.</li>
--   <li><tt>DEPLOYING</tt> - The container service is launching a
--   container deployment.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt> - The container service is running and it has an
--   active container deployment.</li>
--   <li><tt>UPDATING</tt> - The container service capacity or its custom
--   domains are being updated.</li>
--   <li><tt>DELETING</tt> - The container service is being deleted.</li>
--   <li><tt>DISABLED</tt> - The container service is disabled, and its
--   active deployment and containers, if any, are shut down.</li>
--   </ul>
containerService_state :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe ContainerServiceState)

-- | The ID of the power of the container service.
containerService_powerId :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe Text)

-- | The Lightsail resource type of the container service (i.e.,
--   <tt>ContainerService</tt>).
containerService_resourceType :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the container service.
containerService_arn :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when the container service was created.
containerService_createdAt :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An object that describes the location of the container service, such
--   as the AWS Region and Availability Zone.
containerService_location :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | The scale specification of the container service.
--   
--   The scale specifies the allocated compute nodes of the container
--   service.
containerService_scale :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe Natural)

-- | The publicly accessible URL of the container service.
--   
--   If no public endpoint is specified in the <tt>currentDeployment</tt>,
--   this URL returns a 404 response.
containerService_url :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that describes the current state of the container service.
--   
--   The state detail is populated only when a container service is in a
--   <tt>PENDING</tt>, <tt>DEPLOYING</tt>, or <tt>UPDATING</tt> state.
containerService_stateDetail :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe ContainerServiceStateDetail)

-- | An object that describes the next deployment of the container service.
--   
--   This value is <tt>null</tt> when there is no deployment in a
--   <tt>pending</tt> state.
containerService_nextDeployment :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe ContainerServiceDeployment)

-- | The principal ARN of the container service.
--   
--   The principal ARN can be used to create a trust relationship between
--   your standard AWS account and your Lightsail container service. This
--   allows you to give your service permission to access resources in your
--   standard AWS account.
containerService_principalArn :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe Text)

-- | The power specification of the container service.
--   
--   The power specifies the amount of RAM, the number of vCPUs, and the
--   base price of the container service.
containerService_power :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe ContainerServicePowerName)

-- | The private domain name of the container service.
--   
--   The private domain name is accessible only by other resources within
--   the default virtual private cloud (VPC) of your Lightsail account.
containerService_privateDomainName :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe Text)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the container service is disabled.
containerService_isDisabled :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe Bool)

-- | The public domain name of the container service, such as
--   <tt>example.com</tt> and <tt>www.example.com</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify up to four public domain names for a container
--   service. The domain names that you specify are used when you create a
--   deployment with a container configured as the public endpoint of your
--   container service.
--   
--   If you don't specify public domain names, then you can use the default
--   domain of the container service.
--   
--   You must create and validate an SSL/TLS certificate before you can use
--   public domain names with your container service. Use the
--   <tt>CreateCertificate</tt> action to create a certificate for the
--   public domain names you want to use with your container service.
--   
--   See <tt>CreateContainerService</tt> or <tt>UpdateContainerService</tt>
--   for information about how to specify public domain names for your
--   Lightsail container service.
containerService_publicDomainNames :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | The name of the container service.
containerService_containerServiceName :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that describes the current container deployment of the
--   container service.
containerService_currentDeployment :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe ContainerServiceDeployment)

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
containerService_tags :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The state of the deployment.
--   
--   A deployment can be in one of the following states:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Activating</tt> - The deployment is being created.</li>
--   <li><tt>Active</tt> - The deployment was successfully created, and
--   it's currently running on the container service. The container service
--   can have only one deployment in an active state at a time.</li>
--   <li><tt>Inactive</tt> - The deployment was previously successfully
--   created, but it is not currently running on the container
--   service.</li>
--   <li><tt>Failed</tt> - The deployment failed. Use the
--   <tt>GetContainerLog</tt> action to view the log events for the
--   containers in the deployment to try to determine the reason for the
--   failure.</li>
--   </ul>
containerServiceDeployment_state :: Lens' ContainerServiceDeployment (Maybe ContainerServiceDeploymentState)

-- | An object that describes the endpoint of the deployment.
containerServiceDeployment_publicEndpoint :: Lens' ContainerServiceDeployment (Maybe ContainerServiceEndpoint)

-- | The timestamp when the deployment was created.
containerServiceDeployment_createdAt :: Lens' ContainerServiceDeployment (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An object that describes the configuration for the containers of the
--   deployment.
containerServiceDeployment_containers :: Lens' ContainerServiceDeployment (Maybe (HashMap Text Container))

-- | The version number of the deployment.
containerServiceDeployment_version :: Lens' ContainerServiceDeployment (Maybe Int)

-- | An object that describes the endpoint of the deployment.
containerServiceDeploymentRequest_publicEndpoint :: Lens' ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest (Maybe EndpointRequest)

-- | An object that describes the configuration for the containers of the
--   deployment.
containerServiceDeploymentRequest_containers :: Lens' ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text Container))

-- | An object that describes the health check configuration of the
--   container.
containerServiceEndpoint_healthCheck :: Lens' ContainerServiceEndpoint (Maybe ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig)

-- | The name of the container entry of the deployment that the endpoint
--   configuration applies to.
containerServiceEndpoint_containerName :: Lens' ContainerServiceEndpoint (Maybe Text)

-- | The port of the specified container to which traffic is forwarded to.
containerServiceEndpoint_containerPort :: Lens' ContainerServiceEndpoint (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of consecutive health checks successes required before
--   moving the container to the <tt>Healthy</tt> state. The default value
--   is <tt>2</tt>.
containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_healthyThreshold :: Lens' ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig (Maybe Int)

-- | The path on the container on which to perform the health check. The
--   default value is <tt>/</tt>.
containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_path :: Lens' ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The HTTP codes to use when checking for a successful response from a
--   container. You can specify values between <tt>200</tt> and
--   <tt>499</tt>. You can specify multiple values (for example,
--   <tt>200,202</tt>) or a range of values (for example,
--   <tt>200-299</tt>).
containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_successCodes :: Lens' ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The approximate interval, in seconds, between health checks of an
--   individual container. You can specify between 5 and 300 seconds. The
--   default value is <tt>5</tt>.
containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_intervalSeconds :: Lens' ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig (Maybe Int)

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, during which no response means a
--   failed health check. You can specify between 2 and 60 seconds. The
--   default value is <tt>2</tt>.
containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_timeoutSeconds :: Lens' ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of consecutive health check failures required before moving
--   the container to the <tt>Unhealthy</tt> state. The default value is
--   <tt>2</tt>.
containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_unhealthyThreshold :: Lens' ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig (Maybe Int)

-- | The timestamp when the container service log event was created.
containerServiceLogEvent_createdAt :: Lens' ContainerServiceLogEvent (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The message of the container service log event.
containerServiceLogEvent_message :: Lens' ContainerServiceLogEvent (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the power (e.g., <tt>nano-1</tt>).
containerServicePower_powerId :: Lens' ContainerServicePower (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of vCPUs included in the power.
containerServicePower_cpuCount :: Lens' ContainerServicePower (Maybe Double)

-- | The friendly name of the power (e.g., <tt>nano</tt>).
containerServicePower_name :: Lens' ContainerServicePower (Maybe Text)

-- | The monthly price of the power in USD.
containerServicePower_price :: Lens' ContainerServicePower (Maybe Double)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the power is active and can be
--   specified for container services.
containerServicePower_isActive :: Lens' ContainerServicePower (Maybe Bool)

-- | The amount of RAM (in GB) of the power.
containerServicePower_ramSizeInGb :: Lens' ContainerServicePower (Maybe Double)

-- | The timestamp of when the container image registry username and
--   password expire.
--   
--   The log in credentials expire 12 hours after they are created, at
--   which point you will need to create a new set of log in credentials
--   using the <tt>CreateContainerServiceRegistryLogin</tt> action.
containerServiceRegistryLogin_expiresAt :: Lens' ContainerServiceRegistryLogin (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The container service registry username to use to push container
--   images to the container image registry of a Lightsail account.
containerServiceRegistryLogin_username :: Lens' ContainerServiceRegistryLogin (Maybe Text)

-- | The container service registry password to use to push container
--   images to the container image registry of a Lightsail account
containerServiceRegistryLogin_password :: Lens' ContainerServiceRegistryLogin (Maybe Text)

-- | The address to use to push container images to the container image
--   registry of a Lightsail account.
containerServiceRegistryLogin_registry :: Lens' ContainerServiceRegistryLogin (Maybe Text)

-- | The state code of the container service.
--   
--   The following state codes are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The following state codes are possible if your container service
--   is in a <tt>DEPLOYING</tt> or <tt>UPDATING</tt>
--   state:<ul><li><tt>CREATING_SYSTEM_RESOURCES</tt> - The system
--   resources for your container service are being
--   created.</li><li><tt>CREATING_NETWORK_INFRASTRUCTURE</tt> - The
--   network infrastructure for your container service are being
--   created.</li><li><tt>PROVISIONING_CERTIFICATE</tt> - The SSL/TLS
--   certificate for your container service is being
--   created.</li><li><tt>PROVISIONING_SERVICE</tt> - Your container
--   service is being provisioned.</li><li><tt>CREATING_DEPLOYMENT</tt> -
--   Your deployment is being created on your container
--   service.</li><li><tt>EVALUATING_HEALTH_CHECK</tt> - The health of your
--   deployment is being evaluated.</li><li><tt>ACTIVATING_DEPLOYMENT</tt>
--   - Your deployment is being activated.</li></ul></li>
--   <li>The following state codes are possible if your container service
--   is in a <tt>PENDING</tt>
--   state:<ul><li><tt>CERTIFICATE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED</tt> - The SSL/TLS
--   certificate required for your container service exceeds the maximum
--   number of certificates allowed for your
--   account.</li><li><tt>UNKNOWN_ERROR</tt> - An error was experienced
--   when your container service was being created.</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
containerServiceStateDetail_code :: Lens' ContainerServiceStateDetail (Maybe ContainerServiceStateDetailCode)

-- | A message that provides more information for the state code.
--   
--   The state detail is populated only when a container service is in a
--   <tt>PENDING</tt>, <tt>DEPLOYING</tt>, or <tt>UPDATING</tt> state.
containerServiceStateDetail_message :: Lens' ContainerServiceStateDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The specific cookies to forward to your distribution's origin.
cookieObject_cookiesAllowList :: Lens' CookieObject (Maybe [Text])

-- | Specifies which cookies to forward to the distribution's origin for a
--   cache behavior: <tt>all</tt>, <tt>none</tt>, or <tt>allow-list</tt> to
--   forward only the cookies specified in the <tt>cookiesAllowList</tt>
--   parameter.
cookieObject_option :: Lens' CookieObject (Maybe ForwardValues)

-- | The destination service of the record.
destinationInfo_service :: Lens' DestinationInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the resource created at the destination.
destinationInfo_id :: Lens' DestinationInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes the status of the disk.
disk_state :: Lens' Disk (Maybe DiskState)

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>Disk</tt>).
disk_resourceType :: Lens' Disk (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the disk.
disk_arn :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Text)

-- | The disk path.
disk_path :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Text)

-- | The date when the disk was created.
disk_createdAt :: Lens' Disk (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The AWS Region and Availability Zone where the disk is located.
disk_location :: Lens' Disk (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | The input/output operations per second (IOPS) of the disk.
disk_iops :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Int)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the disk is attached.
disk_isAttached :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Bool)

-- | An array of objects representing the add-ons enabled on the disk.
disk_addOns :: Lens' Disk (Maybe [AddOn])

-- | (Deprecated) The attachment state of the disk.
--   
--   In releases prior to November 14, 2017, this parameter returned
--   <tt>attached</tt> for system disks in the API response. It is now
--   deprecated, but still included in the response. Use
--   <tt>isAttached</tt> instead.
disk_attachmentState :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique name of the disk.
disk_name :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Text)

-- | The size of the disk in GB.
disk_sizeInGb :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Int)

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.
--   This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail
--   information more easily.
disk_supportCode :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Text)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether this disk is a system disk (has an
--   operating system loaded on it).
disk_isSystemDisk :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Bool)

-- | The resources to which the disk is attached.
disk_attachedTo :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Text)

-- | (Deprecated) The number of GB in use by the disk.
--   
--   In releases prior to November 14, 2017, this parameter was not
--   included in the API response. It is now deprecated.
disk_gbInUse :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Int)

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
disk_tags :: Lens' Disk (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The disk path.
diskInfo_path :: Lens' DiskInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The disk name.
diskInfo_name :: Lens' DiskInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The size of the disk in GB (e.g., <tt>32</tt>).
diskInfo_sizeInGb :: Lens' DiskInfo (Maybe Int)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether this disk is a system disk (has an
--   operating system loaded on it).
diskInfo_isSystemDisk :: Lens' DiskInfo (Maybe Bool)

-- | The new disk name (e.g., <tt>my-new-disk</tt>).
diskMap_newDiskName :: Lens' DiskMap (Maybe Text)

-- | The original disk path exposed to the instance (for example,
--   <tt>/dev/sdh</tt>).
diskMap_originalDiskPath :: Lens' DiskMap (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique name of the source disk from which the disk snapshot was
--   created.
diskSnapshot_fromDiskName :: Lens' DiskSnapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the snapshot was created from an
--   automatic snapshot.
diskSnapshot_isFromAutoSnapshot :: Lens' DiskSnapshot (Maybe Bool)

-- | The status of the disk snapshot operation.
diskSnapshot_state :: Lens' DiskSnapshot (Maybe DiskSnapshotState)

diskSnapshot_resourceType :: Lens' DiskSnapshot (Maybe ResourceType)

--   created.
diskSnapshot_location :: Lens' DiskSnapshot (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | The progress of the snapshot.
diskSnapshot_progress :: Lens' DiskSnapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the disk snapshot (e.g., <tt>my-disk-snapshot</tt>).
diskSnapshot_name :: Lens' DiskSnapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The size of the disk in GB.
diskSnapshot_sizeInGb :: Lens' DiskSnapshot (Maybe Int)

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.
--   This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail
--   information more easily.
diskSnapshot_supportCode :: Lens' DiskSnapshot (Maybe Text)

--   disk (system volume) snapshot was created.
diskSnapshot_fromInstanceArn :: Lens' DiskSnapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique name of the source instance from which the disk (system
--   volume) snapshot was created.
diskSnapshot_fromInstanceName :: Lens' DiskSnapshot (Maybe Text)

--   snapshot was created.
diskSnapshot_fromDiskArn :: Lens' DiskSnapshot (Maybe Text)

--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
diskSnapshot_tags :: Lens' DiskSnapshot (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The size of the disk in GB (e.g., <tt>32</tt>).
diskSnapshotInfo_sizeInGb :: Lens' DiskSnapshotInfo (Maybe Int)

distributionBundle_price :: Lens' DistributionBundle (Maybe Double)

-- | Indicates whether the bundle is active, and can be specified for a new
--   or existing distribution.
distributionBundle_isActive :: Lens' DistributionBundle (Maybe Bool)

domain_resourceType :: Lens' Domain (Maybe ResourceType)

--   created.

--   have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.

--   information more easily.

--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
domain_tags :: Lens' Domain (Maybe [Tag])

-- | When <tt>true</tt>, specifies whether the domain entry is an alias
--   used by the Lightsail load balancer. You can include an alias (A type)
--   record in your request, which points to a load balancer DNS name and
--   routes traffic to your load balancer.
domainEntry_isAlias :: Lens' DomainEntry (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the domain.
domainEntry_name :: Lens' DomainEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the domain recordset entry.
domainEntry_id :: Lens' DomainEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | (Deprecated) The options for the domain entry.
--   
--   In releases prior to November 29, 2017, this parameter was not
--   included in the API response. It is now deprecated.
domainEntry_options :: Lens' DomainEntry (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The type of domain entry, such as address for IPv4 (A), address for
--   IPv6 (AAAA), canonical name (CNAME), mail exchanger (MX), name server
--   (NS), start of authority (SOA), service locator (SRV), or text (TXT).
--   
--   The following domain entry types can be used:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>A</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>AAAA</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>CNAME</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>MX</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NS</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SOA</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SRV</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TXT</pre></li>
--   </ul>
domainEntry_type :: Lens' DomainEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The target IP address (e.g., <tt>192.0.2.0</tt>), or AWS name server
--   (e.g., <tt>ns-111.awsdns-22.com.</tt>).
--   
--   For Lightsail load balancers, the value looks like
--   <tt>ab1234c56789c6b86aba6fb203d443bc-123456789.us-east-2.elb.amazonaws.com</tt>.
--   For Lightsail distributions, the value looks like
--   <tt>exampled1182ne.cloudfront.net</tt>. For Lightsail container
--   services, the value looks like
--   <tt>container-service-1.example23scljs.us-west-2.cs.amazonlightsail.com</tt>.
--   Be sure to also set <tt>isAlias</tt> to <tt>true</tt> when setting up
--   an A record for a Lightsail load balancer, distribution, or container
--   service.
domainEntry_target :: Lens' DomainEntry (Maybe Text)

--   to validate it for the certificate.

-- | The domain name of the certificate validation record. For example,
--   <tt>example.com</tt> or <tt>www.example.com</tt>.
domainValidationRecord_domainName :: Lens' DomainValidationRecord (Maybe Text)

-- | The specific headers to forward to your distribution's origin.
headerObject_headersAllowList :: Lens' HeaderObject (Maybe [HeaderEnum])

-- | The headers that you want your distribution to forward to your origin
--   and base caching on.
--   
--   You can configure your distribution to do one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>all</tt></b> - Forward all headers to your origin.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>none</tt></b> - Forward only the default headers.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>allow-list</tt></b> - Forward only the headers you specify
--   using the <tt>headersAllowList</tt> parameter.</li>
--   </ul>
headerObject_option :: Lens' HeaderObject (Maybe ForwardValues)

-- | The returned RDP certificate is not valid after this point in time.
--   
--   This value is listed only for RDP certificates.
hostKeyAttributes_notValidAfter :: Lens' HostKeyAttributes (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The returned RDP certificate is valid after this point in time.
--   
--   This value is listed only for RDP certificates.
hostKeyAttributes_notValidBefore :: Lens' HostKeyAttributes (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The SHA-1 fingerprint of the returned SSH host key or RDP certificate.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-1 SSH
--   fingerprint:<pre>SHA1:1CHH6FaAaXjtFOsR/t83vf91SR0</pre></li>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-1 RDP
--   fingerprint:<pre>af:34:51:fe:09:f0:e0:da:b8:4e:56:ca:60:c2:10:ff:38:06:db:45</pre></li>
--   </ul>
hostKeyAttributes_fingerprintSHA1 :: Lens' HostKeyAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The public SSH host key or the RDP certificate.
hostKeyAttributes_publicKey :: Lens' HostKeyAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The SSH host key algorithm or the RDP certificate format.
--   
--   For SSH host keys, the algorithm may be <tt>ssh-rsa</tt>,
--   <tt>ecdsa-sha2-nistp256</tt>, <tt>ssh-ed25519</tt>, etc. For RDP
--   certificates, the algorithm is always <tt>x509-cert</tt>.
hostKeyAttributes_algorithm :: Lens' HostKeyAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The time that the SSH host key or RDP certificate was recorded by
--   Lightsail.
hostKeyAttributes_witnessedAt :: Lens' HostKeyAttributes (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The SHA-256 fingerprint of the returned SSH host key or RDP
--   certificate.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-256 SSH
--   fingerprint:<pre>SHA256:KTsMnRBh1IhD17HpdfsbzeGA4jOijm5tyXsMjKVbB8o</pre></li>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-256 RDP
--   fingerprint:<pre>03:9b:36:9f:4b:de:4e:61:70:fc:7c:c9:78:e7:d2:1a:1c:25:a8:0c:91:f6:7c:e4:d6:a0:85:c8:b4:53:99:68</pre></li>
--   </ul>
hostKeyAttributes_fingerprintSHA256 :: Lens' HostKeyAttributes (Maybe Text)

inputOrigin_regionName :: Lens' InputOrigin (Maybe RegionName)

-- | The name of the origin resource.
inputOrigin_name :: Lens' InputOrigin (Maybe Text)

-- | The protocol that your Amazon Lightsail distribution uses when
--   establishing a connection with your origin to pull content.
inputOrigin_protocolPolicy :: Lens' InputOrigin (Maybe OriginProtocolPolicyEnum)

--   <tt>1479734909.17</tt>) in Unix time format.

--   <tt>LightsailDefaultKeyPair</tt>).

--   <tt>ec2-user</tt>).
instance_username :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

--   the instance.
instance_networking :: Lens' Instance (Maybe InstanceNetworking)

--   <tt>Amazon_Linux-1GB-Ohio-1</tt>).
instance_name :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The IP address type of the instance.
--   
--   The possible values are <tt>ipv4</tt> for IPv4 only, and
--   <tt>dualstack</tt> for IPv4 and IPv6.
instance_ipAddressType :: Lens' Instance (Maybe IpAddressType)

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.
--   This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail
--   information more easily.
instance_supportCode :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The blueprint ID (e.g., <tt>os_amlinux_2016_03</tt>).
instance_blueprintId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The private IP address of the instance.
instance_privateIpAddress :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The friendly name of the blueprint (e.g., <tt>Amazon Linux</tt>).
instance_blueprintName :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether this instance has a static IP
--   assigned to it.
instance_isStaticIp :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Bool)

-- | The public IP address of the instance.
instance_publicIpAddress :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

instance_hardware :: Lens' Instance (Maybe InstanceHardware)

instance_ipv6Addresses :: Lens' Instance (Maybe [Text])
